CPC60220.name: Manage business risk
CPC60220.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to manage risks in a business context. It includes establishing the risk context, identifying risks, analysing and evaluating risks, and developing and implementing appropriate risk treatment plans. The unit applies to individuals who are required to manage risks across various areas within an organisation or for a specific business unit or project.

CPC60220.name: Contribute to developing, implementing and maintaining an organisation's WHS management system
CPC60220.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to contribute to the development, implementation, and maintenance of a work health and safety (WHS) management system. It involves assisting with the integration of WHS policies and procedures into an organisation's overall management system, ensuring compliance with legislative requirements, and contributing to continuous improvement processes.

CPC60220.name: Apply building codes and standards to the construction process for large building projects
CPC60220.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to access, interpret, and apply relevant building codes and standards to the construction processes of large, complex building projects. It involves ensuring compliance with the National Construction Code (NCC) and other relevant Australian standards throughout the planning and construction phases.

CPC60220.name: Establish, maintain and review contract administration procedures and frameworks
CPC60220.desc: This unit involves establishing, maintaining, and reviewing contract administration procedures and frameworks for building and construction projects. It includes developing contract administration processes, monitoring contract performance, and implementing improvements to ensure contractual obligations are met efficiently and effectively.

CPC60220.name: Develop, plan and implement building and construction environmental management processes
CPC60220.desc: This unit covers the development, planning, and implementation of environmental management processes in building and construction projects. It involves identifying environmental requirements, developing management plans to address these requirements, and overseeing the implementation and monitoring of environmental management practices to minimise the environmental impact of construction activities.

CPC60220.name: Develop, plan and implement a building and construction planning process
CPC60220.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to develop, plan, and implement a comprehensive planning process for building and construction projects. It encompasses establishing a construction planning system that ensures accurate and successful project outcomes, aligning with organisational guidelines and relevant legislation, codes, and standards. The unit is applicable to large organisations managing residential and/or commercial projects of significant size and complexity.

CPC60220.name: Establish systems to develop and monitor building and construction costs
CPC60220.desc: This unit covers the establishment of systems to develop and monitor costs associated with building and construction projects. It includes implementing procedures to accurately forecast, control, and report on project costs, ensuring financial management aligns with project objectives and organisational requirements. The unit applies to senior managers responsible for overseeing financial aspects of large construction projects.

CPC60220.name: Manage and administer development of documentation for building and construction projects
CPC60220.desc: This unit involves managing and administering the development of documentation essential for building and construction projects. It includes overseeing the preparation of detailed project documents such as contracts, plans, specifications, and reports, ensuring they meet project requirements, regulatory standards, and organisational policies. The unit is relevant to professionals responsible for coordinating documentation processes in large construction projects.

CPC60220.name: Manage processes for complying with legal obligations of a building and construction contractor
CPC60220.desc: This unit addresses the management of processes to ensure compliance with legal obligations pertinent to building and construction contractors. It encompasses identifying and interpreting relevant legislation, implementing compliance procedures, and monitoring adherence to legal requirements throughout project execution. The unit is crucial for contractors aiming to fulfil their legal responsibilities within the construction industry.

CPC60220.name: Develop workplace policies and procedures for sustainability
CPC60220.desc: This unit focuses on developing workplace policies and procedures that promote sustainability. It involves identifying environmental regulations and best practices, formulating policies that encourage sustainable operations, and implementing procedures to reduce environmental impact. The unit is applicable to managers and professionals tasked with integrating sustainability into workplace practices.

CPC10120.name: Prepare to work safely in the construction industry
CPC10120.desc: This is a fundamental requirement for individuals entering construction sites in Australia. It encompasses the skills and knowledge necessary to identify and address common hazards, understand basic risk control measures, and adhere to workplace health and safety (WHS) legislative requirements. Successful completion of this unit is mandatory for obtaining the White Card, which authorises individuals to work on construction sites nationwide.

CPC10120.name: Apply WHS requirements, policies and procedures in the construction industry
CPC10120.desc: This unit focuses on equipping construction workers with the essential skills and knowledge to implement work health and safety (WHS) practices effectively across various construction settings. This unit covers identifying and assessing risks, recognising hazardous materials (including asbestos), planning and executing safe work practices, and responding appropriately to emergencies. It is a fundamental component for those aiming to perform tasks safely within the construction industry and is also a prerequisite for individuals assessing the 'White Card' unit of competency, CPCCWHS1001.

CPC10120.name: Carry out measurements and calculations
CPC10120.desc: This unit equips individuals with the essential skills to perform basic measurements and calculations within a construction environment. This includes selecting appropriate measuring equipment, obtaining accurate linear measurements, and applying fundamental mathematical concepts such as area, volume, perimeter, and ratios to determine material quantities. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction tasks are executed with precision, contributing to overall project accuracy and efficiency.

CPC10120.name: Handle construction materials
CPC10120.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to safely manage and store common construction materials. This includes manual handling techniques, preparation for mechanical handling, and adherence to environmental management principles. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction materials are handled efficiently and safely, minimising risks and maintaining workplace safety standards.

CPC10120.name: Assemble components
CPC10120.desc: This unit focuses on developing the skills and knowledge required to assemble various construction components, particularly in joinery and related fields. This unit covers interpreting plans and specifications, selecting appropriate materials and tools, and assembling components accurately to meet quality standards. It is commonly included as an elective in qualifications such as the Certificate II in Construction Pathways and the Certificate III in Joinery, providing foundational skills for those pursuing a career in the construction industry.

CPC10120.name: Undertake basic estimation and costing
CPC10120.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to prepare basic estimates of materials, labour, and costs for construction projects. This includes reviewing plans and specifications, creating material lists, obtaining unit costs from suppliers, estimating quantities, calculating costs, and documenting the total cost of tasks. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction tasks are planned and executed with accurate budgeting, contributing to effective project management and resource allocation.

CPC10120.name: Use construction tools and equipment
CPC10120.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely select, operate, and maintain a variety of construction tools and equipment. This encompasses hand tools, power tools, and pneumatic tools commonly utilised in the construction industry. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction tasks are performed efficiently and safely, adhering to workplace health and safety (WHS) standards and manufacturers' specifications.

CPC10120.name: Work effectively and sustainably in the construction industry
CPC10120.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to operate efficiently and sustainably within the construction sector. This includes understanding team roles and responsibilities, effective communication, planning and organising work tasks, and adhering to environmental and resource efficiency requirements. Proficiency in this unit ensures that individuals can contribute positively to team objectives, pursue relevant career pathways, and implement sustainable practices in construction projects.

CPC10120.name: Plan and organise work
CPC10120.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to effectively plan and organise basic work tasks on a construction site. This includes determining task requirements, breaking down tasks into component activities, estimating time and resources, and collaborating with team members to schedule work and allocate responsibilities. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction tasks are executed efficiently, safely, and in accordance with workplace standards.

CPC10120.name: Undertake a basic construction project
CPC10120.desc: This unit equips individuals with the foundational skills and knowledge necessary to plan, execute, and complete a simple construction project. This encompasses interpreting project plans and specifications, selecting and preparing materials, operating hand tools and equipment safely, and adhering to workplace health and safety (WHS) requirements. Proficiency in this unit ensures that individuals can effectively contribute to basic construction tasks, laying the groundwork for more advanced construction activities.

CPC10120.name: Undertake a basic computer design project
CPC10120.desc: This unit equips individuals with the foundational skills to utilise computer-aided design (CAD) software for creating simple construction-related drawings. This involves interpreting design briefs, developing basic digital drawings, and adhering to industry standards and protocols. Proficiency in this unit enables individuals to effectively produce digital representations of construction projects, enhancing accuracy and communication within the construction industry.

CPC33020.name: Work safely at heights
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the essential skills and knowledge to perform tasks safely at heights in various construction settings. It encompasses identifying work requirements, assessing risks, implementing safety measures, and using appropriate equipment to ensure personal and site safety. This unit is fundamental for construction workers who need to operate at heights, ensuring compliance with safety regulations and promoting a secure working environment.

CPC33020.name: Lay multi-thickness walls and piers
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to construct masonry walls of varying thicknesses and to lay both engaged and isolated piers. This includes proficiency in different brick bonding techniques, such as English and Flemish bonds, and the ability to interpret construction plans and specifications. The unit is essential for bricklayers and blocklayers working on new or existing structures, ensuring they can execute complex masonry tasks with precision and in compliance with Australian building standards.

CPC33020.name: Lay masonry walls and corners
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to construct masonry walls and corners for various building types and styles. This includes planning, preparation, setting out, and installation of masonry, ensuring adherence to Australian building standards and codes. The unit is essential for bricklayers and blocklayers working on new or existing structures, enabling them to execute masonry tasks with precision and compliance.

CPC33020.name: Carry out measurements and calculations
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the essential skills and knowledge to perform basic measurements and calculations in a construction environment. This includes selecting appropriate equipment, obtaining accurate linear measurements, and applying fundamental mathematical formulas to determine material quantities. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction tasks are executed with precision, contributing to overall project accuracy and efficiency.

CPC33020.name: Construct masonry structural systems
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to build masonry load-bearing walls and engaged piers. This involves tasks such as setting out and marking masonry walls, laying blocks to specified heights, installing horizontal reinforcing, and securing roof tie-downs and bracing. Proficiency in this unit ensures that bricklayers and blocklayers can construct structural masonry elements that comply with Australian building standards and codes, contributing to the integrity and safety of various construction projects.

CPC33020.name: Carry out setting out
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to accurately identify site boundaries and survey indicators, and to establish, measure, and set up profiled set-outs for buildings and structural components in construction projects. This includes tasks such as setting out pads, posts, slabs, strips, and stumps, and installing string lines to profile the footings of a building and associated structures on a site. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction professionals can execute precise site layouts in compliance with the National Construction Code (NCC), Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and relevant legislation, thereby contributing to the structural integrity and accuracy of building projects.

CPC33020.name: Carry out basic demolition
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely remove components from single-storey buildings and structures using basic demolition techniques. This includes planning and preparing for demolition, setting up safety equipment, executing the removal of building components, and properly checking and storing tools and equipment. Proficiency in this unit ensures that workers can perform demolition tasks in compliance with Australian Standards and workplace safety regulations, contributing to the safe and efficient execution of demolition activities.

CPC33020.name: Read and interpret plans and specifications
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the essential skills and knowledge to accurately comprehend construction plans and specifications at a basic level. This includes understanding different types of construction drawings, recognising symbols and abbreviations, and identifying key features and project requirements from these documents. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction workers can effectively interpret project documentation, facilitating accurate execution of construction tasks in compliance with Australian building standards and codes.

CPC33020.name: Install fire-rated masonry construction
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to construct fire-resistant masonry structures. This includes tasks such as laying fire-resistant bricks and blocks, installing fire-rated steel door jambs, fire-proofing service penetrations, and fitting fire-rated insulation between masonry walls and roof coverings. Proficiency in this unit ensures that bricklayers and blocklayers can effectively contribute to the fire safety of buildings, adhering to the fire control and separation requirements specified in the National Construction Code (NCC) and other relevant legislation.

CPC33020.name: Construct masonry steps and stairs
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to calculate and construct masonry steps, stairs, and wing walls using various masonry products. This unit applies to bricklayers and blocklayers who set out and construct steps and stairs on new or existing structures, operating with some autonomy. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction professionals can accurately plan, prepare, and execute the installation of masonry steps and stairs, adhering to Australian building standards and codes.

CPC33020.name: Carry out cavity brick construction
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to construct cavity brick buildings and structures. This includes tasks such as installing moisture barriers, ventilation systems, and roof tie-downs to ensure structural integrity and compliance with Australian building standards. Proficiency in this unit ensures that bricklayers and blocklayers can effectively execute cavity brick construction projects, adhering to safety regulations and quality requirements.

CPC33020.name: Construct masonry arches
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to construct various types of masonry arches within walls and above columns or attached piers. This includes tasks such as setting out and constructing different arch types, preparing voussoirs (wedge-shaped stones or bricks), and fitting arch templates. Proficiency in this unit ensures that bricklayers and blocklayers can accurately and safely build masonry arches, adhering to Australian building standards and codes.

CPC33020.name: Conduct workplace communication
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to communicate effectively in a construction workplace environment. This includes gathering, conveying, and receiving information through verbal and written forms, participating in simple meeting processes, and interpreting work instructions and safety signage. Proficiency in this unit ensures that workers can interact efficiently with colleagues and stakeholders, contributing to the smooth operation of construction activities and adherence to safety protocols.

CPC33020.name: Install flashings and damp proof course
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to install various materials for flashings and damp proofing in masonry construction. This includes installing vertical and head flashings to windows and doors, as well as stepped and tray flashings to parapets, to prevent moisture penetration and ensure structural integrity. Proficiency in this unit ensures that bricklayers and blocklayers can effectively implement moisture control measures, adhering to Australian building standards and codes.

CPC33020.name: Carry out masonry veneer construction
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to construct masonry veneer buildings and structures. This includes tasks such as installing damp proof courses, wall ties, flashings, and ventilation systems to ensure structural integrity and compliance with Australian building standards. Proficiency in this unit ensures that bricklayers and blocklayers can effectively execute masonry veneer construction projects, adhering to safety regulations and quality requirements.

CPC33020.name: Use bricklaying and blocklaying tools and equipment
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely and effectively utilise tools and equipment specific to bricklaying and blocklaying tasks. This includes understanding the functional features and operational requirements of both hand and power tools, as well as plant and equipment used in masonry work. Proficiency in this unit ensures that workers can perform bricklaying and blocklaying tasks efficiently, adhering to safety protocols and contributing to the quality of construction projects.

CPC33020.name: Plan and organise work
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to effectively plan and organise basic work tasks on a construction site. This includes determining task requirements, breaking down tasks into components, estimating time and resources, and coordinating with team members to ensure efficient workflow. Proficiency in this unit ensures that workers can execute construction activities methodically, adhering to safety protocols and contributing to project efficiency.

CPC33020.name: Apply basic levelling procedures
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to carry out levelling in a single plane to establish correct and accurate set-out of building components. This includes the set-up, testing, and use of levelling devices, as well as establishing and transferring heights using a range of levelling equipment. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction workers can perform levelling tasks accurately, contributing to the structural integrity and precision of building projects.

CPC33020.name: Carry out concreting to simple forms
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely install formwork, reinforcement, and place and finish concrete for minor slabs, pathways, and other simple structures. This includes tasks such as preparing the substrate, erecting formwork, placing and tying reinforcement, and applying appropriate finishing techniques to achieve the specified design finish. Proficiency in this unit ensures that workers can execute basic concreting tasks in compliance with the National Construction Code (NCC), Australian Standards, and work health and safety (WHS) regulations, contributing to the quality and safety of construction projects.

CPC33020.name: Lay paving
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to prepare, set out, and install paving for various applications. This includes tasks such as preparing the base and bedding, selecting and laying pavers in designated patterns, and ensuring proper alignment and level. Proficiency in this unit ensures that workers can execute paving projects effectively, adhering to Australian building standards and safety regulations.

CPC33020.name: Apply WHS requirements, policies and procedures in the construction industry
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to implement work health and safety (WHS) requirements through safe work practices in both on-site and off-site construction environments. This includes identifying and assessing risks, recognising hazardous materials such as asbestos, planning and preparing for safe work practices, applying these practices effectively, and following emergency procedures. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction workers can perform their tasks safely, adhering to legislative requirements and workplace policies, thereby contributing to a safer work environment.

CPC33020.name: Construct curved walls
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to construct masonry curved walls. This includes using geometry to calculate and set out curves, and constructing both standard curved walls and serpentine (S-shaped) walls. Proficiency in this unit ensures that bricklayers and blocklayers can accurately and safely build curved masonry structures, adhering to Australian building standards and codes.

CPC33020.name: Handle and prepare bricklaying and blocklaying materials
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely handle, sort, and prepare materials for bricklaying and blocklaying tasks. This includes manual and mechanical handling techniques, proper storage methods, and the preparation of mortar mixes to specified ratios. Proficiency in this unit ensures that workers can efficiently manage materials on-site, contributing to the quality and safety of masonry construction projects.

CPC33020.name: Work effectively and sustainably in the construction industry
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to operate efficiently and sustainably within the construction sector. This includes participating in team planning, understanding roles and responsibilities, identifying pathways to become a tradesperson or skilled operator, and adhering to environmental and resource efficiency requirements. Proficiency in this unit ensures that workers can contribute positively to team objectives, pursue career development, and implement sustainable practices in compliance with industry standards.

CPC33020.name: Place and fix reinforcement materials
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to place and secure reinforcement for concrete work as part of construction processes. This includes planning and preparing for the task, executing final preparations for placement, accurately positioning and securing reinforcement materials such as deformed bars, rods, and mesh sheets, verifying the reinforcement setup, and completing clean-up activities. Proficiency in this unit ensures that concreters can effectively contribute to the structural integrity of construction projects, adhering to Australian building standards and safety regulations.

CPC33020.name: Erect and dismantle restricted height scaffolding
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely assemble and disassemble modular scaffolding systems up to a height of 4 metres. This includes tasks such as planning and preparing for scaffolding work, placing safety barriers, erecting scaffolding in accordance with regulations and manufacturer specifications, inspecting and repairing scaffolding components, and dismantling the scaffolding after use. Proficiency in this unit ensures that workers can provide secure work platforms for various construction tasks, adhering to Australian safety standards and contributing to efficient site operations.

CPC33020.name: Operate elevated work platforms up to 11 metres
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely and effectively operate specific types of elevated work platforms (EWPs) in various locations, including uneven terrain. This encompasses tasks such as locating, setting up, operating, and shutting down scissor lifts and self-propelled boom lifts with a boom length under 11 metres. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction workers can handle electrical, hydraulic, and mechanical EWPs competently, adhering to Australian safety standards and contributing to efficient site operations.

CPC33020.name: Carry out general demolition of minor building structures
CPC33020.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely demolish minor building structures to facilitate alterations, extensions, and additions in residential and commercial sites. This includes planning and preparing for demolition tasks, assessing structures to determine the scope of work, managing risks, complying with safety and environmental requirements, and handling materials appropriately. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction workers can execute demolition activities efficiently, adhering to Australian building standards and safety regulations.

MSF30322.name: Match furnishing style and materials to customer requirements
MSF30322.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to align furniture styles and materials with clients' needs and preferences. This involves understanding various furnishing styles, materials, and production techniques, as well as effectively communicating and negotiating with customers to ensure their requirements are met. The unit is essential for professionals in the furnishing industry who aim to provide customised solutions that satisfy customer expectations.

MSF30322.name: Join solid timber
MSF30322.desc: This unit focuses on developing the skills and knowledge required to join timber to create solid flat surfaces. This includes accurately measuring, marking, and cutting timbers, applying various edge joining methods such as butt and dowel, moulded edge joints, biscuit joints, and slip-tongue joints, and ensuring the final product meets quality standards. The unit is essential for individuals in the cabinet and furniture making industries, enabling them to produce high-quality solid timber products by following established procedures and utilising appropriate tools and adhesives.

MSF30322.name: Research and organise product inspection and testing
MSF30322.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to effectively plan and coordinate the inspection and testing of furnishing products. This involves researching appropriate inspection and testing methods, organising the necessary resources, and ensuring that products meet quality and compliance standards. The unit is essential for professionals in the furnishing industry who are responsible for maintaining product quality and adhering to industry regulations.

MSF30322.name: Make measurements and calculations
MSF30322.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to accurately identify appropriate measuring equipment, perform precise measurements, and carry out relevant calculations in furnishing tasks. This includes selecting suitable tools, applying correct measurement techniques, estimating material quantities, and recording results accurately. The unit is essential for professionals in the furnishing industry to ensure precision and quality in their work.

MSF30322.name: Communicate in the workplace
MSF30322.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to effectively receive, relay, and record both written and oral messages within a work environment. This includes accurately recording messages, seeking clarification when necessary, accessing required information, relaying information to appropriate personnel, and completing workplace documentation within designated timelines. The unit is applicable across various work environments and is essential for ensuring clear and accurate communication in the workplace.

MSF30322.name: Participate in environmentally sustainable work practices
MSF30322.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to comply with environmental regulations, identify environmental issues, and minimise negative impacts within their work area. This includes recognising workplace environmental and resource efficiency concerns, understanding resource usage in one's role, adhering to environmental policies and procedures, and seeking opportunities to enhance environmental practices and resource efficiency. The unit is applicable across various sectors of the manufacturing industry and its value chain, including office and warehouse settings, and is essential for promoting sustainable work practices.

MSF30322.name: Design, construct and test jigs
MSF30322.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to design, build, and evaluate jigs used in the production of furniture or similar items. This involves understanding the principles of jig design, selecting appropriate materials, constructing the jig to specifications, and testing it to ensure it meets production requirements. The unit is essential for professionals in the furnishing industry who aim to enhance production efficiency and maintain quality standards through the effective use of jigs.

MSF30322.name: Use furniture finishing hand and power tools
MSF30322.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to select and use appropriate hand and power tools for furniture finishing tasks. This includes understanding the functions and safe operation of various tools, performing routine maintenance, and applying techniques to achieve desired finishes on furniture pieces. The unit is essential for professionals in the furniture finishing industry, enabling them to complete tasks efficiently and maintain high-quality workmanship.

MSF30322.name: Prepare surfaces for finishing
MSF30322.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to prepare a range of furniture surfaces for the application of surface coatings by hand or machine. This includes tasks such as identifying and setting up required materials, tools, and equipment; preparing surfaces in accordance with workplace procedures and specifications; rectifying surface faults; and ensuring surfaces are suitable for further processing. The unit is essential for professionals in the furniture finishing industry, enabling them to complete routine tasks effectively and maintain high-quality workmanship.

MSF30322.name: Deliver and monitor a service to customers
MSF30322.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to identify customer needs, deliver and monitor customer service, and identify improvements in service provision. This includes establishing rapport with customers, managing complaints, and promoting services and products effectively. The unit applies to those who apply a broad range of competencies in various work contexts, exercising discretion and judgement using appropriate knowledge of customer service. They provide technical advice and support to customers over short or long-term interactions.

MSF30322.name: Hand make timber joints
MSF30322.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to craft timber joints using hand and portable power tools. This includes tasks such as selecting appropriate materials, accurately marking out cutting and joining lines, and assembling joints to meet specified quality standards. The unit is essential for professionals in the furniture and cabinet making industries, enabling them to produce precise and durable timber joints that contribute to the overall quality of the finished product.

MSF30322.name: Manufacture components for doors, windows and frames
MSF30322.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to machine and assemble components for door and window frames, sashes, and panelled doors. This includes tasks such as setting out component materials, operating machinery safely, and adhering to the National Construction Code (NCC), Australian Standards, and work health and safety (WHS) regulations. The unit is essential for professionals in the construction industry, particularly those specialising in carpentry and joinery, enabling them to produce precise and compliant components for building projects.

MSF30322.name: Estimate and cost job
MSF30322.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to accurately estimate the net cost of providing products and services, calculate mark-up and tax, and develop comprehensive customer quotations. This involves obtaining detailed job information, assessing material and labour costs, and ensuring all calculations comply with organisational procedures and industry standards. The unit is applicable across various industries involving the manufacture and/or installation of products or delivery of services, enabling professionals to provide precise and competitive pricing to clients.

MSF30322.name: Read and interpret work documents
MSF30322.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to identify, comprehend, and apply information from various work-related documents. This includes understanding Australian Standards, building codes, job procedures, manufacturer technical instructions, safety data sheets (SDS), and work plans. Proficiency in this unit enables workers to accurately interpret documentation, plan tasks effectively, and maintain proper documentation procedures, ensuring compliance with industry standards and workplace requirements.

MSF30322.name: Install cabinetry
MSF30322.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to install custom-made or mass-manufactured cabinetry, along with associated fixtures and fittings. This includes conducting pre-installation checks, identifying site constraints, executing the installation process, and performing quality assessments of the completed work. Proficiency in this unit enables professionals to ensure cabinetry installations are completed accurately, safely, and in compliance with design specifications and industry standards.

MSF30322.name: Produce angled and curved components using manufactured board
MSF30322.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to produce and assemble components with angled and curved constructions using manufactured board materials. This includes techniques such as kerfing, machine curving, laminated curving, and skinning curved sub-frames for curved components, as well as creating bevel joins and flat panel angled components. Proficiency in this unit enables professionals in the furnishing and cabinet-making industries to craft complex designs, such as curved counters, desks, and cabinetry, ensuring high-quality workmanship and adherence to design specifications.

MSF30322.name: Work in a team
MSF30322.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to organise their activities within a team to align with work schedules and meet operational guidelines. This includes identifying team and individual tasks, prioritising activities as directed, breaking work into manageable components, and utilising effective communication and interpersonal skills to ensure cohesive teamwork. Proficiency in this unit enables individuals to contribute effectively within various work environments, ensuring that team objectives are achieved efficiently and harmoniously.

MSF30322.name: Select timbers for furniture production
MSF30322.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to determine timber requirements and evaluate the suitability of different timbers against those requirements. This involves assessing various timber properties, such as density, hardness, elasticity, and compatibility with other materials, to ensure they meet specified client or production needs. Proficiency in this unit enables professionals in the furniture production industry to make informed decisions when selecting timbers, ensuring the quality and suitability of the final product.

MSF30322.name: Produce manual and computer-aided production drawings
MSF30322.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to create detailed production drawings that support the manufacture and assembly of furniture and cabinetry. This includes producing both manual and computer-aided drawings, utilising orthographic projections and section views, and adhering to Australian Standard AS1100 drawing conventions. Proficiency in this unit enables professionals to accurately represent design specifications, facilitating effective communication and precise fabrication in the furnishing industry.

MSF30322.name: Use furniture making hand and power tools
MSF30322.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to select and safely operate hand and power tools for common furniture making tasks, such as cutting, joining, planing, and sanding wood and other materials. This includes understanding tool safety, performing basic tool sharpening, and conducting routine maintenance to ensure tools remain functional and safe for use. Proficiency in this unit enables workers to complete routine tasks in industries such as cabinet and furniture making and wood machining, adhering to workplace procedures and manufacturer specifications.

MSF30322.name: Prepare and apply decorative surfaces for furnishing products
MSF30322.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to prepare, construct, and apply decorative surfaces, such as veneers and inlays, to furnishing products. This includes tasks such as selecting appropriate materials, preparing surfaces, constructing decorative elements, and applying them to achieve the desired aesthetic effect. Proficiency in this unit enables professionals in the furnishing industry to enhance the visual appeal and quality of furniture pieces through the application of decorative surface techniques.

MSF30322.name: Produce angled and curved components using solid timber
MSF30322.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to produce and assemble solid timber components using angled and curved construction methods. This includes techniques such as kerfing, machine curving, laminated curving, and creating bevel joins and flat panel angled components. Proficiency in this unit enables professionals in the furnishing and cabinet-making industries to craft complex designs, such as curved counters, desks, seating, cabinetry, and end panels, ensuring high-quality workmanship and adherence to design specifications.

MSF30322.name: Prepare cutting lists from design and production documentation
MSF30322.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to interpret various types of design and production documentation to prepare cutting lists and other information for subsequent processing operations in industries such as cabinet and furniture making and wood machining. This involves accurately extracting dimensions, materials, and quantities from design plans to create detailed cutting lists that guide the manufacturing process. Proficiency in this unit ensures that components are produced efficiently and accurately, minimising material waste and adhering to design specifications. The unit is essential for professionals in the furnishing industry who are responsible for translating design documentation into actionable production plans.

MSF30322.name: Operate basic static machines safely
MSF30322.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely operate basic stationary machinery used in industries such as wood machining and cabinet and furniture making. This includes tasks such as setting up machines, conducting pre-start checks, operating machines within their designed capacity, and adhering to safety requirements, including the correct positioning of hands and body, use of machine guards, and understanding the importance of grain direction in solid timber. Proficiency in this unit enables workers to perform basic operations on machines like band saws, crosscut saws, panel saws, rip saws, edge banders, hinge borers, thicknessers, jointers, and wide belt sanders, ensuring tasks are completed efficiently and safely in accordance with workplace procedures and manufacturer specifications.

MSF30322.name: Prepare to work safely in the construction industry
MSF30322.desc: This unit is a mandatory training requirement for individuals seeking to undertake construction work in Australia. It imparts essential knowledge of work health and safety (WHS) legislative requirements, enabling individuals to work safely and prevent injury or harm to themselves and others. Key components of the training include identifying and reporting common construction hazards, understanding basic risk control measures, responding to potential incidents and emergencies, and correctly selecting and fitting personal protective equipment (PPE) used in construction work. Successful completion of this unit is a prerequisite for obtaining the 'White Card,' which is compulsory for all construction workers in Australia.

CPC30220.name: Use carpentry tools and equipment
CPC30220.desc: This unit focuses on equipping learners with the skills and knowledge necessary to safely and effectively select, use, and maintain a variety of carpentry tools and equipment. This includes understanding the functions of different tools, adhering to safety protocols, and performing routine maintenance to ensure tools remain in good working condition. Proficiency in this unit is essential for those pursuing a career in carpentry, as it lays the foundation for competent and safe tool handling in various carpentry tasks.

CPC30220.name: Handle carpentry materials
CPC30220.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely manually handle, sort, stack, and store carpentry materials in compliance with work health and safety (WHS) and environmental regulations. It also encompasses preparing materials for mechanical handling and applying environmental management principles associated with carpentry materials. This unit is suitable for those with basic skills and knowledge undertaking routine work tasks under the direction of more experienced workers.

CPC30220.name: Carry out general demolition of minor building structures
CPC30220.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely and effectively demolish minor building structures to facilitate alterations, extensions, and additions in residential and commercial sites. This includes planning and preparing for demolition tasks, assessing structures to determine the scope of work, managing risks, complying with work health and safety (WHS) and environmental requirements, and handling materials appropriately for disposal or salvage. The unit is designed for construction workers, such as carpenters and concreters, working as part of a team to complete demolition tasks according to schedules, plans, and specifications.

CPC30220.name: Carry out setting out
CPC30220.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to identify site boundaries and survey indicators, and to establish, measure, and set up profiled set-outs for buildings and structural components. This includes tasks such as setting out pads, posts, slabs, strips, and stumps, and installing string lines to profile the footings of a building and associated structures on a site. The unit ensures compliance with the National Construction Code (NCC), Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and relevant legislation.

CPC30220.name: Install flooring systems
CPC30220.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to plan, prepare, set out, and install timber and steel flooring systems that support internal and external walls in residential buildings. This includes installing flooring in areas such as bedrooms, living rooms, kitchens, bathrooms, balconies, and decks. The unit emphasizes compliance with the National Construction Code (NCC), Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and other relevant legislation. Key competencies include setting out and installing support structures, bearers, and floor joists, fitting and fixing trimmers and blocks, and installing various flooring materials.

CPC30220.name: Construct and erect wall frames
CPC30220.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to plan, prepare, set out, construct, and erect both load-bearing and non-load-bearing wall frames using timber and steel. This includes tasks such as setting out wall locations, cutting and assembling components like studs, plates, lintels, and bracing, and erecting frames in compliance with the National Construction Code (NCC), Australian Standards, and work health and safety (WHS) regulations. Proficiency in this unit is essential for those pursuing a career in carpentry or joinery, as it ensures the ability to construct wall frames that meet structural and safety requirements.

CPC30220.name: Construct ceiling frames
CPC30220.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to plan, prepare, set out, construct, and erect timber ceiling frames. This includes accommodating various components such as ceiling joists, hanging beams, strutting beams, and combined hanging/strutting beams. The unit emphasizes adherence to the National Construction Code (NCC), Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and relevant legislation. Key competencies involve selecting appropriate materials, accurately setting out ceiling frames in conjunction with roof members, and ensuring compliance with structural and safety requirements.

CPC30220.name: Erect roof trusses
CPC30220.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to select, set out, erect, and brace timber and steel roof trusses in preparation for installing waterproof roof coverings. This includes interpreting work instructions, planning sequences, managing materials, and ensuring compliance with the National Construction Code (NCC), Australian Standards, National Association of Steel-framed Housing (NASH) Standards, and work health and safety (WHS) regulations. Key competencies involve setting out truss locations, safely lifting and handling materials, erecting and plumbing trusses in sequence, installing bracing and lateral restraints, and ensuring all work meets structural and safety requirements.

CPC30220.name: Construct pitched roofs
CPC30220.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to set out, construct, and erect pitched roofs to accommodate roof coverings for weatherproofing purposes. This includes determining the necessary materials and processes, and constructing various roof structures such as scotch valley gable and broken hip and valley roofs. The unit emphasizes adherence to the National Construction Code (NCC), Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and relevant legislation.

CPC30220.name: Construct eaves
CPC30220.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to plan, prepare, set out, and construct eaves in both new and existing structures. This includes tasks such as selecting appropriate materials, measuring and cutting components, and assembling eaves to ensure proper ventilation and weatherproofing. The unit emphasizes adherence to the National Construction Code (NCC), Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and relevant legislation. Proficiency in this unit is essential for those pursuing a career in carpentry, as it ensures the ability to construct eaves that meet structural and aesthetic requirements.

CPC30220.name: Install windows and doors
CPC30220.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to plan, prepare, and install window and door units in compliance with the National Construction Code (NCC), Australian Standards, and work health and safety (WHS) regulations. This includes tasks such as selecting appropriate materials, accurately setting out openings, installing frames and fittings, and ensuring proper sealing and alignment to achieve weatherproofing and security standards. Proficiency in this unit is essential for those pursuing a career in carpentry or construction, as it ensures the ability to install windows and doors that meet structural and safety requirements.

CPC30220.name: Construct, assemble and install timber external stairs
CPC30220.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to build and install timber external stairs with one or more flights, providing access to buildings or structures. This includes tasks such as setting out stair components, cutting and assembling stringers and treads, and fitting handrails and balustrades. The unit emphasizes adherence to the National Construction Code (NCC), Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and relevant legislation. Proficiency in this unit is essential for those pursuing a career in carpentry or construction, as it ensures the ability to construct safe and compliant external stair structures.

CPC30220.name: Install exterior cladding
CPC30220.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to apply material finishes to external framed wall surfaces for weatherproofing and securing buildings. This includes the application of both sheet and linear style claddings in a range of materials, ensuring compliance with the National Construction Code (NCC), Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and relevant legislation. Key competencies involve preparing exterior wall frames, installing thermal and moisture management systems, setting out and fixing various types of cladding, and adhering to manufacturers' installation instructions.

CPC30220.name: Install lining, panelling and moulding
CPC30220.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to prepare, set out, and install lining and panelling to masonry and timber and/or metal-framed walls. This includes the installation of mouldings to provide decorative finishes, ensuring compliance with the National Construction Code (NCC), Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and relevant legislation. Key competencies involve selecting appropriate materials, preparing surfaces, accurately setting out and installing linings and panelling, and fitting various mouldings such as architraves and skirtings to achieve a high-quality finish.

CPC30220.name: Read and interpret plans, specifications and drawings for carpentry work
CPC30220.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to accurately interpret construction documents to plan and sequence carpentry tasks. This includes understanding construction plans, cross-sectional plans, dimensions, notes, illustrations, project specifications, site plans, elevations, floor plans, sections, and structural details. The unit emphasizes adherence to the National Construction Code (NCC), Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and relevant legislation. Proficiency in this unit is essential for carpentry professionals to ensure that construction work aligns with specified requirements and industry standards.

CPC30220.name: Erect and dismantle formwork for footings and slabs on ground
CPC30220.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to construct and disassemble formwork for concrete footings and ground-level slabs. This process involves establishing site levels, selecting appropriate materials such as timber, metal, or reconstituted products, and assembling formwork to contain poured concrete until it cures. Additionally, the unit covers the safe dismantling, cleaning, and storage of formwork components for future use. All tasks must comply with the National Construction Code (NCC), Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and relevant legislation.

CPC30220.name: Apply basic levelling procedures
CPC30220.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to carry out levelling in a single plane to establish correct and accurate set-out of building components. This includes setting up, testing, and using levelling devices, as well as establishing and transferring heights using a range of levelling equipment. The unit supports workers in the construction industry who use various common methods and equipment when working with others and as part of a team. It applies to levelling work on residential and commercial work sites.

CPC30220.name: Erect and dismantle restricted height scaffolding
CPC30220.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely assemble and disassemble modular scaffolding systems up to a height of 4 metres. This includes tasks such as planning and preparing for scaffolding work, placing safety barriers, erecting scaffolding in accordance with regulations and manufacturer specifications, inspecting and repairing scaffolding components, and dismantling the scaffolding safely. The unit emphasises adherence to the National Construction Code (NCC), Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and relevant legislation. Proficiency in this unit is essential for workers in various industries who need to provide safe work platforms for occupational applications.

CPC30220.name: Work safely at heights
CPC30220.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to perform tasks on construction sites where there is a risk of falling from one level to another. This includes identifying task requirements, selecting and inspecting personal protective equipment (PPE), installing fall protection systems, and safely accessing and traversing work areas at height. The unit emphasises adherence to the National Construction Code (NCC), Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and relevant legislation. Proficiency in this unit is essential for construction workers to ensure safety when working at heights.

CPC30220.name: Carry out concreting to simple forms
CPC30220.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely install formwork, reinforcement, and place and finish concrete for minor slabs, pathways, and other minor works to a specified design finish. This includes tasks such as preparing the substrate, erecting simple formwork, placing and tying reinforcement, placing concrete, screeding to the alignment of formwork, finishing the concrete surface, and safely dismantling formwork. The unit emphasises adherence to the National Construction Code (NCC), Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and relevant legislation. Proficiency in this unit is essential for those pursuing a career in construction, as it ensures the ability to perform basic concreting tasks that meet structural and safety requirements.

CPC30220.name: Work effectively and sustainably in the construction industry
CPC30220.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the essential skills and knowledge to operate efficiently and sustainably within the construction sector. Key competencies include effective teamwork, understanding roles and responsibilities, planning and executing tasks, and adhering to environmental and resource efficiency requirements. The unit also covers identifying pathways to become a tradesperson or skilled operator, recognising existing skills, and determining additional skills needed for career advancement. This unit is suitable for individuals with basic skills undertaking routine tasks under supervision.

CPC30220.name: Conduct workplace communication
CPC30220.desc: This unit focuses on developing the skills and knowledge necessary for effective communication within a construction workplace. It encompasses gathering, conveying, and receiving information through both verbal and written forms, ensuring clarity and understanding among team members. Key competencies include active listening, effective questioning, preparing and presenting basic reports, and participating in simple meeting processes. This unit is designed for individuals with basic skills undertaking routine tasks under the direction of more experienced workers.

CPC30220.name: Carry out measurements and calculations
CPC30220.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to perform basic measurements and calculations essential for determining task and material requirements in a construction environment. Key competencies include selecting appropriate measurement equipment, accurately obtaining linear measurements, applying basic mathematical formulas to calculate quantities such as weight, area, volume, perimeter, and converting measurements between units. This unit is designed for individuals performing routine tasks under supervision.

CPC30220.name: Perform construction calculations to determine carpentry material requirements
CPC30220.desc: This unit focuses on developing the skills and knowledge necessary to accurately calculate material quantities for construction projects. Key competencies include interpreting construction drawings and specifications, calculating areas and volumes of various materials, and determining the precise quantities of materials required for tasks such as wall and roof framing, internal linings, flooring, external cladding, and roofing. This unit is designed for individuals performing routine tasks under supervision.

CPC30220.name: Carry out levelling operations
CPC30220.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to perform accurate levelling tasks essential for setting out buildings and components in construction projects. Key competencies include setting up, testing, and using levelling devices; applying the rise and fall and height of collimation methods; undertaking closed and open traverses with various levelling equipment; and calculating distances using stadia lines. This unit emphasises adherence to the National Construction Code (NCC), Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and relevant legislation. It is designed for individuals performing levelling operations on residential and commercial work sites in new construction, renovation, refurbishment, and maintenance projects.

CPC30220.name: Apply WHS requirements, policies and procedures in the construction industry
CPC30220.desc: This unit equips individuals with the essential skills and knowledge to implement work health and safety (WHS) practices in construction settings. Key competencies include identifying and assessing risks, recognising hazardous materials (such as asbestos), planning and applying safe work practices, and following emergency procedures. This unit is fundamental for workers across all construction sectors, ensuring adherence to legislated safety practices and contributing to a safer work environment.

CPC30220.name: Identify construction work hazards and select risk control strategies
CPC30220.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to effectively identify hazards and implement appropriate risk control measures on construction sites. Key competencies include planning and preparing for hazard identification, conducting thorough inspections to detect potential risks, and developing job safety analyses (JSAs) and safe work method statements (SWMSs) in compliance with work health and safety (WHS) legislation. This unit is essential for construction workers involved in ensuring safety on residential and commercial work sites, encompassing new constructions, renovations, refurbishments, and maintenance projects.

CPC30220.name: Frame and fit wet area fixtures
CPC30220.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge required to install supporting frameworks for fixtures and flashings in wet areas such as bathrooms, laundries, showers, toilets, and en suites. This includes preparing for the installation of baths, shower bases, sinks, or basin units, and ensuring proper fitting and flashing to meet regulatory standards. The unit emphasises safety, accurate measurement, material selection, and compliance with environmental requirements.

CPC30220.name: Construct and install bulkheads
CPC30220.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge required to construct bulkheads for decorative purposes, to contain fittings such as range hoods and cupboards, to conceal services, and to facilitate changes in ceiling heights. This includes preparing for sheeting bulkheads with materials like plasterboard, lining boards, reconstituted timber products, and metal or plastic decorative panels. The unit covers the installation of bulkheads that may be hung from, incorporated into, or fastened onto a structure in situ. It emphasises compliance with the National Construction Code (NCC), Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and environmental requirements.

CPC30220.name: Carry out hand excavation
CPC30220.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to perform hand excavation tasks for forming excavations for footings and the provision of services. This unit is suitable for individuals with basic skills and knowledge undertaking routine work tasks under the supervision of more experienced workers. It emphasises safety, accurate measurement, and compliance with environmental requirements.

CPC30220.name: Operate elevated work platforms up to 11 metres
CPC30220.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge required to safely and effectively operate specific types of elevated work platforms (EWPs) in various locations, including uneven terrain. It encompasses tasks such as locating, setting up, operating, and shutting down scissor lifts and self-propelled boom lifts with a boom length under 11 metres. This unit is applicable to construction work on residential and commercial sites, including new constructions, renovations, refurbishments, and maintenance projects. It emphasises adherence to safety protocols, accurate operation, and compliance with relevant regulations.

CPC30220.name: Construct tilt panels on site
CPC30220.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge required to work in a team to set up, pour, and place concrete tilt panels to form internal and external walls for building structures on residential, commercial, or civil construction sites. It encompasses both on-site and prefabricated methods of panel construction, including tasks such as planning and preparation, setting out and constructing temporary casting beds, preparing formwork, placing reinforcement and cast-in fittings, and finishing and curing concrete. The unit emphasises adherence to work health and safety (WHS) requirements, environmental considerations, and compliance with relevant legislation, regulations, and codes of practice.

CPC30220.name: Place and fix reinforcement materials
CPC30220.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge required to place and secure reinforcement for concrete work within construction processes. This includes planning and preparing for the task, performing final preparations for placement, accurately positioning and fixing reinforcement materials such as deformed bars, rods, and mesh sheets, verifying the reinforcement setup prior to concrete pouring, and completing subsequent clean-up activities. The unit emphasises adherence to work health and safety (WHS) requirements, environmental considerations, and compliance with relevant legislation, regulations, and codes of practice.

CPC30220.name: Plan and organise work
CPC30220.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge required to effectively plan and organise basic individual and group work tasks on a construction site. This includes determining task requirements, breaking down tasks into component activities, estimating time and resources, and preparing a comprehensive work plan. The unit emphasises collaboration with team members to review plans, schedule work, allocate roles and responsibilities, and ensure compliance with work health and safety (WHS) requirements. It is suitable for individuals with basic skills and knowledge undertaking routine tasks under the direction of more experienced workers.

RII30820.name: Plan and organise work
RII30820.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to effectively plan and organise one's own work activities in a mining or extractive context. It includes identifying and interpreting work requirements, planning and preparing for work, and completing work in accordance with the plan. Competence in this unit ensures that individuals can manage their tasks efficiently, contributing to safe and productive operations within the resources and infrastructure industries.

RII30820.name: Carry out measurements and calculations
RII30820.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to perform accurate measurements and calculations within the resources and infrastructure sectors. Key competencies include planning and preparing for measurement tasks, executing precise measurements, performing relevant calculations, and estimating quantities required for various work activities. Proficiency in this unit ensures that workers can effectively determine material requirements, assess project dimensions, and contribute to the overall efficiency and accuracy of operations in their respective fields.

RII30820.name: Identify, locate and protect underground services
RII30820.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to identify, locate, and protect underground services in civil construction settings. Key competencies include preparing to identify and locate underground services, using appropriate tools and equipment to detect these services, implementing protective measures to safeguard them during construction activities, and conducting necessary housekeeping activities post-identification. Proficiency in this unit ensures that workers can effectively manage underground utilities, thereby preventing damage, ensuring safety, and maintaining the integrity of essential services during construction operations.

RII30820.name: Communicate in the workplace
RII30820.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to effectively communicate within the workplace, particularly in the resources and infrastructure sectors. Key competencies include planning and preparing for workplace communication using various equipment and systems, utilising communication tools appropriately, engaging in face-to-face routine communication, and completing written documentation accurately. Proficiency in this unit ensures that workers can convey and interpret information clearly and efficiently, thereby enhancing collaboration, safety, and productivity in their work environment.

RII30820.name: Apply risk management processes
RII30820.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to apply risk management processes in the mining, drilling, and civil infrastructure industries. Key competencies include planning and preparing for risk management, identifying and assessing risks, implementing appropriate risk treatment measures, and reviewing the effectiveness of these measures. Proficiency in this unit ensures that workers can systematically identify potential hazards, evaluate risks, and implement control measures to maintain a safe and compliant work environment.

RII30820.name: Handle resources and infrastructure materials and safely dispose of nontoxic materials
RII30820.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to handle various materials used in resources and infrastructure projects and to safely dispose of non-toxic waste. Key competencies include planning and preparing for material handling tasks, complying with safety data sheets and regulatory requirements, identifying hazardous materials for separate handling, applying dust suppression procedures, and conducting housekeeping activities such as clearing work areas and maintaining equipment. Proficiency in this unit ensures that workers can manage materials efficiently and adhere to environmental and safety standards, contributing to the overall effectiveness and compliance of operations within the resources and infrastructure sectors.

RII30820.name: Use hand and power tools
RII30820.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely and effectively use hand and power tools in the resources and infrastructure industries. Key competencies include planning and preparing for tasks involving tools, selecting appropriate hand and power tools for specific activities, inspecting tools for serviceability, using tools safely and correctly, and conducting housekeeping activities such as clearing the work area and maintaining equipment. Proficiency in this unit ensures that workers can perform tasks involving hand and power tools efficiently while adhering to safety protocols, thereby contributing to the overall productivity and safety of operations within the resources and infrastructure sectors.

RII30820.name: Operate small plant and equipment
RII30820.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to operate small plant and equipment in the resources and infrastructure industries. Key competencies include planning and preparing for operations, conducting pre-operational checks, safely using small plant and equipment, performing operator maintenance, and carrying out housekeeping activities. Proficiency in this unit ensures that workers can effectively and safely operate small plant and equipment, contributing to efficient and compliant operations within their respective industries.

RII30820.name: Work safely and follow WHS policies and procedures
RII30820.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to work safely and adhere to Work Health and Safety (WHS) policies and procedures within the resources and infrastructure industries. Key competencies include accessing and applying site safety procedures, implementing personal and operational safety measures, maintaining personal wellbeing, and identifying and reporting incidents. Proficiency in this unit ensures that workers can effectively contribute to a safe working environment by following established WHS guidelines and protocols.

RII30820.name: Conduct civil construction skid steer loader operations
RII30820.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to operate a skid steer loader for loading, hauling, and distributing materials in civil construction settings. Key competencies include planning and preparing for operations, conducting pre-start and start-up checks, operating the skid steer loader safely and efficiently, selecting and using appropriate attachments, relocating the equipment as needed, and performing post-operational activities such as maintenance and housekeeping. Proficiency in this unit ensures that workers can effectively and safely operate skid steer loaders, contributing to the productivity and safety of civil construction projects.

RII30820.name: Conduct backhoe/loader operations
RII30820.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to operate a backhoe/loader to load, distribute, and place materials in civil construction settings. Key competencies include planning and preparing for operations, conducting pre-operational checks, operating the backhoe/loader safely and efficiently, lifting and placing materials, selecting and using appropriate attachments, relocating the equipment as needed, and performing post-operational activities such as maintenance and housekeeping. Proficiency in this unit ensures that workers can effectively and safely operate backhoe/loaders, contributing to the productivity and safety of civil construction projects.

RII30820.name: Conduct roller operations
RII30820.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to operate a roller to compact materials in civil construction and related industries. Key competencies include planning and preparing for roller operations, conducting pre-operational checks, selecting and fitting appropriate attachments, operating the roller safely and efficiently, relocating the machine as necessary, and performing post-operational activities such as maintenance and housekeeping. Proficiency in this unit ensures that workers can effectively and safely conduct roller operations, contributing to the quality and safety of construction projects.

RII30820.name: Provide first aid
RII30820.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to provide a first aid response to a casualty in various situations, including community and workplace settings. Key competencies include assessing an emergency situation, performing cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) in accordance with Australian Resuscitation Council (ARC) guidelines, applying appropriate first aid procedures, communicating details of the incident, and evaluating the incident and one's own performance. Proficiency in this unit ensures that individuals can effectively manage casualties, coordinate first aid until the arrival of medical assistance, and adhere to established first aid principles and procedures.

RII30820.name: Load and unload plant
RII30820.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely and efficiently load and unload plant equipment onto and from transportation vehicles such as floats and trailers. Key competencies include planning and preparing for loading and unloading tasks, conducting pre-operational checks, selecting and using appropriate tools and equipment, securing plant to the transport vehicle in line with workplace procedures, and performing post-operational activities such as stowing loading aids and completing necessary documentation. Proficiency in this unit ensures that workers can manage the loading and unloading of plant equipment effectively, adhering to safety protocols and contributing to the overall efficiency of operations within the resources and infrastructure sectors.

RII30820.name: Read and interpret plans and job specifications
RII30820.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to accurately read and interpret plans and job specifications within civil construction contexts. Key competencies include preparing to interpret plans and specifications, recognising amendments on drawings, understanding commonly used symbols and abbreviations, locating and identifying key features on site plans, and comprehending job specifications to ensure work is carried out according to project requirements. Proficiency in this unit ensures that workers can effectively interpret technical documents, facilitating accurate implementation of construction tasks and contributing to the overall success of civil construction projects.

RII30820.name: Support plant operations
RII30820.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to assist in plant operations within civil construction projects.
