Key competencies include planning and preparing for support tasks, identifying and protecting services, providing guidance to plant operators, and conducting housekeeping activities. Proficiency in this unit ensures that workers can effectively support plant operations, contributing to the efficiency and safety of civil construction projects.

RII30820.name: Carry out manual excavation
RII30820.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to perform manual excavation tasks in civil construction settings. Key competencies include planning and preparing for excavation work, confirming the location of underground services to prevent damage, manually digging post holes, small pits, and trenches to specified dimensions, implementing trench collapse prevention techniques in unstable ground, placing appropriate barricades around excavation sites, and conducting housekeeping activities such as clearing the work area and maintaining equipment. Proficiency in this unit ensures that workers can safely and effectively carry out manual excavation tasks, adhering to safety protocols and contributing to the efficiency and safety of civil construction projects.

RII30820.name: Spread and compact materials manually
RII30820.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to manually spread and compact materials in civil construction settings. Key competencies include planning and preparing for tasks, conducting operational checks on compaction equipment, directing vehicles and materials to appropriate locations, operating mechanical compaction equipment, and performing housekeeping activities such as clearing the work area and maintaining equipment. Proficiency in this unit ensures that workers can effectively and safely carry out manual spreading and compaction of materials, contributing to the quality and efficiency of civil construction projects.

RII30820.name: Drain and dewater civil construction sites
RII30820.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to manage drainage and dewatering activities on civil construction sites. Key competencies include planning and preparing for drainage and dewatering tasks, implementing appropriate methods to remove water from work areas, monitoring and maintaining dewatering systems, and conducting housekeeping activities to ensure site safety and environmental compliance. Proficiency in this unit ensures that workers can effectively control water on construction sites, preventing potential hazards and contributing to the efficiency and safety of civil construction projects.

RII30820.name: Carry out basic levelling
RII30820.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to perform basic levelling tasks in civil construction projects. Key competencies include planning and preparing for levelling activities, establishing offsets to plans and drawings, setting up and using levelling devices, transferring heights accurately, and documenting levelling results according to site requirements. Proficiency in this unit ensures that workers can effectively carry out basic levelling, contributing to the accuracy and quality of civil construction projects.

CPC30320.name: Carry out setting out
CPC30320.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to accurately establish and mark out the location and dimensions of buildings or structures on a construction site. This process, known as 'setting out,' involves interpreting construction plans, identifying site boundaries, and using tools to mark reference points that guide the construction process. Proficiency in this unit ensures that structures are positioned correctly according to design specifications, which is crucial for the integrity and success of construction projects.

CPC30320.name: Erect and dismantle formwork for footings and slabs on ground
CPC30320.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to construct and disassemble formwork systems for concrete footings and ground-level slabs. This includes interpreting construction plans, selecting appropriate materials, establishing accurate levels, assembling formwork to contain poured concrete until it cures, and safely dismantling and preparing formwork components for reuse. Proficiency in this unit ensures that formwork is erected and dismantled in compliance with the National Construction Code (NCC), Australian Standards, and work health and safety (WHS) regulations, contributing to the structural integrity and safety of construction projects.

CPC30320.name: Carry out hand excavation
CPC30320.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to perform manual excavation tasks for footings and service provisions on construction sites. This includes planning and preparing for excavation, identifying and avoiding underground services, establishing excavation lines and depths, implementing safety measures, and executing the excavation using appropriate hand tools. Proficiency in this unit ensures that manual excavation is conducted safely and effectively, adhering to work health and safety (WHS) regulations and environmental requirements.

CPC30320.name: Apply basic levelling procedures
CPC30320.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to perform levelling tasks in a single plane, essential for accurately setting out building components on construction sites. This involves setting up, testing, and using various levelling devices—such as spirit levels, laser levels, and automatic/optical levels—to establish and transfer heights as per job specifications. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction elements are positioned correctly, adhering to industry standards and contributing to the structural integrity of building projects.

CPC30320.name: Work effectively and sustainably in the construction industry
CPC30320.desc: This unit focuses on providing individuals with the foundational skills required to operate productively and sustainably in a construction environment. This includes understanding workplace roles, adhering to workplace health and safety (WHS) requirements, planning and prioritising tasks, working collaboratively within a team, and implementing environmentally sustainable practices. Proficiency in this unit ensures that individuals contribute effectively to workplace goals while promoting resource efficiency and sustainable work practices.

CPC30320.name: Plan and organise work
CPC30320.desc: This unit provides individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to effectively plan and organise tasks within a construction setting. This involves determining work requirements, prioritising tasks, identifying resource needs, and scheduling activities to ensure efficiency and alignment with project goals. The unit emphasises teamwork, clear communication, and adherence to workplace health and safety (WHS) standards, enabling individuals to contribute to smooth and productive workflows on construction projects.

CPC30320.name: Conduct workplace communication
CPC30320.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to communicate effectively within a construction workplace environment. This includes gathering, conveying, and receiving information through verbal and written forms of communication, as well as participating in simple meeting processes. Proficiency in this unit ensures that individuals can effectively interpret instructions, convey information accurately, and engage constructively in workplace discussions, thereby contributing to efficient and safe construction operations.

CPC30320.name: Carry out measurements and calculations
CPC30320.desc: This unit equips individuals with the foundational skills required to perform accurate measurements and calculations in a construction environment. This includes selecting and using appropriate measuring tools, recording measurements, and applying mathematical techniques to calculate dimensions such as area, volume, and material quantities. Proficiency in this unit ensures tasks are executed with precision, contributing to efficient planning and resource management on construction projects.

CPC30320.name: Read and interpret plans and specifications
CPC30320.desc: This unit equips individuals with the essential skills to accurately comprehend construction drawings and documents. This includes understanding various types of plans, symbols, abbreviations, and specifications pertinent to construction projects. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction personnel can effectively interpret project requirements, facilitating accurate execution of tasks and adherence to design intentions.

CPC30320.name: Handle concreting materials and components
CPC30320.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely manage and prepare concreting materials and components for construction tasks. This includes understanding the properties of various concreting materials, selecting appropriate handling methods, and adhering to safety protocols to ensure the integrity of materials and the safety of personnel. Proficiency in this unit ensures that concreting materials are handled efficiently, contributing to the quality and durability of concrete structures.

CPC30320.name: Select, use and maintain concreting plant, tools and equipment
CPC30320.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely and effectively handle various concreting machinery, tools, and equipment. This includes selecting appropriate equipment for specific tasks, understanding operational functions and limitations, adhering to safety protocols, and performing routine maintenance to ensure optimal performance. Proficiency in this unit ensures that concreting operations are conducted efficiently, safely, and in compliance with workplace and manufacturer requirements.

CPC30320.name: Determine concrete supply requirements
CPC30320.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to assess and specify the type and volume of concrete needed for various concreting projects. This includes interpreting project documentation to identify concrete properties, calculating required volumes, estimating costs, and scheduling deliveries to ensure timely and efficient supply. Proficiency in this unit ensures that concreting operations are planned and executed accurately, aligning with project specifications and industry standards.

CPC30320.name: Place concrete
CPC30320.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to effectively place concrete into prepared formwork or foundations. This includes tasks such as receiving and verifying concrete deliveries, calculating the necessary volume of concrete, transporting it to the designated pour location, and executing the placement and screeding processes to achieve the specified levels and finishes. Proficiency in this unit ensures that concrete placement is conducted safely, accurately, and in compliance with project specifications and relevant standards.

CPC30320.name: Finish concrete
CPC30320.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to apply manual and mechanical finishing techniques to concrete surfaces, ensuring they meet specified standards. This includes tasks such as assessing the concrete surface during the curing process, applying mechanical trowelling to consolidate and densify the setting concrete, installing jointing systems, finishing edges, and ensuring the final surface complies with project specifications. Proficiency in this unit ensures that concrete surfaces are finished to the desired quality, contributing to the durability and aesthetic appeal of the construction project.

CPC30320.name: Cure concrete
CPC30320.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to perform the initial curing process on freshly poured concrete. This process involves controlling moisture evaporation to ensure proper hydration and strength development of the concrete. Key tasks include applying appropriate curing agents and techniques in accordance with engineering specifications to maintain the desired moisture and temperature conditions during the critical early stages of concrete setting. Proficiency in this unit ensures that concrete structures achieve their intended durability and performance characteristics.

CPC30320.name: Place and fix reinforcement materials
CPC30320.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to install reinforcement for concrete structures as part of construction processes. This includes planning and preparing for the task, cutting and bending reinforcement bars, placing and securing reinforcement using bar chairs, ligatures, and spacers, and ensuring compliance with engineering drawings and specifications. Proficiency in this unit ensures that reinforcement materials are accurately positioned and fixed, contributing to the structural integrity and durability of concrete constructions.

CPC30320.name: Apply WHS requirements, policies and procedures in the construction industry
CPC30320.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the necessary skills and knowledge to adhere to Work Health and Safety (WHS) regulations within the construction sector. It encompasses understanding and implementing WHS legislative requirements, recognising construction hazards, and following established safety procedures to ensure a safe working environment. This unit is essential for those entering the construction industry, as it lays the foundation for maintaining safety standards on-site.

CPC30320.name: Plan concrete work and brief team
CPC30320.desc: This unit focuses on developing the skills and knowledge necessary to effectively plan concreting tasks and communicate requirements to team members. This includes assessing the size and scope of concreting projects, scheduling activities in compliance with work health and safety (WHS) regulations, identifying and sourcing necessary resources, and briefing team members to ensure tasks are completed on time and within budget. This unit is essential for individuals responsible for organising concreting work and leading teams in the construction industry.

CPC30320.name: Apply decorative finishes to concrete
CPC30320.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to enhance concrete surfaces with decorative treatments. This includes techniques such as stamping, stencilling, colouring, exposing aggregates, and applying textured finishes to create distinctive features for areas like driveways, patios, and pathways. The unit is essential for concreters working autonomously or as part of a team, aiming to produce aesthetically pleasing and durable concrete finishes in various construction projects.

CPC30320.name: Repair and rectify concrete
CPC30320.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to address defects in concrete structures. This encompasses tasks such as patching, refinishing, sealing, recolouring to enhance aesthetic appeal, and more substantial repairs like cutting and replacing concrete sections or repairing cracks in accordance with engineer or manufacturer specifications. The unit does not cover structural defects requiring underpinning or specialist works involving highly engineered solutions. This unit is essential for professionals in the construction industry responsible for maintaining and restoring the integrity of concrete installations.

CPC30320.name: Cut concrete
CPC30320.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely and effectively cut concrete using appropriate tools and techniques. This includes planning and preparing for concrete cutting tasks, assessing the work site to determine concrete type and thickness, selecting and using suitable equipment, performing cuts according to specifications, and managing associated hazards such as dust control. This unit is essential for construction professionals involved in projects requiring precise and safe concrete cutting.

CPC30320.name: Conduct concrete pump delivery operations
CPC30320.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely and efficiently operate concrete pumping equipment on construction sites. This includes planning and preparing for concrete pumping tasks, conducting pre-operational checks, positioning the pump, managing the delivery of concrete to specified locations, and performing post-operational procedures. Emphasis is placed on adhering to work health and safety (WHS) regulations, environmental considerations, and effective communication with team members to ensure the safe and precise placement of concrete.

CPC31420.name: Investigate business opportunities
CPC31420.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge to explore and assess potential business opportunities. It covers identifying and researching viable business ideas, evaluating market needs, and determining the feasibility of these opportunities. The unit is essential for those considering starting a new business or expanding an existing one, as it provides a structured approach to making informed decisions about business ventures.

CPC31420.name: Manage finances for new business ventures
CPC31420.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to implement and review financial management strategies for new business ventures. It encompasses the use of new and emerging digital technologies, interpretation of financial reports, and analysis of numerical data. Key aspects include developing financial budgets or projections, managing business capital, ensuring adequate financial provision for taxation, and monitoring financial performance through key performance indicators (KPIs). This unit is essential for those establishing a business for self-employment or initiating a new venture within a larger organisation, providing a structured approach to effective financial management in business settings.

CPC31420.name: Apply basic levelling procedures
CPC31420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to carry out levelling in a single plane to establish correct and accurate set-out of building components. It includes the set-up, testing, and use of levelling devices, as well as establishing and transferring heights using a range of levelling equipment. The unit supports workers in the construction industry who use various common methods and equipment when working with others and as part of a team. It applies to levelling work on residential and commercial work sites.

CPC31420.name: Erect and dismantle restricted height scaffolding
CPC31420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to erect and dismantle modular scaffolding systems up to a height of four metres, providing work platforms for various occupational applications. It encompasses planning and preparation, establishing footings, erecting scaffolding in accordance with regulations and manufacturer specifications, inspecting for structural integrity, and safely dismantling the scaffolding. The unit applies to workers across a range of industries and involves working in a team environment. No licensing, legislative, or certification requirements apply to this unit at the time of publication.

CPC31420.name: Carry out basic demolition
CPC31420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to remove components from single-storey buildings and structures using basic demolition techniques. It includes preparing the site for demolition, safely removing building components, and handling materials for disposal or salvage. The unit is suitable for individuals with basic skills undertaking routine work tasks under the direction of more experienced workers. A prerequisite for this unit is CPCCWHS2001, which covers applying work health and safety requirements in the construction industry.

CPC31420.name: Work effectively and sustainably in the construction industry
CPC31420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to work effectively and sustainably in the construction industry. It is suitable for individuals with basic skills and knowledge undertaking routine work tasks under the direction of more experienced workers. Key competencies include participating in team planning, understanding construction job roles and employment pathways, and adhering to environmental and resource efficiency requirements. Completion of the general construction induction training program specified by the model Code of Practice for Construction Work is required for any person who is to carry out construction work. Achievement of unit CPCCWHS1001 Prepare to work safely in the construction industry meets this requirement.

CPC31420.name: Plan and organise work
CPC31420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to plan and organise basic work tasks on a construction site. It involves determining task requirements, breaking down tasks into components, estimating time and resources, and preparing a written work plan. The unit is suitable for individuals with basic skills and knowledge undertaking routine work tasks under the direction of more experienced workers. Completion of the general construction induction training program specified by the model Code of Practice for Construction Work is required for any person who is to carry out construction work. Achievement of unit CPCCWHS1001 Prepare to work safely in the construction industry meets this requirement.

CPC31420.name: Conduct workplace communication
CPC31420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to communicate effectively with other workers in a construction workplace environment. It includes gathering, conveying, and receiving information through verbal and written forms of communication. The unit is suitable for individuals with basic skills and knowledge undertaking routine work tasks under the direction of more experienced workers. Completion of the general construction induction training program specified by the model Code of Practice for Construction Work is required for any person who is to carry out construction work. Achievement of unit CPCCWHS1001 Prepare to work safely in the construction industry meets this requirement.

CPC31420.name: Carry out measurements and calculations
CPC31420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to undertake basic measurements and calculations to determine task and material requirements in a construction work environment. It involves selecting appropriate equipment, obtaining accurate linear measurements, and performing calculations for quantities of materials using basic formulas for weight, area, volume, perimeter, circumference, ratio, and percentage. The unit is suitable for individuals with basic skills and knowledge undertaking routine tasks under supervision. Completion of the general construction induction training program specified by the model Code of Practice for Construction Work is required for any person who is to carry out construction work; achievement of CPCCWHS1001 Prepare to work safely in the construction industry meets this requirement.

CPC31420.name: Read and interpret plans and specifications
CPC31420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to read and interpret plans and specifications relevant to construction operations at a basic level. It involves understanding key features and functions of different types of construction plans and drawings, interpreting legends, symbols, and abbreviations, and identifying project requirements such as construction types, dimensions, environmental controls, and material specifications. The unit is suitable for individuals with basic skills and knowledge undertaking routine work tasks under the direction of more experienced workers. A prerequisite for this unit is CPCCWHS2001, which covers applying work health and safety requirements in the construction industry.

CPC31420.name: Apply WHS requirements, policies and procedures in the construction industry
CPC31420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to carry out work health and safety (WHS) requirements through safe work practices in all on-site or off-site construction workplaces. It involves identifying and assessing risks, recognising hazardous materials (including asbestos), planning and preparing for safe work practices, applying these practices, and following emergency procedures. The unit is essential for individuals working in the construction industry to ensure personal safety and the safety of others by adhering to legislated work safety practices. Notably, this unit is a mandatory requirement for trainers delivering the White Card Course (CPCCWHS1001 Prepare to work safely in the construction industry).

CPC31420.name: Handle waterproofing materials and components
CPC31420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to safely handle and store waterproofing materials and components, both manually and mechanically, in compliance with Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and relevant legislation. It encompasses tasks such as preparing, handling, sorting, stacking, and disposing of waterproofing products and materials during the application of waterproofing systems. This unit is suitable for individuals with basic skills and knowledge undertaking routine waterproofing tasks under the direction of more experienced workers. A prerequisite for this unit is CPCCWHS2001, which covers applying WHS requirements, policies, and procedures in the construction industry.

CPC31420.name: Use waterproofing tools and equipment
CPC31420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to safely and effectively use tools and equipment in waterproofing tasks, ensuring compliance with Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and relevant legislation. It encompasses planning and preparing for the use of waterproofing tools, selecting appropriate hand and power tools, conducting pre-operational checks, and adhering to safe work practices during operation. The unit is suitable for individuals with basic skills and knowledge undertaking routine waterproofing tasks under the direction of more experienced workers. A prerequisite for this unit is CPCCWHS2001, which covers applying WHS requirements, policies, and procedures in the construction industry.

CPC31420.name: Prepare surfaces for waterproofing application
CPC31420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to repair and prepare various surfaces for waterproofing applications, ensuring compliance with Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and relevant legislation. Key tasks include assessing and repairing surface defects, cleaning and preparing work areas, and selecting appropriate tools and materials for the waterproofing process. This unit is suitable for individuals with basic skills undertaking routine waterproofing tasks under supervision. A prerequisite for this unit is CPCCWHS2001, which covers applying WHS requirements, policies, and procedures in the construction industry.

CPC31420.name: Apply waterproofing system to below ground level wet areas
CPC31420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to apply waterproofing systems to below-ground wet areas, ensuring compliance with Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and relevant legislation. It encompasses tasks such as preparing surfaces, selecting appropriate waterproofing materials, applying waterproofing systems, and ensuring proper drainage and protection of the waterproofed area. This unit is suitable for individuals with basic skills and knowledge undertaking routine waterproofing tasks under the direction of more experienced workers. A prerequisite for this unit is CPCCWHS2001, which covers applying WHS requirements, policies, and procedures in the construction industry.

CPC31420.name: Apply waterproofing process to internal wet areas
CPC31420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to apply waterproofing to internal wet areas, ensuring compliance with Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and relevant legislation. It encompasses tasks such as identifying appropriate waterproofing systems, preparing surfaces, applying waterproofing membranes, and ensuring proper curing and protection of the treated areas. This unit is essential for individuals aiming to perform waterproofing tasks in areas like bathrooms, laundries, and showers, ensuring these spaces are effectively protected against water ingress. A prerequisite for this unit is CPCCWHS2001, which covers applying WHS requirements, policies, and procedures in the construction industry.

CPC31420.name: Apply waterproofing process to external above-ground wet areas
CPC31420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to apply waterproofing to external above-ground wet areas, ensuring compliance with Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and relevant legislation. It encompasses tasks such as identifying appropriate waterproofing systems, preparing surfaces, applying waterproofing membranes, and ensuring proper detailing and termination of the waterproofing system. This unit is essential for individuals aiming to perform waterproofing tasks on structures like balconies, decks, and planter boxes, ensuring these areas are effectively protected against water ingress. A prerequisite for this unit is CPCCWHS2001, which covers applying WHS requirements, policies, and procedures in the construction industry.

CPC31420.name: Apply waterproofing remedial processes
CPC31420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to apply remedial waterproofing processes to wet areas, ensuring compliance with Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) requirements, and relevant legislation. It involves planning and preparing for remedial work, selecting appropriate techniques and materials, applying the remedial processes, and conducting tests to confirm the effectiveness of repairs. This unit is essential for individuals responsible for maintaining and repairing waterproofing systems to ensure the integrity of wet areas in both residential and commercial constructions. A prerequisite for this unit is CPCCWHS2001, which covers applying WHS requirements, policies, and procedures in the construction industry.

CPC31420.name: Assess construction waterproofing processes
CPC31420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to assess waterproofing processes across various wet areas in building situations, ensuring compliance with Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and relevant legislation. It involves planning and preparing for assessments, evaluating selected waterproofing systems for installation techniques, product suitability, compatibility with substrates, and conformity to codes and specifications. Additionally, it includes assessing potential for water penetration, determining installation methods, and identifying potential faults and mitigation activities. This unit is essential for individuals responsible for ensuring the integrity of waterproofing systems in construction projects. A prerequisite for this unit is CPCCWHS2001, which covers applying WHS requirements, policies, and procedures in the construction industry.

CPC30420.name: Manage work health and safety in the building and construction workplace
CPC30420.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to manage work health and safety (WHS) within the building and construction industry. It encompasses the identification of hazards, assessment and control of risks, and the development and implementation of WHS policies and procedures to ensure a safe working environment. Additionally, it covers the monitoring of compliance with WHS legislation and the promotion of a safety culture among workers.

CPC30420.name: Read and interpret plans and specifications
CPC30420.desc: This unit imparts the skills and knowledge required to accurately read and interpret plans and specifications for residential and commercial construction projects. It involves identifying various types of plans, understanding key features, and extracting essential structural and non-structural details to inform estimation, planning, and supervisory tasks. Proficiency in this area ensures that construction professionals can effectively translate two-dimensional drawings into three-dimensional structures, facilitating compliance with building codes and standards.

CPC30420.name: Work safely at heights
CPC30420.desc: This unit imparts the skills and knowledge required to work safely on construction sites where there is a risk of falling from one level to another. It encompasses identifying task requirements, selecting and checking personal protective equipment (PPE), assessing work areas for hazards, and implementing appropriate fall protection measures. Additionally, it covers the safe execution of tasks at heights, including the use of fall restraint and fall arrest systems, and adherence to workplace and regulatory requirements to prevent falls and ensure safety.

CPC30420.name: Identify hazards on demolition sites and apply risk management strategies
CPC30420.desc: This unit imparts the skills and knowledge required to identify and manage hazards specific to demolition sites. It involves assessing risks associated with structural integrity, hazardous materials, services, and environmental factors, and implementing appropriate risk management strategies to ensure safety and compliance with regulatory requirements. Additionally, it covers monitoring the worksite for undiscovered hazards and contributing to the continuous improvement of risk management practices.

CPC30420.name: Select and use hand tools and equipment for demolition tasks
CPC30420.desc: This unit imparts the skills and knowledge required to select and use appropriate hand tools and equipment for demolition tasks in construction settings. It involves identifying the correct tools for specific demolition activities, inspecting and maintaining tools to ensure safety and efficiency, and applying safe work practices during their use. Proficiency in this area ensures that demolition work is conducted effectively, minimising risks to workers and maintaining compliance with workplace safety standards.

CPC30420.name: Select and use small plant and equipment for demolition tasks
CPC30420.desc: This unit imparts the skills and knowledge required to safely and effectively select and operate small plant and equipment for demolition tasks, such as breaking concrete, dismantling structures, and removing services infrastructure. It encompasses planning and preparation, including hazard assessment and compliance with work health and safety (WHS) requirements; selecting appropriate tools; conducting pre-operational checks; and executing demolition activities in accordance with regulatory and environmental guidelines. Proficiency in this area ensures that demolition work is conducted efficiently, safely, and in compliance with industry standards.

CPC30420.name: Demolish small buildings and structures using hand tools and small plant and equipment
CPC30420.desc: This unit imparts the skills and knowledge required to demolish small buildings and structures using hand tools and small plant equipment. It encompasses planning and preparing for demolition tasks, including hazard identification and compliance with work health and safety (WHS) requirements; selecting and using appropriate tools and equipment; safely executing demolition activities; and managing waste materials in accordance with environmental and regulatory guidelines. Proficiency in this area ensures that demolition work is conducted efficiently, safely, and in compliance with industry standards.

CPC30420.name: Select and use tools and equipment for hot work in the demolition industry
CPC30420.desc: This unit imparts the skills and knowledge required to safely select and operate tools and equipment for hot work in the demolition industry, including tasks such as cutting and grinding that generate heat and potential ignition sources. It encompasses planning and preparing for hot work, identifying and mitigating hazards, adhering to work health and safety (WHS) requirements, obtaining necessary permits, and selecting appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE). Additionally, it covers the maintenance and safe operation of hot work tools and equipment to ensure compliance with industry standards and regulatory guidelines.

CPC30420.name: Operate demolition material crushing plants
CPC30420.desc: This unit imparts the skills and knowledge required to operate demolition material crushing plants, enabling the processing of demolished materials into reusable forms. It encompasses planning and preparing for operations, conducting pre-operational checks, operating the crushing plant safely and efficiently, and performing post-operational procedures. Proficiency in this area ensures that demolition materials are processed in compliance with work health and safety (WHS) regulations, environmental standards, and industry best practices.

CPC30420.name: Manage demolition recyclable waste materials and contaminated soil using load shifting equipment
CPC30420.desc: This unit imparts the skills and knowledge required to manage demolition recyclable waste materials and contaminated soil using load shifting equipment. It encompasses planning and preparing for waste management tasks, identifying and segregating different types of materials, operating load shifting equipment safely and efficiently, and ensuring compliance with work health and safety (WHS) regulations and environmental guidelines. Proficiency in this area ensures that demolition waste is handled responsibly, promoting recycling and proper disposal practices in line with industry standards.

CPC30420.name: Operate excavators at ground level to demolish building elements
CPC30420.desc: This unit imparts the skills and knowledge required to operate excavators at ground level to demolish building elements in the demolition industry. It encompasses planning and preparing for demolition tasks, conducting pre-operational checks on the excavator, selecting and fitting appropriate attachments, and safely executing demolition activities in accordance with work health and safety (WHS) regulations and site-specific requirements. Proficiency in this area ensures that demolition work is conducted efficiently, safely, and in compliance with industry standards.

CPC30420.name: Read and interpret demolition site plans and drawings
CPC30420.desc: This unit imparts the skills and knowledge required to accurately read and interpret demolition site plans and drawings. It encompasses identifying various types of plans, understanding their functions, recognising commonly used symbols and abbreviations, and extracting essential details to inform demolition activities. Proficiency in this area ensures that demolition work is conducted efficiently, safely, and in compliance with industry standards.

CPC30420.name: Carry out measurements and calculations
CPC30420.desc: This unit imparts the skills and knowledge required to perform basic measurements and calculations in a construction environment. It encompasses selecting appropriate measuring equipment, obtaining accurate linear measurements, and applying basic mathematical formulas to calculate weight, area, volume, perimeter, circumference, ratio, and percentage. Additionally, it involves converting measurements between metres and millimetres, ensuring accuracy in calculations, and recording results. Proficiency in this area ensures that construction tasks are executed with precision, supporting effective planning and resource management.

CPC30420.name: Apply WHS requirements, policies and procedures in the construction industry
CPC30420.desc: This unit imparts the skills and knowledge required to apply work health and safety (WHS) requirements, policies, and procedures in the construction industry. It encompasses identifying and assessing risks, recognising hazardous materials (including asbestos), planning and preparing for safe work practices, implementing these practices, and following emergency procedures. Proficiency in this area ensures that construction tasks are performed safely, in compliance with legislative requirements, and with due regard for personal and others' safety.

CPC30420.name: Conduct civil construction excavator operations
CPC30420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to operate an excavator to perform civil construction tasks. It involves planning and preparing for operations, conducting machine pre-operational checks, operating the excavator, lifting, carrying and placing materials, selecting, removing and fitting attachments, relocating the excavator, carrying out machine operator maintenance, and cleaning up.

CPC30420.name: Enter and work in confined spaces
CPC30420.desc: This unit outlines the competencies required to safely enter and work in confined spaces within the resources and infrastructure industries. It encompasses planning and preparing for entry, conducting atmospheric testing, adhering to permit requirements, maintaining communication with standby personnel, executing tasks within the confined space, and ensuring safe exit procedures. Emphasis is placed on hazard identification, risk management, and compliance with safety protocols to protect workers from potential dangers associated with confined spaces.

CPC30420.name: Control traffic with stop-slow bat
CPC30420.desc: This unit outlines the competencies required to control vehicle and pedestrian traffic using stop-slow bats, hand signals, and approved communication devices within the resources and infrastructure industries. It encompasses planning and preparing for traffic control operations, coordinating traffic flow, operating communication devices, and conducting post-operational activities such as site clean-up. Emphasis is placed on adhering to workplace policies, procedures, and jurisdictional safety requirements to ensure the safety of both workers and the public in live traffic environments.

CPC30420.name: Implement traffic management plans
CPC30420.desc: This unit specifies the competencies required to implement traffic management plans in civil construction settings. It encompasses preparing to implement the plan, setting out the traffic guidance scheme, monitoring traffic flow, and safely closing down work activities. Emphasis is placed on ensuring the safety of both workers and the public by adhering to workplace policies, procedures, and relevant legislative requirements.

CPC30420.name: Shift materials safely using manual handling methods
CPC30420.desc: This unit encompasses the skills and knowledge necessary to safely shift materials using manual handling techniques. It involves assessing risks associated with relocating loads, planning the relocation process, and executing the move in accordance with established plans. Key competencies include identifying appropriate relocation methods, determining storage locations, estimating load balance points, and adhering to workplace health and safety regulations to prevent injury and ensure efficient material handling.

CPC30420.name: Handle dangerous goods/hazardous substances
CPC30420.desc: This unit specifies the competencies required to handle dangerous goods and hazardous substances in compliance with safety regulations. It involves identifying such materials through labels and documentation, understanding their storage requirements, and applying appropriate handling procedures based on their classifications. Additionally, it covers confirming site incident procedures, including emergency equipment checks and incident reporting processes, to ensure a safe working environment.

MEM31922.name: Shut down and isolate machines/equipment
MEM31922.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to safely shut down and isolate machines and equipment in a manufacturing or engineering environment. It includes following standard operating procedures (SOPs) to de-energise and secure machinery, ensuring safety during maintenance or emergency situations.

MEM31922.name: Organise and communicate information
MEM31922.desc: This unit focuses on effectively organising and communicating information within a manufacturing or engineering context. It involves accessing, interpreting, and conveying information accurately using appropriate methods and procedures to ensure clear and efficient communication in the workplace.

MEM31922.name: Dismantle, replace and assemble engineering components
MEM31922.desc: This unit involves dismantling engineering components, identifying faulty parts, selecting replacements, and reassembling components into assemblies or sub-assemblies. It ensures that components function correctly and meet specified tolerances.

MEM31922.name: Work safely with industrial chemicals and materials
MEM31922.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to work safely with industrial chemicals and materials. It includes understanding chemical properties, interpreting safety data sheets, using appropriate personal protective equipment, and following safety protocols to minimise risks associated with handling hazardous substances.

MEM31922.name: Perform manual heating and thermal cutting
MEM31922.desc: This unit involves performing manual heating and thermal cutting operations on metals. It includes setting up equipment, applying heating and cutting techniques such as oxy-fuel cutting, and adhering to safety procedures to cut materials to specified shapes and sizes.

MEM31922.name: Weld using manual metal arc welding process
MEM31922.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to perform manual metal arc welding (MMAW) on various materials. It includes preparing materials and equipment, setting welding parameters, and executing welds to meet specifications. Competency in this unit ensures the ability to produce sound welds in accordance with industry standards.

MEM31922.name: Plan work activities
MEM31922.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to plan familiar work activities by following established procedures and work health and safety (WHS) policies. It involves determining job requirements, identifying and prioritising components of the plan, selecting appropriate planning tools, and modifying the plan as necessary to respond to unforeseen developments. Competency in this unit ensures the ability to organise work effectively and safely.

MEM31922.name: Operate as a team member to conduct manufacturing, engineering or related activities
MEM31922.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge required to operate effectively as a member of a team in manufacturing, engineering, or related environments. It includes understanding team goals and processes, communicating and cooperating with team members, performing tasks according to organisational and team requirements, and solving problems collaboratively. Achieving competency in this unit ensures effective participation in team-based operations.

MEM31922.name: Participate in environmentally sustainable work practices
MEM31922.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to apply environmentally sustainable work practices in the manufacturing sector. It involves identifying environmental regulations applicable to the workplace, assessing current practices, and implementing improvements to reduce environmental risks. Competency in this unit contributes to the development of sustainable work practices.

MEM31922.name: Order materials
MEM31922.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to order materials for production or maintenance activities. It includes identifying material requirements, selecting appropriate suppliers, placing orders, and following up to ensure timely delivery. Competency in this unit ensures the ability to manage material resources effectively.

MEM31922.name: Operate and monitor machine and process
MEM31922.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to operate and monitor machines and processes in a manufacturing or engineering environment. It includes setting up machines, monitoring operations, identifying and responding to irregularities, and maintaining production quality. Achieving competency in this unit ensures the ability to manage machinery operations efficiently.

MEM31922.name: Carry out mechanical cutting
MEM31922.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to set up and operate a range of mechanical cutting and holing equipment, such as guillotines, croppers, and saws. It involves selecting appropriate machines and tooling, preparing materials, and performing cutting operations to meet specifications. Competency in this unit ensures the ability to carry out mechanical cutting tasks safely and efficiently.

MEM31922.name: Use power tools/hand-held operations
MEM31922.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to safely operate a variety of hand-held power tools commonly used in manufacturing, engineering, and related environments. It includes selecting appropriate tools, performing operations such as cutting, grinding, and drilling, and conducting routine maintenance. Achieving competency in this unit ensures effective and safe use of power tools in various tasks.

MEM31922.name: Perform brazing and/or silver soldering
MEM31922.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to perform brazing and silver soldering operations. It includes preparing materials and equipment, applying appropriate techniques to join metals, and inspecting completed work to ensure it meets specifications. Competency in this unit ensures the ability to carry out brazing and silver soldering tasks effectively.

MEM31922.name: Assemble fabricated components
MEM31922.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to assemble fabricated components in manufacturing or engineering environments. It includes interpreting technical drawings, selecting appropriate assembly methods, using tools and equipment to join components, and ensuring the final assembly meets specifications. Achieving competency in this unit ensures the ability to assemble fabricated components accurately and efficiently.

MEM31922.name: Use hand tools
MEM31922.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to use a variety of hand tools in manufacturing, engineering, and related environments. It includes selecting appropriate tools for specific tasks, performing operations such as measuring, marking, cutting, and assembling, and maintaining tools in good working condition. Competency in this unit ensures the ability to use hand tools safely and effectively.

MEM31922.name: Perform routine manual metal arc welding
MEM31922.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to perform routine manual metal arc welding (MMAW) on low carbon mild steel. It involves preparing materials and equipment, selecting appropriate electrodes, and executing welds such as butt and fillet joints. Competency in this unit ensures the ability to carry out MMAW tasks safely and effectively.

MEM31922.name: Repair, replace and/or modify fabrications
MEM31922.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to undertake repair, replacement, and modification of fabrications. It includes inspecting fabrications to determine suitability for repair, assessing material requirements, preparing materials, and performing necessary welding and fabrication tasks. Achieving competency in this unit ensures the ability to manage fabrication maintenance and repair tasks efficiently.

MEM31922.name: Perform computations
MEM31922.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to perform calculations involving percentages, proportions, ratios, and averages, as well as producing and interpreting simple charts and graphs. It is essential for tasks that require precise measurements and data interpretation in manufacturing and engineering contexts. Competency in this unit ensures the ability to perform necessary computations accurately.

MEM31922.name: Work safely and effectively in manufacturing and engineering
MEM31922.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to work safely and effectively in manufacturing and engineering environments. It includes understanding and following work health and safety (WHS) procedures, using personal protective equipment (PPE), and communicating effectively with team members. Competency in this unit ensures adherence to safety protocols and effective workplace communication.

MEM31922.name: Use tools for precision work
MEM31922.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to use tools to manually produce work to precise dimensions and finishes. It covers performing precision tasks on various materials using a range of tools, instruments, and power equipment. Achieving competency in this unit ensures the ability to execute precision work accurately and efficiently.

MEM31922.name: Perform routine oxy-fuel gas welding
MEM31922.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to perform routine oxy-fuel gas welding on materials such as mild/low carbon steel and cast iron. It involves preparing materials and equipment, setting up and operating welding equipment, and executing welds to meet job specifications. Competency in this unit ensures the ability to carry out oxy-fuel gas welding tasks safely and effectively.

MEM31922.name: Weld using gas tungsten arc welding process
MEM31922.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to weld materials using the gas tungsten arc welding (GTAW) process. It includes preparing materials and equipment, setting welding parameters, and performing welds to meet specifications. Achieving competency in this unit ensures the ability to execute GTAW tasks proficiently.

MEM31922.name: Weld using gas metal arc welding process
MEM31922.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to weld materials using the gas metal arc welding (GMAW) process. It involves preparing materials and equipment, selecting appropriate welding parameters, and performing welds to meet job specifications. Competency in this unit ensures the ability to carry out GMAW tasks safely and effectively.

MEM31922.name: Perform internal/external customer service
MEM31922.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to provide effective customer service to both internal and external customers in a manufacturing or engineering environment. It includes identifying customer needs, delivering quality service, and handling complaints or issues professionally. Competency in this unit ensures the ability to maintain positive customer relations.

MEM31922.name: Interact with computing technology
MEM31922.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to use computing technology in a manufacturing or engineering context. It includes accessing, inputting, and storing information using relevant software applications, as well as following organisational procedures for data management. Achieving competency in this unit ensures effective interaction with computing technology in the workplace.

MEM31922.name: Undertake manual handling
MEM31922.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to safely lift and move materials manually or using basic manual handling equipment in various work environments. It includes determining material weight, assessing risks, selecting appropriate lifting techniques, and utilising equipment such as hand trolleys or pallet trucks. Competency in this unit ensures adherence to Safe Work Australia guidelines for manual handling.

MEM31922.name: Perform engineering measurements
MEM31922.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to perform precise measurements in an engineering context. It includes selecting and using appropriate measuring instruments, interpreting technical information, and recording data accurately. Achieving competency in this unit ensures the ability to obtain reliable measurements essential for engineering tasks.

MEM31922.name: Assist in the provision of on-the-job training

Competency in this unit contributes to effective workplace training and skill development.

MEM31922.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to apply fabrication, forming, and shaping techniques to produce components from materials such as plate, sheet, tube, and pipe. It includes interpreting technical drawings, selecting appropriate tools and equipment, and performing operations such as levelling, rolling, pressing, and bending to meet specifications. Competency in this unit ensures the ability to fabricate components accurately using various forming and shaping methods.

MEM31922.name: Interpret technical drawing
MEM31922.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to interpret technical drawings used in engineering and manufacturing contexts. MEM30219.desc: This unit of competency defines the skills and knowledge required to interpret technical drawings. MEM30219.name: Undertake manual handling
MEM30219.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to lift and move materials manually and/or using basic manual handling equipment in various environments. It emphasises adhering to Safe Work Australia recommendations, ensuring safety and compliance during manual handling tasks.

MEM30219.name: Perform engineering measurements

MEM30219.name: Perform computations
MEM30219.desc: This unit focuses on performing mathematical computations essential in engineering contexts. It encompasses calculations involving algebra, geometry, and trigonometry to solve engineering problems, ensuring accurate and reliable results.

MEM30219.name: Work safely and effectively in manufacturing and engineering
MEM30219.desc: This unit defines the skills and knowledge required to work safely and effectively in manufacturing and engineering environments. It includes following standard operating procedures, complying with work health and safety requirements, and using appropriate personal protective equipment.

MEM30219.name: Plan work activities
MEM30219.desc: This unit involves planning work activities in a manufacturing or engineering setting. It includes determining job requirements, sequencing tasks, and coordinating resources to achieve efficient workflow and meet production targets.

MEM30219.name: Organise and communicate information
MEM30219.desc: This unit focuses on effectively organising and communicating information within a manufacturing or engineering context. MEM30219.name: Interact with computing technology
MEM30219.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to use computing technology in manufacturing and engineering environments. It includes accessing, inputting, and storing information using various software applications and devices, ensuring efficient and accurate data management.

MEM30219.name: Assist in the provision of on-the-job training
MEM30219.desc: This unit involves assisting in delivering on-the-job training within the workplace. It includes preparing for training, providing support to trainees, and contributing to the assessment process to facilitate effective skill development and knowledge transfer.

MEM30219.name: Use hand tools
MEM30219.desc: This unit defines the skills and knowledge required to safely and effectively use a variety of hand tools in engineering applications. It encompasses selecting appropriate tools, performing tasks to specifications, and maintaining tools in good working condition.

MEM30219.name: Use power tools/hand-held operations
MEM30219.desc: This unit covers the use of a range of hand-held power tools and fixed power tools for hand-held operations in general engineering tasks. It includes selecting appropriate tools, performing operations safely, and conducting operational maintenance to ensure tools are in proper working order.

MEM30219.name: Participate in environmentally sustainable work practices
MEM30219.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to apply environmentally sustainable work practices in the workplace. It includes identifying environmental regulations, assessing workplace environmental practices, and contributing to improvements to minimise environmental risks and maximise resource efficiency.

MEM30219.name: Carry out mechanical cutting
MEM30219.desc: This unit defines the skills and knowledge required to set up and operate a range of mechanical cutting and holing equipment, such as guillotines, saws, and cropping machines. It involves planning material usage to minimise waste, selecting appropriate machinery and tooling, and performing cutting operations to meet specifications.

MEM30219.name: Perform general machining
MEM30219.desc: This unit involves performing general machining operations using machines like lathes, mills, planers, and grinders. It includes determining job requirements, selecting and mounting tools, setting machining parameters, and checking components for compliance with specifications.

MEM30219.desc: This unit covers the installation of machinery and plant equipment in industrial settings. It includes planning the installation process, positioning and aligning machinery, connecting services, and testing the installed equipment to ensure operational readiness.

MEM30219.desc: This unit defines the skills and knowledge required to mark off/out general engineering components using appropriate tools and equipment. MEM30219.name: Use tools for precision work
MEM30219.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to select, use, and maintain precision tools in engineering tasks. It includes interpreting technical drawings, performing precise measurements, and ensuring components meet exact specifications.

MEM30219.desc: This unit involves diagnosing faults, performing maintenance, and overhauling mechanical equipment to ensure optimal performance. It encompasses dismantling machinery, repairing or replacing components, and reassembling equipment in accordance with industry standards.

MEM30219.desc: This unit focuses on diagnosing bearing faults, and the installation and removal of bearings in mechanical equipment. It includes selecting appropriate bearings, using correct installation techniques, and ensuring operational efficiency.

MEM30219.desc: This unit covers dismantling engineering components, identifying faulty parts, selecting replacements, and reassembling components into assemblies or sub-assemblies. It ensures that components function correctly and meet specified tolerances.

MEM30219.name: Perform precision fitting of engineering components
MEM30219.desc: This unit involves fitting engineering components with high precision to meet exact specifications. It includes tasks such as marking out, shaping, and assembling components, ensuring they function seamlessly within mechanical systems.

MEM30219.name: Perform precision levelling and alignment of machines and engineering components
MEM30219.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to perform precision levelling and alignment of machines and engineering components. It involves using appropriate tools and techniques to ensure machinery and components are correctly levelled and aligned to specified tolerances, ensuring optimal performance and longevity.

MEM30219.name: Perform routine gas metal arc welding
MEM30219.desc: This unit involves performing routine gas metal arc welding (GMAW) tasks. It includes preparing materials, setting up welding equipment, and applying GMAW techniques to join materials in accordance with job specifications and safety standards.

MEM30219.desc: This unit covers the process of safely shutting down and isolating machines and equipment. It includes following standard operating procedures to ensure machinery is correctly de-energised and secured, preventing accidental operation during maintenance or emergency situations.

MEM30219.desc: This unit involves performing grinding operations to shape or finish metal components using various grinding machines. It includes selecting appropriate grinding wheels, setting up machines, and applying grinding techniques to achieve required specifications and surface finishes.

MEM30219.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to operate workshop machines for basic tasks in a maintenance or jobbing environment. It includes identifying unbalanced components, selecting appropriate balancing methods, and using balancing equipment to achieve the required balance within specified tolerances.

MEM30219.name: Perform installation and removal of mechanical seals
MEM30219.desc: This unit focuses on installing and removing mechanical seals in machinery to prevent leakage of fluids. It includes selecting appropriate seals, preparing equipment for seal installation or removal, and ensuring seals are correctly fitted or removed without causing damage to components.

MEM30219.name: Operate as a team member to conduct manufacturing, engineering or related activities
MEM30219.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to work effectively as a team member in manufacturing, engineering, or related environments. It includes communicating with team members, contributing to team objectives, and following established procedures to achieve production or project goals.

MEM30219.desc: This unit involves ordering materials required for production or maintenance activities. It includes identifying material requirements, selecting appropriate suppliers, placing orders, and ensuring materials are available when needed to support operational needs.

MSF30422.desc: This unit involves operating basic glass processing machines to cut, edge, drill, or shape glass components as specified in work orders. It includes setting up machines, selecting appropriate tools, and adhering to safety and quality standards throughout the processing activities.

MSF30422.name: Participate in environmentally sustainable work practices
MSF30422.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to effectively engage in environmentally sustainable work practices. It includes identifying environmental regulations applicable to the workplace, implementing procedures to support sustainable practices, and seeking opportunities to improve environmental performance.

MSF30422.name: Communicate in the workplace

MSF30422.name: Work in a team
MSF30422.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge required to work cooperatively with others in a workplace setting. It includes understanding team goals, contributing to team activities, and supporting team members to achieve objectives.

MSF30422.desc: This unit specifies the mandatory work health and safety (WHS) training required prior to undertaking construction work. MSF30422.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to safely move single glass sheets using mechanical equipment. It includes planning the movement, selecting appropriate equipment, and adhering to safety procedures to prevent damage to the glass and injury to personnel.

MSF30422.name: Install residential windows and doors
MSF30422.desc: This unit covers the competencies required to install residential windows and doors. It involves preparing the worksite, selecting and using appropriate tools and materials, installing window and door units, and ensuring installations comply with relevant standards and specifications.

MSF30422.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge necessary to install commercial glazing products. MSF30422.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge required to assemble components for glazing products. It includes identifying work requirements, preparing materials and work areas, and assembling glazing components according to specifications and safety standards.

MSF30422.desc: This unit describes the competencies needed to accurately read and interpret various work documents within the furnishing industry. MSF30422.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to work safely on scaffolding at heights greater than two metres. AUR30620.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to use and maintain tools and equipment in an automotive workplace. AUR30620.desc: This unit describes the performance outcomes required to diagnose and repair faults in light vehicle hydraulic braking systems. It involves preparing for the task, diagnosing and repairing hydraulic braking system faults, and completing workplace processes and documentation.

AUR30620.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to inspect and service automatic transmissions in light vehicles. This unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

AUR30620.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to inspect and service manual transmissions in light vehicles. AUR30620.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to diagnose and repair faults in light vehicle drive shafts. It involves preparing for the task, diagnosing emission control system faults, repairing or replacing faulty components, and completing workplace processes and documentation. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

AUR30620.name: Follow safe working practices in an automotive workplace
AUR30620.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to apply safe working practices in an automotive workplace. It includes identifying and following workplace procedures for hazard identification and risk control, contributing to arrangements for managing occupational health and safety, and completing workplace safety documentation. The unit applies to those working in all sectors of the automotive industry.

AUR30620.name: Test and repair basic electrical circuits
AUR30620.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to test and repair basic electrical circuits in vehicles, vessels, or machinery. It includes preparing for the task, testing electrical circuits, repairing faulty circuits, and completing workplace processes and documentation. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

AUR30620.name: Diagnose and repair starting systems
AUR30620.desc: This unit describes the performance outcomes required to diagnose and repair faults in starting systems of vehicles, vessels, or machinery. It involves preparing for the task, diagnosing starting system faults, repairing or replacing faulty components, and completing workplace processes and documentation. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

AUR30620.name: Diagnose and repair ignition systems
AUR30620.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to diagnose and repair faults in ignition systems of vehicles, vessels, or machinery. It includes preparing for the task, diagnosing ignition system faults, repairing or replacing faulty components, and completing workplace processes and documentation. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

AUR30620.name: Diagnose and repair light vehicle final drive assemblies
AUR30620.desc: This unit describes the performance outcomes required to diagnose and repair faults in light vehicle final drive assemblies. It involves preparing for the task, diagnosing final drive assembly faults, repairing or replacing faulty components, and completing workplace processes and documentation. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

AUR30620.name: Diagnose and repair cooling systems
AUR30620.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to diagnose and repair faults in cooling systems of vehicles, vessels, or machinery. It includes preparing for the task, diagnosing cooling system faults, repairing or replacing faulty components, and completing workplace processes and documentation. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

AUR30620.name: Carry out servicing operations
AUR30620.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to carry out servicing operations on vehicles, vessels, or machinery. It includes preparing for the task, carrying out routine servicing operations, and completing workplace processes and documentation. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

AUR30620.name: Inspect and service engines
AUR30620.desc: This unit describes the performance outcomes required to inspect and service engines in light vehicles. It involves preparing for the task, inspecting the engine, servicing the engine, and completing workplace processes and documentation. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

AUR30620.name: Use and maintain measuring equipment in an automotive workplace
AUR30620.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to select, use, and maintain measuring equipment in an automotive workplace. It includes preparing for the task, selecting and using measuring equipment, maintaining measuring equipment, and completing workplace processes and documentation. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

AUR30620.name: Diagnose and repair light vehicle manual transmissions
AUR30620.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to diagnose and repair faults in light vehicle manual transmissions. It includes preparing for the task, diagnosing manual transmission faults, repairing or replacing faulty components, and completing workplace processes and documentation. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

AUR30620.name: Diagnose and repair light vehicle automatic transmissions
AUR30620.desc: This unit describes the performance outcomes required to diagnose and repair faults in light vehicle automatic transmissions. It involves preparing for the task, diagnosing automatic transmission faults, repairing or replacing faulty components, and completing workplace processes and documentation. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry.

AHC30921.name: Install drainage systems
AHC30921.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to install surface and subsurface drainage systems in various settings, such as agricultural or horticultural environments. This includes tasks like interpreting drainage plans, preparing the site, selecting appropriate materials, installing drainage components, and ensuring the system functions effectively. The unit emphasises adherence to safety protocols and environmental considerations throughout the installation process.

AHC30921.name: Set out site for construction works
AHC30921.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to accurately set out sites for construction activities. This involves interpreting site plans and specifications, identifying existing site features, marking out proposed construction works, establishing survey benchmarks, and verifying site levels to ensure alignment with project requirements. The unit emphasises the application of mathematical and geometrical principles, the use of appropriate tools and surveying instruments, and adherence to workplace health and safety protocols throughout the site set-out process.

AHC30921.name: Construct brick and block structures and features
AHC30921.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to build brick and block structures in landscaping and construction settings. This includes interpreting site plans and specifications, selecting appropriate materials, setting up profiles, applying bonding techniques, cutting bricks or blocks, and ensuring structural integrity. The unit emphasises adherence to Australian standards, workplace health and safety requirements, and environmental considerations throughout the construction process.

AHC30921.name: Construct stone structures and features, and install stone cladding
AHC30921.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to build stone structures and features, as well as to install stone cladding, within landscape project works. This encompasses tasks such as interpreting site plans and specifications, preparing the site, selecting and preparing stone materials, constructing stone structures using various techniques, installing stone cladding, and ensuring the quality of finished work. The unit emphasises adherence to safety protocols, environmental considerations, and the use of appropriate tools and equipment throughout the construction process.

AHC30921.name: Implement a paving project
AHC30921.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to execute paving projects in landscaping and construction contexts. This encompasses interpreting site plans and specifications, preparing the site, selecting and utilising appropriate materials, setting out and excavating the area, installing base and bedding materials, laying pavers in designated patterns, and ensuring proper finishing and quality control. The unit emphasises adherence to workplace health and safety protocols, environmental considerations, and the effective use of tools and equipment throughout the paving process.

AHC30921.name: Construct landscape features using concrete
AHC30921.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to construct concrete structures and features as components of landscape projects. This includes tasks such as interpreting site plans and specifications, preparing the site, setting out and installing formwork, mixing and pouring concrete, applying various finishing techniques, and ensuring the quality of the completed work. The unit emphasises adherence to workplace health and safety requirements, environmental considerations, and the proper use of tools and equipment throughout the construction process.

AHC30921.name: Implement a retaining wall project
AHC30921.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to execute retaining wall projects within landscape construction. This involves interpreting site plans and specifications, calculating material and resource requirements, establishing survey benchmarks, excavating to specified soil levels, constructing retaining walls using appropriate tools and equipment, and ensuring the quality of the completed work. The unit emphasises adherence to workplace health and safety requirements, including the use of personal protective equipment (PPE), and environmental considerations throughout the project implementation.

AHC30921.name: Provide information on plants and their culture
AHC30921.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to effectively communicate plant-related information to clients.
