This includes identifying client needs, researching and selecting appropriate plant solutions, and conveying cultural requirements such as planting techniques, maintenance practices, and pest management. The unit emphasises the importance of clear communication, attentive listening, and the use of reliable reference materials to ensure clients receive accurate and helpful advice.

AHC30921.name: Implement a plant establishment program
AHC30921.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to establish planting areas in various environments. This includes preparing the site, selecting appropriate plant species, implementing planting techniques, providing post-planting care, and reviewing the establishment process to ensure plant health and growth. The unit emphasises adherence to workplace health and safety protocols, environmental considerations, and the effective use of tools and equipment throughout the plant establishment process.

AHC30921.name: Implement soil improvements for garden and turf areas
AHC30921.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to enhance soil quality to support healthy plant growth in garden beds and turf areas. This involves collecting and testing soil samples to assess their physical and chemical characteristics, determining necessary soil improvements, and implementing appropriate treatments to optimise soil conditions. The unit emphasises adherence to workplace health and safety protocols, environmental considerations, and the effective use of tools and equipment throughout the soil improvement process.

AHC30921.name: Apply WHS requirements, policies and procedures in the construction industry
AHC30921.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to adhere to work health and safety (WHS) protocols within construction settings. This encompasses identifying and assessing risks, recognising hazardous materials (including asbestos), planning and implementing safe work practices, and responding effectively to emergencies. The unit emphasises compliance with legislative requirements and workplace procedures to ensure personal safety and the safety of others on construction sites.

AHC30921.name: Erect and dismantle formwork for footings and slabs on ground
AHC30921.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to construct and disassemble formwork for on-ground footings and slabs in compliance with the National Construction Code (NCC), Australian Standards, and work health and safety (WHS) regulations. This involves tasks such as interpreting construction plans, preparing the site, selecting appropriate materials, assembling formwork to specified dimensions, applying release agents, and safely dismantling and storing formwork components post-construction. The unit emphasises adherence to safety protocols, environmental considerations, and the effective use of tools and equipment throughout the process.

AHC30921.name: Cost a project
AHC30921.desc: This unit equips supervisors and managers with the skills and knowledge required to accurately estimate and document project costs, including materials, resources, services, consultants, and contractors. This process involves identifying project objectives, determining necessary resources, calculating individual itemised costs, and preparing a comprehensive financial summary for approval. The unit emphasises adherence to organisational guidelines, legislative requirements, and the effective use of appropriate tools and technology throughout the costing process.

AHC30921.name: Maintain roof gardens, vertical gardens and green facades
AHC30921.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to effectively maintain various types of green infrastructure, including roof gardens, vertical gardens, and green facades. This involves tasks such as assessing plant health, implementing appropriate irrigation and fertilisation regimes, managing pests and diseases, and performing routine maintenance to ensure the vitality and aesthetic appeal of these installations. The unit emphasises adherence to workplace health and safety protocols, environmental considerations, and the use of appropriate tools and equipment throughout the maintenance process.

AHC30921.name: Finish concrete
AHC30921.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to apply finishing techniques to concrete surfaces to meet job specifications. This includes tasks such as trowelling, floating, and applying surface treatments to achieve the desired finish. The unit emphasises adherence to work health and safety (WHS) regulations, environmental considerations, and the effective use of tools and equipment throughout the concrete finishing process.

AHC30921.name: Cure concrete
AHC30921.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to perform the initial curing process on poured concrete to control moisture evaporation and ensure optimal strength and durability. This involves applying appropriate curing methods and agents in accordance with engineering specifications to maintain the necessary moisture and temperature conditions during the concrete's early stages of setting. The unit emphasises adherence to work health and safety (WHS) regulations, environmental considerations, and the effective use of tools and equipment throughout the curing process.

AHC30921.name: Install synthetic textile floor coverings to sports facilities and outdoor spaces
AHC30921.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to install synthetic textile floor coverings, such as synthetic turf and needle-punch carpets, in both indoor and outdoor sports facilities and recreational areas. This includes tasks like preparing the subfloor, cutting and laying materials, joining seams, applying adhesives, and finishing the installation to meet specific design and functional requirements. The unit emphasises adherence to workplace health and safety protocols, environmental considerations, and the effective use of tools and equipment throughout the installation process.

CPC30620.name: Handle and store painting and decorating materials
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on the essential skills and knowledge required to safely and effectively manage materials used in painting and decorating tasks. This includes understanding the correct procedures for handling, storing, and disposing of various materials to maintain safety standards and ensure the quality of work. The unit is applicable to individuals working in the construction industry, particularly those involved in painting and decorating roles. It emphasises the importance of adhering to safety regulations and environmental considerations when dealing with painting materials.

CPC30620.name: Work safely to encapsulate non-friable asbestos in the painting industry
CPC30620.desc: This unit equips individuals with the necessary skills and knowledge to safely manage and encapsulate non-friable asbestos materials encountered during painting and decorating tasks. This involves identifying asbestos-containing materials, selecting appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE), preparing work areas to prevent asbestos disturbance, and applying suitable encapsulation products to seal asbestos fibres effectively. The unit emphasises adherence to work health and safety (WHS) regulations, environmental considerations, and manufacturers’ specifications to ensure safe and compliant work practices within the painting industry.

CPC30620.name: Prepare uncoated surfaces for painting
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to effectively prepare various uncoated surfaces for painting applications. This involves assessing and testing the condition of substrates, selecting appropriate preparation methods, removing contaminants, and repairing surfaces to achieve a smooth finish ready for painting. The unit emphasises adherence to Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and environmental considerations, ensuring that all preparation work meets industry requirements and quality standards.

CPC30620.name: Work safely at heights
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the essential skills and knowledge to perform tasks at heights on construction sites safely. This includes identifying task requirements, selecting and inspecting appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE), assessing work areas for potential hazards, and implementing control measures to prevent falls. The unit also covers the correct use of fall protection equipment, safe methods for accessing and traversing work areas at height, and adherence to workplace and regulatory requirements. It is applicable to various construction activities, including new builds, renovations, refurbishments, and maintenance work, ensuring that workers can effectively manage the risks associated with working at heights.

CPC30620.name: Apply decorative paint finishes
CPC30620.desc: This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to apply various decorative paint finishes to different material surfaces. This includes preparing the application area, applying mirror paint finishes, creating broken colour effects, utilising modern acrylic finishes, performing lining by brush, executing basic stencilling, and implementing basic special effects. The unit also covers the completion of clean-up activities, ensuring all tasks are performed in accordance with work health and safety (WHS) regulations, environmental plans, manufacturers’ specifications, and workplace requirements.

CPC30620.name: Erect and maintain trestle and plank systems
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely set up and maintain trestle and plank work platforms commonly used in painting and decorating tasks. This includes planning and preparing the worksite, selecting appropriate equipment, inspecting components for serviceability, correctly positioning trestles and planks to meet Australian standards, and conducting regular inspections to ensure safety and stability during use. The unit emphasises adherence to work health and safety (WHS) regulations and environmental considerations, ensuring that all tasks are performed in compliance with industry standards and workplace requirements.

CPC30620.name: Match specific paint colours
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on developing the skills and knowledge required to accurately match new and existing paint finishes to specified colour samples. This involves determining the paint type and sheen level, selecting appropriate paint bases and colourants, mixing and testing the paint to achieve the desired colour, and recording the details of the colourants used. The unit emphasises adherence to work health and safety (WHS) regulations, environmental considerations, and manufacturers’ specifications, ensuring that all tasks are performed in compliance with industry standards and workplace requirements.

CPC30620.name: Carry out measurements and calculations
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the essential skills and knowledge to perform basic measurements and calculations within a construction environment. This includes selecting and using appropriate measuring equipment, obtaining accurate linear measurements, and applying basic mathematical formulas to calculate quantities related to weight, area, volume, perimeter, circumference, ratio, and percentage. The unit also covers converting measurements between metres and millimetres, ensuring precision in determining task and material requirements. Adherence to work health and safety (WHS) regulations and environmental considerations is emphasised throughout the unit to maintain compliance with industry standards and workplace requirements.

CPC30620.name: Prepare existing coated surface for painting
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to restore, repair, and prepare previously coated surfaces for new paint applications. This involves assessing the condition of existing substrates, performing adhesion tests, selecting appropriate preparation methods, removing unwanted coatings and loose debris, repairing surface defects, and applying suitable primers to achieve a smooth finish ready for painting. The unit emphasises adherence to Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, environmental considerations, and manufacturers’ specifications, ensuring that all tasks are performed in compliance with industry standards and workplace requirements.

CPC30620.name: Use painting and decorating tools and equipment
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to select, use, store, and maintain a variety of tools and equipment commonly employed in painting and decorating tasks. This includes understanding the functions, limitations, and safe operation methods of both hand and power tools, as well as adhering to work health and safety (WHS) regulations and environmental considerations. The unit is suitable for those with basic skills and knowledge undertaking routine work tasks under the direction of more experienced workers.

CPC30620.name: Remove and apply wallpaper
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to effectively remove existing wallpaper and apply new wallpaper to various surfaces. This includes preparing the work area, selecting appropriate tools and materials, removing old wall coverings, preparing surfaces for new wallpaper, and applying wallpaper ensuring an even surface with properly aligned patterns and seams. The unit emphasises adherence to work health and safety (WHS) regulations, environmental considerations, and manufacturers’ specifications, ensuring that all tasks are performed in compliance with industry standards and workplace requirements.

CPC30620.name: Read and interpret plans and specifications
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to accurately read and interpret construction plans and specifications at a basic level. This includes understanding key features and functions of various construction drawings, identifying symbols and abbreviations, verifying amendments, and locating key site features from site plans. The unit also covers identifying project requirements such as construction types, dimensions, environmental controls, standards of work, and required materials. Adherence to work health and safety (WHS) regulations and environmental considerations is emphasised throughout the unit to maintain compliance with industry standards and workplace requirements.

CPC30620.name: Apply stains and clear timber finishes
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to apply stains and clear finishes to timber surfaces, including previously treated timber, to achieve a protective and decorative finish. This involves preparing the work area and materials, staining bare timber, applying clear finishes, and completing clean-up activities. The unit emphasises adherence to work health and safety (WHS) regulations, environmental considerations, and manufacturers’ specifications, ensuring that all tasks are performed in compliance with industry standards and workplace requirements.

CPC30620.name: Remove and replace doors and door and window components
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely and effectively remove and replace doors, as well as door and window furniture, for painting or replacement purposes. This includes planning and preparing the work area, removing and storing screens and fittings, uninstalling and reinstalling door and window furniture, handling and replacing glass panes, and ensuring all tasks are performed in compliance with work health and safety (WHS) regulations and environmental considerations. The unit is suitable for those with basic skills and knowledge undertaking routine work tasks under the direction of more experienced workers.

CPC30620.name: Operate elevated work platforms up to 11 metres
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely and effectively operate specific types of elevated work platforms (EWPs) in various locations, including uneven terrain. This includes tasks such as locating, setting up, operating, and shutting down scissor lifts and self-propelled boom lifts with a boom length under 11 metres. The unit emphasises adherence to work health and safety (WHS) regulations, environmental considerations, and manufacturers’ specifications, ensuring that all tasks are performed in compliance with industry standards and workplace requirements.

CPC30620.name: Conduct workplace communication
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to communicate effectively within a construction workplace environment. This includes gathering, conveying, and receiving information through verbal and written forms, interpreting work instructions, and participating in simple meeting processes. The unit is suitable for those with basic skills and knowledge undertaking routine work tasks under the direction of more experienced workers. Adherence to work health and safety (WHS) regulations and effective communication practices are emphasised to ensure clarity and efficiency in workplace interactions.

CPC30620.name: Calculate costs of construction work
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to accurately estimate and establish costs for construction projects. This includes determining material quantities, labour requirements, timeframes, and overhead expenses to prepare comprehensive cost estimates and client quotations. The unit emphasises adherence to industry standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and environmental considerations, ensuring that all costing activities are performed in compliance with workplace and statutory requirements.

CPC30620.name: Plan and organise work
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to effectively plan and organise basic work tasks on a construction site. This includes determining work task outcomes, breaking tasks into component activities, estimating time and personnel requirements, identifying necessary tools and equipment, and preparing a written work plan. The unit also emphasises collaboration with team members to review work plans, schedule tasks, allocate roles and responsibilities, and ensure compliance with work health and safety (WHS) requirements. It is suitable for individuals with basic skills and knowledge undertaking routine work tasks under the direction of more experienced workers.

CPC30620.name: Apply paint by spray
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to apply paint using various spray systems in construction settings. This includes planning and preparing the work area, selecting and setting up appropriate spray equipment, preparing materials, applying paint to achieve an even finish, and conducting clean-up activities. The unit emphasises adherence to work health and safety (WHS) regulations, environmental considerations, and manufacturers’ specifications, ensuring that all tasks are performed in compliance with industry standards and workplace requirements.

CPC30620.name: Apply paint by brush and roller
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to apply paint coatings to various surfaces using brushes and rollers. This includes preparing the work area and materials, selecting appropriate tools, mixing and matching paint colours, and applying paint to achieve a uniform and quality finish. The unit also covers cleaning up after painting tasks, maintaining tools and equipment, and adhering to work health and safety (WHS) regulations, environmental considerations, and manufacturers’ specifications to ensure compliance with industry standards and workplace requirements.

CPC30620.name: Apply WHS requirements, policies and procedures in the construction industry
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to implement work health and safety (WHS) requirements through safe work practices in both on-site and off-site construction environments. This includes identifying and assessing risks, recognising hazardous materials (such as asbestos), planning and preparing for safe work practices, applying these practices effectively, and following emergency procedures. The unit emphasises compliance with legislative requirements and workplace policies to ensure personal safety and the safety of others. It is applicable to workers across various sectors within the construction industry and aligns with general construction induction training requirements as specified in the Model Work Health and Safety Regulations 2011.

CPC30620.name: Apply texture coat paint finishes by brush, roller and spray
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to apply texture coat paint finishes to various surfaces using brushes, rollers, and spray equipment. This includes preparing the work area and materials, selecting and setting up appropriate tools and equipment, mixing and adjusting texture coatings, and applying the finishes to achieve the desired texture and appearance. The unit also covers identifying and rectifying defects in coatings, conducting clean-up activities, and adhering to work health and safety (WHS) regulations, environmental considerations, and manufacturers’ specifications to ensure compliance with industry standards and workplace requirements.

CPC30620.name: Work safely with lead-painted surfaces in the painting industry
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely identify, manage, and treat lead-based paint hazards in painting and decorating tasks. This includes hazard identification, preparation of the work area, removal or encapsulation of contaminated materials, and completion of clean-up activities. The unit emphasises adherence to work health and safety (WHS) regulations, environmental considerations, and compliance with relevant legislation to ensure safe and effective handling of lead-painted surfaces.

CPC30620.name: Organise finances for new business ventures
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to effectively manage the financial aspects of establishing a new business. This includes planning financial requirements, identifying funding options, developing budgets, maintaining financial records, and ensuring compliance with financial regulations. The unit emphasises the importance of sound financial management practices to support the viability and growth of new business ventures.

CPC30620.name: Work effectively and sustainably in the construction industry
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to operate efficiently and sustainably within the construction sector. This includes effective teamwork, understanding employment pathways, and adhering to environmental and resource efficiency requirements. The unit is suitable for those with basic skills and knowledge undertaking routine work tasks under the direction of more experienced workers.

CPC30620.name: Apply protective paint coating systems
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to apply specialised paint coatings that protect surfaces from atmospheric conditions, sanitation and hygiene risks, and the impacts of high-traffic areas. This involves planning and preparing the work area, selecting appropriate materials, preparing surfaces, applying the protective coating system, and conducting clean-up activities. The unit emphasises adherence to work health and safety (WHS) regulations, environmental considerations, and manufacturers’ specifications, ensuring that all tasks are performed in compliance with industry standards and workplace requirements.

CPC30620.name: Apply trowelled texture coat finishes
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to mix and apply trowelled texture coat finishes to various substrates. This process involves planning and preparing the work area, selecting appropriate materials, preparing the substrate, mixing texture coating materials to the designed proportion and consistency, applying the texture coat uniformly using a trowel, and ensuring the finish is plumb and level. The unit also covers curing the texture coat according to weather and temperature conditions, and conducting clean-up activities in compliance with environmental and safety regulations. Adherence to work health and safety (WHS) regulations, environmental considerations, and manufacturers’ specifications is emphasised to ensure compliance with industry standards and workplace requirements.

CPC30620.name: Erect and dismantle restricted height scaffolding
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely and effectively erect and dismantle modular scaffolding systems up to a height of 4 metres. This includes planning and preparing the work area, selecting and inspecting appropriate equipment, erecting scaffolding in accordance with regulations and manufacturer specifications, inspecting and repairing scaffolding components, and safely dismantling the scaffolding upon task completion. The unit emphasises adherence to work health and safety (WHS) regulations, environmental considerations, and compliance with industry standards to ensure safe and efficient work practices.

CPC30620.name: Manage finances for new business ventures
CPC30620.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to implement and review financial management strategies for new business ventures. This includes using new and emerging digital technologies, interpreting financial reports, and analysing numerical data to make informed financial decisions. Key components of this unit involve producing financial budgets or projections, developing plans to manage business capital, ensuring adequate financial provisions for taxation, and monitoring financial performance through key performance indicators (KPIs). The unit applies to those establishing a business for self-employment, as well as individuals setting up new ventures within larger organisations.

CPC32420.name: Erect and dismantle restricted height scaffolding
CPC32420.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to safely and effectively assemble and disassemble scaffolding systems up to a specified height, typically not exceeding four metres. This includes understanding regulatory requirements, selecting appropriate equipment, conducting risk assessments, and implementing safety measures to ensure a secure working environment. Competency in this unit is essential for construction workers who need to perform tasks at heights within the restricted parameters, ensuring compliance with Australian safety standards and contributing to overall site safety.

CPC32420.name: Work safely at heights
CPC32420.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to work safely on construction sites where there is a potential to fall from one level to another. This includes identifying task requirements, assessing work areas, selecting and using appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE), and implementing fall protection measures. Competency in this unit is essential for construction workers to ensure safety when working at heights, in compliance with Australian safety standards and regulations.

CPC32420.name: Carry out interactive workplace communication
CPC32420.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to effectively engage in interactive communication within the workplace. This includes understanding and applying communication techniques, interpreting and conveying information accurately, and participating in discussions to achieve work outcomes. Competency in this unit is essential for workers to ensure clear and effective communication, contributing to efficient and safe workplace operations.

CPC32420.name: Read plans, calculate quantities and mark out materials
CPC32420.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to read and interpret construction and plumbing plans and specifications, calculate material quantities, and accurately mark out materials. This includes understanding drawing conventions, selecting appropriate tools and equipment, and applying measurement and calculation principles. Competency in this unit is essential for plumbing professionals to ensure precise material preparation and adherence to project specifications, contributing to efficient and effective construction processes.

CPC32420.name: Work effectively in the plumbing services sector
CPC32420.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to perform effectively within the plumbing services sector. This includes understanding industry employment conditions, responsibilities, and obligations; complying with relevant legislation, regulations, standards, and codes of practice; and applying specific work health and safety (WHS) requirements. Competency in this unit is essential for plumbing professionals to ensure efficient and safe workplace performance, contributing to overall industry standards and public health and safety.

CPC32420.name: Carry out WHS requirements
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to comply with work health and safety (WHS) requirements in the plumbing and services sector. It encompasses identifying and following workplace procedures for hazard identification and risk control, contributing to WHS consultative processes, and responding to incidents.

CPC32420.name: Handle and store plumbing materials
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to safely handle and store plumbing materials, addressing environmental concerns and associated hazards, including waste disposal. It involves selecting appropriate tools and equipment, ensuring their serviceability, and using personal protective equipment (PPE) correctly. The unit also covers identifying and storing materials to prevent damage and cross-contamination, erecting signage and barricades to isolate stored materials, and safely transporting materials in compliance with safety data sheets (SDS) and regulatory requirements. Additionally, it includes procedures for cleaning up spills, disposing of waste, and maintaining tools and equipment.

CPC32420.name: Use plumbing hand and power tools
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to use commonly used hand and power tools in plumbing work applications. It involves preparing to use these tools by identifying work health and safety (WHS) and environmental requirements, selecting appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE), and ensuring tools are serviceable and safe. The unit covers the safe and effective use of hand and power tools according to manufacturer’s specifications and workplace procedures, as well as the proper storage and maintenance of tools and equipment after use.

CPC32420.name: Carry out levelling
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to conduct levelling procedures in plumbing work. It encompasses setting up and using levelling devices, recording and interpreting readings, and transferring levels accurately to ensure compliance with project specifications and standards.

CPC32420.name: Cut and join sheet metal
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the competencies required to cut and join sheet metal in the plumbing and services industry. It involves interpreting job specifications, selecting appropriate materials and tools, accurately marking out and cutting sheet metal, and employing suitable joining techniques to assemble components in compliance with industry standards and safety regulations.

CPC32420.name: Weld using metal arc welding equipment
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to weld using metal arc welding equipment in plumbing work. It covers preparing materials and equipment, performing welding tasks, and ensuring quality and safety standards are met. Competency in this unit ensures that individuals can effectively and safely carry out welding tasks as part of plumbing operations.

CPC32420.name: Carry out simple concreting and rendering
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to perform minor concreting and rendering tasks in plumbing applications. It encompasses preparing materials, placing and finishing concrete, applying render, and adhering to safety and environmental standards. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively undertake basic concreting and rendering tasks as part of plumbing projects.

CPC32420.name: Work safely on roofs
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to work safely on roofing structures. It includes identifying work requirements, preparing for work, installing and using fall prevention systems, and adhering to safety protocols. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively and safely perform tasks on roofs, complying with relevant regulations and standards.

CPC32420.name: Flash penetrations through roofs and walls
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to set out, cut, and flash penetrations through roofs and walls for plumbing installations. It involves interpreting plans, selecting appropriate materials, and applying flashing techniques to ensure watertight and compliant installations. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively manage roof and wall penetrations, maintaining the integrity of structures and adhering to Australian standards.

CPC32420.name: Weld polymer pipes using fusion method
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to fusion weld polymer pipes, including polyethylene and polypropylene, for plumbing applications. It encompasses preparing joints, conducting test welds, performing fusion welding, and inspecting completed welds to ensure compliance with Australian standards and manufacturer specifications. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively and safely weld polymer pipes using fusion methods, maintaining the integrity of plumbing systems.

CPC32420.name: Fabricate and install non-ferrous pressure piping
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to fabricate and install non-ferrous pressure piping, such as copper, in plumbing systems. It involves interpreting job plans and specifications, selecting appropriate materials, setting up and using silver brazing equipment, and ensuring installations comply with relevant codes and standards. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively and safely install non-ferrous pressure piping systems in accordance with Australian regulations.

CPC32420.name: Prepare simple drawings
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to produce onsite drawings for plumbing services work. It involves identifying key features through consultation and reference to plans, selecting suitable views, and applying standard drawing conventions, including relevant codes and standards, to create simple sketches and drawings. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively prepare clear and accurate 2D plan, schematic, isometric, and sectional drawings, complete with appropriate notations and labelling, for plumbing installations.

CPC32420.name: Locate and clear blockages
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to install trench support systems to ensure safety during excavation work. It involves assessing site conditions, selecting appropriate support methods, installing trench supports, and complying with safety regulations to prevent ground collapse. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively and safely implement trench support measures in accordance with Australian standards.

CPC32420.name: Install stormwater and sub-soil drainage systems and drain work site
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to locate and clear blockages in drainage systems. It involves identifying the location and cause of blockages, selecting and using appropriate tools and equipment, and applying safe and effective methods to remove obstructions. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can maintain the functionality of drainage systems by efficiently resolving blockages in compliance with Australian standards.

CPC32420.name: Install prefabricated inspection openings and inspection chambers
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to install prefabricated inspection openings and inspection chambers in new or existing domestic or commercial contexts. It involves interpreting job plans and specifications, selecting appropriate materials and tools, marking out and excavating sites, installing prefabricated concrete or polymer inspection openings and chambers, and connecting inlet and outlet pipes in compliance with relevant codes, Australian standards, and manufacturer’s specifications. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively and safely install inspection openings and chambers, facilitating access for maintenance and inspection of drainage systems.

CPC32420.name: Install prefabricated inspection openings and inspection chambers
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to plan the layout and install below-ground sanitary drainage systems for sewage and waste discharge from sanitary fixtures to approved connection points in new or existing domestic and commercial structures. It involves interpreting job plans and specifications, selecting appropriate materials, setting out fixture locations, excavating trenches, fabricating and installing pipework, and ensuring compliance with relevant Australian standards and codes. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively and safely install sanitary drainage systems, maintaining the integrity and functionality of plumbing infrastructure.

CPC32420.name: Install on-site domestic wastewater treatment plants and disposal systems
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to install on-site domestic wastewater treatment plants and disposal systems. It involves interpreting job plans and specifications, selecting appropriate materials, setting out and excavating sites, installing treatment plants and disposal systems, and ensuring compliance with relevant codes, Australian standards, and manufacturer’s specifications. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively and safely install on-site domestic wastewater treatment systems, maintaining environmental and public health standards.

CPC32420.name: Plan layout and install vacuum drainage systems
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to plan the layout and install vacuum drainage systems for sewage and waste discharge in new or existing domestic and commercial structures. It involves interpreting job specifications, selecting appropriate materials, setting out levels and heights, installing vacuum drainage pipes, and ensuring compliance with relevant Australian standards and codes. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively and safely implement vacuum drainage systems, maintaining the integrity and functionality of plumbing infrastructure.

CPC32420.name: Fabricate and install fire hydrant and hose reel systems
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to fabricate and install fire hydrant and hose reel systems in new or existing structures. It involves interpreting job plans and specifications, selecting appropriate materials, setting out systems, connecting fire brigade suction and booster arrangements, fitting pipework and supports, installing fire hydrant valves, hose reels, and ancillary equipment, and performing hydrostatic tests to ensure compliance with relevant codes, Australian Standards, and manufacturer’s specifications. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively and safely install fire hydrant and hose reel systems, maintaining the integrity and functionality of fire protection infrastructure.

CPC32420.name: Install residential life safety sprinkler systems
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to fabricate and install fire hydrant and hose reel systems in various structures. It involves interpreting plans and specifications, selecting appropriate materials, installing pipework and supports, connecting fire hydrant valves and hose reels, and ensuring compliance with relevant Australian standards and codes. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively and safely implement fire hydrant and hose reel systems, maintaining essential fire protection measures within buildings.

CPC32420.name: Test and maintain fire hydrant and hose reel installations
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to install life safety sprinkler systems in residential buildings. It involves interpreting plans and specifications, selecting appropriate materials, installing pipework and sprinkler heads, and ensuring compliance with relevant Australian standards and codes. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively and safely implement residential sprinkler systems, enhancing fire safety within dwellings.

CPC32420.name: Install gas pressure control equipment
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to test and maintain fire hydrant and hose reel installations. It involves conducting routine inspections, identifying and rectifying faults, performing flow and pressure tests, and ensuring compliance with relevant Australian standards and codes. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively maintain the operational readiness and safety of fire hydrant and hose reel systems.

CPC32420.name: Install gas appliance flues
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to install gas pressure control equipment in gas systems. It involves interpreting plans and specifications, selecting appropriate materials and equipment, installing pressure regulators and associated components, and ensuring compliance with relevant Australian standards and codes. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively and safely manage gas pressure control installations, maintaining the integrity and safety of gas systems.

CPC32420.name: Purge consumer piping
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to purge consumer gas piping systems greater than 0.03 cubic metres (30 litres) in volume. It involves preparing for the purging process, selecting appropriate purging mediums and methods, conducting the purge in accordance with safety protocols, and ensuring compliance with relevant Australian standards and codes. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can safely and effectively remove unwanted gases from consumer piping systems, maintaining system integrity and safety.

CPC32420.name: Maintain Type A gas appliances
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to maintain Type A gas appliances, which are domestic and light commercial gas appliances with a gas consumption not exceeding 500 megajoules per hour. It involves conducting routine servicing, diagnosing faults, repairing or replacing components, and ensuring appliances operate safely and efficiently in compliance with relevant Australian standards and codes. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively maintain the performance and safety of Type A gas appliances.

CPC32420.name: Disconnect and reconnect Type A gas appliances
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to safely disconnect and reconnect Type A gas appliances, such as domestic and light commercial appliances with a gas consumption not exceeding 500 megajoules per hour. It involves preparing for the task, isolating gas and other services, disconnecting and reconnecting appliances, and conducting tests to ensure safe operation in compliance with relevant Australian standards and codes. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively manage the disconnection and reconnection of Type A gas appliances, maintaining safety and functionality within gas systems.

CPC32420.name: Calculate and install natural ventilation for Type A gas appliances
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to calculate and install natural ventilation for Type A gas appliances, ensuring adequate airflow for safe operation. It involves assessing installation sites, determining ventilation requirements based on appliance specifications and relevant standards, and implementing appropriate ventilation solutions. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively design and install natural ventilation systems that comply with Australian standards, maintaining safety and efficiency in gas appliance installations.

CPC32420.name: Install gas sub-meters
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to install gas sub-meters in consumer gas installations. It involves preparing for the installation, selecting appropriate materials and equipment, installing sub-meters according to manufacturer specifications, and ensuring compliance with relevant Australian standards and codes. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively and safely install gas sub-meters, facilitating accurate measurement and monitoring of gas usage within a property.

CPC32420.name: Size and install consumer gas piping systems
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to install gas sub-meters in consumer gas installations. It involves preparing for the installation, selecting appropriate materials and equipment, installing sub-meters according to manufacturer specifications, and ensuring compliance with relevant Australian standards and codes. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively and safely install gas sub-meters, facilitating accurate measurement and monitoring of gas usage within a property.

CPC32420.name: Install LPG storage of aggregate storage capacity up to 500 litres
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to select, install, and test liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) storage facilities with a capacity up to 500 litres. It involves interpreting job plans and specifications, selecting appropriate materials, installing cylinders and associated pipework, conducting tests to ensure system integrity, and ensuring compliance with relevant Australian standards and codes. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively and safely manage LPG storage installations, maintaining safety and functionality within gas systems.

CPC32420.name: Install LPG storage of aggregate storage capacity exceeding 500 litres and less than 8 kilolitres
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to install liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) storage systems with an aggregate capacity exceeding 500 litres and less than 8 kilolitres. It involves planning the installation, selecting appropriate materials and equipment, positioning and securing storage containers, installing associated piping and regulators, conducting tests to ensure system integrity, and ensuring compliance with relevant Australian standards, codes, and jurisdictional requirements. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively and safely install medium-capacity LPG storage systems, maintaining safety and functionality within gas installations.

CPC32420.name: Install and commission Type A gas appliances
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to install and commission certified Type A gas appliances, which are domestic and light commercial appliances with a gas consumption not exceeding 500 megajoules per hour. It involves interpreting plans and specifications, selecting appropriate materials, installing appliances, testing for safe operation, and ensuring compliance with relevant Australian standards and codes. Competency in this unit ensures individuals can effectively and safely install and commission Type A gas appliances, maintaining safety and functionality within gas systems.

CPC32420.name: Design domestic urban irrigation systems
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to design irrigation systems for domestic urban landscapes. It encompasses assessing site conditions, selecting appropriate irrigation components, and developing system layouts that ensure efficient water distribution tailored to the specific needs of residential gardens and lawns.

CPC32420.name: Set out, install and commission irrigation systems
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the competencies required to set out, install, and commission irrigation systems in various settings. It involves interpreting plans and specifications, selecting appropriate materials and equipment, installing system components, and ensuring the system operates efficiently and effectively through proper testing and commissioning procedures.

CPC32420.name: Collect and store roof water
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to collect and store roof water, including installing storage tanks and related piping systems. It involves determining site-specific requirements, preparing the worksite, installing inlet connections with appropriate filtration devices, and connecting tank overflows to approved stormwater discharge points, ensuring compliance with relevant Australian Standards and codes.

CPC32420.name: Fabricate and install roof drainage systems
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to fabricate and install roof drainage systems and associated rainwater components. It involves interpreting plans and specifications, selecting appropriate materials, fabricating components such as gutters and downpipes, and installing them to ensure effective roof drainage. The unit also covers compliance with relevant Australian Standards, codes, and work health and safety (WHS) requirements.

CPC32420.name: Fabricate and install external flashings
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to fabricate and install external flashings for roof and ceiling installations. It involves interpreting plans and specifications, selecting appropriate materials, measuring and cutting flashings to fit specific angles and profiles, and installing them to ensure weatherproofing and durability. The unit also covers compliance with relevant Australian Standards, codes, and work health and safety (WHS) requirements.

CPC32420.name: Install roof components
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to install roof components, including flashing penetrations to maintain weatherproofing. It involves interpreting installation requirements from job specifications, relevant Australian Standards, codes, and manufacturers’ instructions; preparing the work area by selecting appropriate materials, tools, and equipment; and performing the installation, fixing, and sealing of roofing components. The unit also covers compliance with workplace, work health and safety (WHS), and environmental requirements.

CPC32420.name: Plan the layout of a residential sanitary plumbing system and fabricate and install sanitary stacks
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to plan the layout of a residential sanitary plumbing system for a three-storey residence, and to fabricate and install sanitary stacks. It involves interpreting plans and specifications, selecting appropriate materials, and ensuring compliance with relevant Australian Standards and codes. The unit also covers work health and safety (WHS) requirements and the principles of sanitary plumbing systems.

CPC32420.name: Install discharge pipes
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to install discharge pipes, including pipework from soil and wastewater fixtures to a stack or drain. It involves interpreting plans and specifications, selecting appropriate materials, and ensuring compliance with relevant Australian Standards and codes. The unit also covers work health and safety (WHS) requirements and the principles of sanitary plumbing systems.

CPC32420.name: Install pre-treatment facilities
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to install pre-treatment facilities designed to remove contaminants from wastewater before it enters the main treatment system. It involves interpreting plans and specifications, selecting appropriate materials, and ensuring compliance with relevant Australian Standards and codes. The unit also covers work health and safety (WHS) requirements and the principles of sanitary plumbing systems.

CPC32420.name: Install sewage pumps
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to install sewerage pumpsets, including small bore macerators, in both domestic and commercial settings. It involves interpreting plans and specifications, selecting appropriate materials, setting out and installing pumping equipment, connecting pipework and controls, and testing the system to ensure compliance with relevant Australian Standards and codes. The unit also covers work health and safety (WHS) requirements and the principles of sanitary plumbing systems.

CPC32420.name: Connect and install storage tanks to a domestic water supply
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to connect and install storage tanks to a domestic water supply. It involves interpreting installation requirements from job specifications, relevant Australian Standards, codes, manufacturers’ instructions, and jurisdictional requirements; preparing the work area by selecting appropriate materials, tools, and equipment; and performing the installation, connection, and testing of storage tanks to ensure compliance. The unit also covers work health and safety (WHS) and environmental requirements.

CPC32420.name: Set out and install water services
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to set out and install water services in both residential and commercial settings. It involves interpreting plans and specifications, selecting appropriate materials, marking out the service layout, installing pipework and fittings, and testing the system to ensure compliance with relevant Australian Standards and codes. The unit also covers work health and safety (WHS) requirements and the principles of water service installations.

CPC32420.name: Install and commission water heating systems and adjust controls and devices
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to install and commission water heating systems, as well as to adjust associated controls and devices. It involves interpreting installation requirements from job specifications, relevant Australian Standards, codes, manufacturers’ instructions, and jurisdictional requirements; preparing the work area by selecting appropriate materials, tools, and equipment; and performing the installation, connection, and testing of water heating systems to ensure compliance. The unit also covers work health and safety (WHS) and environmental requirements.

CPC32420.name: Install water pumpsets
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to install water pumpsets in various settings. It involves interpreting plans and specifications, selecting appropriate materials, setting out and installing pumping equipment, connecting pipework and controls, and testing the system to ensure compliance with relevant Australian Standards and codes. The unit also covers work health and safety (WHS) requirements and the principles of water pump installations.

CPC32420.name: Install and fit off sanitary fixtures, water services and adjust water service controls
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to install and fit off sanitary fixtures, water services, and adjust water service controls. It involves interpreting installation requirements from job specifications, relevant Australian Standards, codes, manufacturers’ instructions, and jurisdictional requirements; preparing the work area by selecting appropriate materials, tools, and equipment; and performing the installation, connection, and testing of sanitary fixtures and water services to ensure compliance. The unit also covers work health and safety (WHS) and environmental requirements.

CPC32420.name: Install backflow prevention devices
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to install backflow prevention devices, which are essential for protecting potable water supplies from contamination due to reverse flow. The unit involves interpreting installation requirements from job specifications, relevant Australian Standards, codes, manufacturers’ instructions, and jurisdictional requirements; preparing the work area by selecting appropriate materials, tools, and equipment; and performing the installation and testing of backflow prevention devices to ensure compliance. It does not include the commissioning or testing of backflow prevention devices or arrangements. The unit also covers work health and safety (WHS) and environmental requirements.

CPC32420.name: Install property service
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to install a property service from the authority water main up to and including the water meter assembly. It involves determining installation requirements, tapping into a minimum DN100 mm water main, connecting a property service to a water meter assembly, and testing and commissioning the installation to ensure compliance with relevant Australian Standards and codes. The unit also covers work health and safety (WHS) requirements and the principles of property service installations.

CPC32420.name: Install water pipe systems
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to install and test water pipe systems with diameters larger than DN65. It involves interpreting installation requirements from job specifications, relevant Australian Standards, codes, manufacturers’ instructions, and jurisdictional requirements; preparing the work area by selecting appropriate materials, tools, and equipment; and performing the installation and testing of large water services to ensure compliance. The unit also covers work health and safety (WHS) and environmental requirements.

CPC32420.name: Install home fire sprinkler systems
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to install home fire sprinkler systems in Class 1a buildings, as defined in the National Construction Code (NCC). It involves interpreting installation requirements from job specifications, relevant Australian Standards, codes, manufacturers’ instructions, and jurisdictional requirements; preparing the work area by selecting appropriate materials, tools, and equipment; and performing the installation, testing, and commissioning of home fire sprinkler systems to ensure compliance. The unit also covers work health and safety (WHS) and environmental requirements.

CPC32420.name: Provide First Aid
CPC32420.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to provide a first aid response to a casualty in line with first aid guidelines determined by the Australian Resuscitation Council (ARC) and other Australian national peak clinical bodies. It is suitable for anyone who may be required to provide a first aid response in a range of settings, including community and workplace settings.

CPC32620.name: Erect and dismantle restricted height scaffolding
CPC32620.desc: Focuses on the skills and knowledge required to safely erect and dismantle modular scaffolding systems up to four metres in height. This includes planning the task, selecting appropriate equipment, establishing secure footings, assembling the scaffold in compliance with safety regulations, inspecting for structural integrity, performing necessary repairs or alterations, and safely dismantling the structure. The unit is applicable across various industries and emphasises teamwork and adherence to workplace safety standards.

CPC32620.name: Work safely at heights
CPC32620.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the necessary skills and knowledge to perform tasks at heights on construction sites, ensuring safety and compliance with regulatory standards. This includes identifying task requirements, selecting and inspecting appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE), assessing work areas for potential hazards, implementing control measures, and effectively using fall protection systems. The unit also covers safe methods for accessing and exiting work areas, maintaining communication during tasks, and adhering to safe work method statements (SWMS). This competency is essential for workers in various industries where there is a risk of falling from one level to another.

CPC32620.name: Operate elevated work platforms up to 11 metres
CPC32620.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to safely and effectively operate specific types of elevated work platforms (EWPs), such as scissor lifts and self-propelled boom lifts with a boom length under 11 metres. This includes tasks such as locating, setting up, operating, and shutting down EWPs in various environments, including uneven terrain. The unit emphasises adherence to safety protocols, proper use of personal protective equipment (PPE), conducting pre-operational checks, and implementing appropriate risk control measures to ensure safe operation during construction activities on residential and commercial work sites.

CPC32620.name: Operate personnel and materials hoists
CPC32620.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely and efficiently operate hoists designed for transporting people and materials to various heights within multi-storey structures. This encompasses conducting pre-operational checks, operating the hoist in accordance with manufacturer and regulatory requirements, performing shutdown procedures, and carrying out post-operational checks to ensure the equipment's integrity and safety. The unit is essential for workers in the construction industry who are responsible for the vertical movement of personnel and materials on-site, emphasising adherence to safety protocols and effective communication with site personnel.

CPC32620.name: Carry out load slinging of off-site materials
CPC32620.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely sling and move materials from off-site locations to designated positions on construction sites. This includes selecting appropriate lifting gear, inspecting equipment for safety, calculating load weights, applying correct slinging techniques, and effectively communicating with crane operators and other personnel to ensure safe and efficient material handling. The unit is essential for workers involved in the transportation and placement of materials in construction settings, emphasising adherence to safety protocols and regulatory requirements.

CPC32620.name: Apply WHS requirements, policies and procedures in the construction industry
CPC32620.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the essential skills and knowledge to adhere to work health and safety (WHS) protocols within construction environments. This encompasses identifying and assessing potential hazards, recognising hazardous materials such as asbestos, planning and implementing safe work practices, and effectively responding to emergencies. The unit emphasises compliance with legislative requirements and workplace procedures to ensure personal safety and the safety of others on-site. It is fundamental for workers across all sectors of the construction industry, promoting a culture of safety and risk management.

CPC32620.name: Read plans, calculate quantities and mark out materials
CPC32620.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to accurately interpret construction and plumbing plans and specifications. This includes obtaining precise dimensions, calculating material quantities, and marking out materials accordingly. Key tasks involve accessing and understanding relevant documentation, selecting appropriate tools and equipment, determining material types, performing accurate calculations, and ensuring markings align with planned dimensions. This unit is essential for professionals in the plumbing and construction sectors, ensuring that materials are prepared and utilised efficiently and accurately in accordance with project requirements.

CPC32620.name: Work effectively in the plumbing services sector
CPC32620.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required for effective workplace performance within the plumbing and services industry. This includes understanding employment conditions, responsibilities, and obligations; accessing relevant legislation, regulations, standards, and codes of practice; and adhering to work health and safety (WHS) requirements. The unit also emphasises the importance of teamwork, quality assurance, and sustainability principles, as well as the identification and pursuit of personal development opportunities. It is essential for professionals in the plumbing services sector to ensure compliance with industry standards and to promote a harmonious and efficient work environment.

CPC32620.name: Carry out WHS requirements
CPC32620.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to implement work health and safety (WHS) protocols within plumbing and services work environments. Key components include participating in workplace induction procedures, planning and preparing for safe work practices, identifying and assessing risks, recognising and handling hazardous materials, and consistently applying safe work practices. This unit is essential for plumbing professionals to ensure compliance with legislative requirements and to maintain a safe working environment.

CPC32620.name: Carry out levelling
CPC32620.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to plan and use levelling equipment effectively within the plumbing and services industry. This includes interpreting job plans and specifications to determine levelling requirements, selecting and verifying the serviceability of appropriate tools and equipment, setting up and operating levelling instruments such as laser levels or automatic levels, and accurately recording and marking levels in accordance with job specifications. The unit also emphasises adherence to work health and safety (WHS) and environmental requirements, ensuring that all tasks are performed safely and in compliance with relevant standards. This competency is essential for plumbing professionals to ensure precise installation and alignment of plumbing systems and components.

CPC32620.name: Cut and join sheet metal
CPC32620.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to accurately cut and join sheet metal components within the plumbing and services industry. This includes interpreting job plans and specifications to determine cutting and joining requirements, selecting appropriate tools and equipment, marking out materials, performing precise cuts, preparing surfaces for joining, and assembling components using suitable fastening and sealing methods. The unit emphasises adherence to work health and safety (WHS) protocols and environmental considerations, ensuring tasks are performed safely and in compliance with relevant standards. This competency is essential for plumbing professionals involved in fabricating and installing sheet metal components, such as ductwork, roofing elements, and drainage systems.

CPC32620.name: Cut using oxy-acetylene equipment
CPC32620.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely and effectively perform basic cutting of mild steel using oxy-acetylene equipment. This includes tasks such as setting up and adjusting the equipment according to manufacturer guidelines, selecting appropriate tip sizes and cutting pressures, preparing materials by marking out and clamping, and executing cuts to achieve clean results. The unit also emphasises adherence to work health and safety (WHS) protocols, including the use of personal protective equipment (PPE), and compliance with environmental requirements. This competency is essential for professionals in the plumbing and services industry, enabling them to carry out fabrication and installation tasks that involve cutting mild steel components.

CPC32620.name: Work safely on roofs
CPC32620.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to perform tasks on roofing structures safely. This includes identifying work requirements from job plans and specifications, preparing for work by selecting appropriate tools and equipment, installing and using fall prevention systems, and adhering to work health and safety (WHS) protocols. The unit emphasises the importance of inspecting fall prevention and arrest equipment for serviceability, installing safety systems according to manufacturer and regulatory requirements, and maintaining a clean work area by dismantling safety systems appropriately. This competency is essential for professionals in the plumbing and construction industries to ensure safe practices when working at heights.

CPC32620.name: Flash penetrations through roofs and walls
CPC32620.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to set out, cut, and install flashing for penetrations in roofing and wall structures. This includes interpreting job plans and specifications to determine flashing requirements, selecting appropriate materials and tools, accurately marking and cutting penetrations, installing supports, fitting penetrating products, and applying purpose-made or proprietary flashing in compliance with relevant codes and standards. The unit also emphasises adherence to work health and safety (WHS) protocols and environmental considerations, ensuring that all tasks are performed safely and in accordance with regulatory requirements. This competency is essential for professionals in the plumbing and construction industries to ensure watertight and secure installations where services penetrate building envelopes.

CPC32620.name: Prepare simple drawings
CPC32620.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to produce onsite drawings for plumbing services work. This includes identifying key features through consultation and reference to plans, selecting suitable views, and applying standard drawing conventions in compliance with relevant codes and standards. The unit also emphasises recording essential information using appropriate symbols and abbreviations, and storing drawings according to organisational procedures. Adherence to work health and safety (WHS) and environmental requirements is integral throughout the process. This competency is essential for plumbing professionals to effectively communicate technical information and ensure accurate implementation of plumbing services.

CPC32620.name: Select and install roof sheeting and wall cladding
CPC32620.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to select and install insulation, roof battens, and wall cladding using metallic, non-metallic, or other approved roof covering materials. This includes interpreting job specifications, relevant Australian Standards, codes, and manufacturer’s instructions to determine installation requirements; ensuring material compatibility with the surrounding environment; calculating material types and quantities; and identifying insulation to meet thermal, acoustic, moisture, and bushfire control requirements. The unit also covers receiving and securing materials, preparing for work by checking equipment and ensuring fall protection systems are in place, and installing roof sheeting and wall cladding with appropriate fastening methods. Adherence to work health and safety (WHS) protocols and environmental considerations is emphasised throughout the process. This competency is essential for professionals in the construction and plumbing industries to ensure compliant and effective installation of roofing and cladding systems.

CPC32620.name: Collect and store roof water
CPC32620.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to install storage tanks and related piping systems for the collection and storage of roof water. This includes determining water storage requirements based on factors such as site rainfall data, roof catchment area, and water consumption needs; planning and preparing for installation by selecting appropriate materials, tools, and equipment; and installing the storage system by preparing the worksite, setting up tank stands or bases, connecting inlet and overflow systems, and ensuring compliance with relevant Australian Standards, codes, and manufacturer instructions. The unit also emphasises adherence to work health and safety (WHS) and environmental requirements throughout the process. This competency is essential for professionals in the plumbing and construction industries to ensure effective and compliant roof water harvesting systems.

CPC32620.name: Fabricate and install roof drainage systems
CPC32620.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to fabricate and install components of roof drainage systems, including gutters, downpipes, and associated rainwater products. This encompasses interpreting job specifications and relevant Australian Standards to determine installation requirements, selecting appropriate materials and tools, performing accurate measurements and calculations, fabricating components as per design specifications, and installing them to ensure effective roof drainage. The unit also emphasises adherence to work health and safety (WHS) protocols and environmental considerations throughout the process. This competency is essential for professionals in the plumbing and roofing industries to ensure compliant and efficient installation of roof drainage systems.

CPC32620.name: Fabricate and install external flashings
CPC32620.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to accurately fabricate and install external flashings in construction settings. This includes interpreting installation requirements from plans and specifications, ensuring material compatibility with the surrounding environment, and adhering to workplace policies, work health and safety (WHS) protocols, and environmental and sustainability requirements. Key tasks involve measuring sites for external flashings, fabricating flashings to comply with relevant standards, and installing them using appropriate fastening and sealing methods. This competency is essential for professionals in the plumbing and roofing industries to ensure effective weatherproofing and structural integrity of buildings.

CPC32620.name: Install roof components
CPC32620.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to install various roof components, including flashing penetrations, to maintain weatherproofing. This involves interpreting job specifications, relevant Australian Standards, codes, and manufacturer instructions to determine installation requirements; selecting appropriate materials, tools, and equipment; preparing the work area by checking for obstructions and relocating battens if necessary; and performing the installation, fixing, and sealing of roofing components to ensure compliance with industry standards. The unit also emphasises adherence to work health and safety (WHS) protocols and environmental considerations throughout the process. This competency is essential for professionals in the plumbing and roofing industries to ensure effective and compliant installation of roof components.

CPC32620.name: Install roof coverings to curved roof structures
CPC32620.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to set out and install curved roof coverings. This includes tasks such as determining the curvature of the roof, creating design sketches, drawing fabrication patterns, calculating material quantities, and installing the roof covering in accordance with job specifications and relevant Australian Standards. The unit also emphasises adherence to work health and safety (WHS) protocols and environmental considerations throughout the process. This competency is essential for professionals in the roofing and construction industries to ensure the effective and compliant installation of curved roof coverings.

CPC32620.name: Install roof sheets, wall cladding and complex flashings
CPC32620.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to install roof sheeting, wall cladding, and complex flashings in construction settings. This includes interpreting job plans and specifications, selecting appropriate materials and tools, preparing the work area, and installing components in compliance with relevant codes, Australian Standards, and manufacturer’s specifications. The unit also emphasises adherence to work health and safety (WHS) protocols and environmental considerations throughout the process. This competency is essential for professionals in the roofing and construction industries to ensure effective and compliant installation of roofing and cladding systems.

CPC32620.name: Provide First Aid
CPC32620.desc: Equips individuals with the essential skills and knowledge to deliver a first aid response in various situations, including community and workplace settings. This encompasses recognising and assessing emergency situations, ensuring personal and bystander safety, assessing casualties, and seeking assistance from emergency services. Key components include performing cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) in accordance with Australian Resuscitation Council (ARC) guidelines, providing first aid following established principles, and effectively communicating incident details to emergency services. The unit also emphasises the importance of respecting casualty privacy and confidentiality, completing necessary documentation, and recognising the potential psychological impacts on rescuers, encouraging seeking help when required.
