This competency is vital for individuals who may be required to provide a first aid response across a range of situations.

CPC30820.name: Investigate business opportunities
CPC30820.desc: A unit of competency within the Business Services Training Package. This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to identify and evaluate potential business opportunities. It covers areas such as researching market needs, analysing competitors, assessing financial viability, and understanding regulatory requirements. By completing this unit, learners develop the ability to make informed decisions about the feasibility and potential success of new business ventures.

CPC30820.name: Work effectively and sustainably in the construction industry
CPC30820.desc: A unit of competency that imparts essential skills and knowledge for individuals entering the construction sector. It focuses on effective teamwork, understanding employment pathways, and adhering to environmental and resource efficiency requirements. Learners are trained to plan and perform work collaboratively, investigate career development opportunities, and implement sustainable practices on construction sites. This unit is particularly suited for those with basic skills, undertaking routine tasks under the guidance of more experienced workers.

CPC30820.name: Plan and organise work
CPC30820.desc: A unit of competency that imparts essential skills and knowledge for individuals in the construction industry. It focuses on planning and organising basic work tasks on a construction site, including determining work task outcomes, breaking tasks into components, estimating time and resources, and collaborating with team members to allocate roles and responsibilities. This unit is suitable for those with basic skills and knowledge undertaking routine work tasks under the direction of more experienced workers.

CPC30820.name: Conduct workplace communication
CPC30820.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to effectively communicate with others in a construction workplace. It involves gathering, conveying, and receiving information through verbal and written forms, ensuring clear understanding among team members. The unit is suitable for individuals with basic skills undertaking routine tasks under supervision.

CPC30820.name: Carry out measurements and calculations
CPC30820.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to perform basic measurements and calculations in a construction environment. It involves selecting appropriate equipment, obtaining accurate measurements, and using basic formulae to calculate quantities of materials. Competency in this unit ensures that construction workers can determine task and material requirements accurately, contributing to efficient and precise project execution.

CPC30820.name: Read and interpret plans and specifications
CPC30820.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge necessary to read and interpret construction plans and specifications at a basic level. It includes understanding different types of plans, construction symbols, abbreviations, and legends, as well as identifying key features, boundaries, and existing services on a site. Proficiency in this unit enables workers to accurately comprehend project requirements, facilitating effective communication and execution of construction tasks.

CPC30820.name: Apply protective paint coating systems
CPC30820.desc: This unit involves the application of protective paint coating systems to various surfaces. It encompasses preparing surfaces, selecting appropriate materials, and applying coatings according to specifications to protect surfaces from environmental factors and wear. Competence in this unit ensures that workers can enhance the durability and appearance of structures through proper application of protective coatings.

CPC30820.name: Handle roof tiling materials
CPC30820.desc: This unit covers the handling of roof tiling materials in preparation for roof tiling tasks. It includes the safe and efficient handling, storage, and distribution of materials such as tiles, battens, and underlays on-site. Achieving competency in this unit ensures that workers can manage roofing materials properly, maintaining safety standards and contributing to the smooth progression of roofing projects.

CPC30820.name: Use roof tiling tools and equipment
CPC30820.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to use tools and equipment essential for roof tiling. It involves selecting, operating, and maintaining tools such as trowels, hammers, and cutting equipment specific to roof tiling tasks. Proficiency in this unit enables workers to perform roof tiling activities effectively, ensuring quality workmanship and adherence to safety protocols.

CPC30820.name: Tile regular roofs
CPC30820.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to tile regular roofs, including preparation, setting out, and installation of tiles on straightforward roof structures. Competency in this unit ensures that workers can effectively tile standard roof designs, adhering to industry standards and safety protocols.

CPC30820.name: Tile irregular roofs
CPC30820.desc: This unit involves tiling irregular roofs, focusing on complex roof structures with non-standard features. It includes interpreting plans, setting out, and installing tiles on roofs with unique shapes or angles. Proficiency in this unit enables workers to handle challenging roofing projects, ensuring quality workmanship on intricate designs.

CPC30820.name: Repair and replace valleys, valley irons and flashings
CPC30820.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to repair and replace valley sections and flashings on tiled roofs. It encompasses preparing the work area, removing damaged components, and installing new valleys, valley irons, and flashings to restore roof integrity. Competence in this unit ensures that workers can maintain and repair critical roof elements, preventing leaks and structural issues.

CPC30820.name: Repair and renovate tile roofs
CPC30820.desc: This unit covers repairing and renovating tiled roofs, including identifying defects, removing damaged tiles, and installing replacements to restore the roof's condition. It also involves cleaning and applying protective treatments as needed. Achieving competency in this unit ensures that workers can effectively extend the lifespan and functionality of tiled roofing systems.

CPC30820.name: Slate a roof
CPC30820.desc: This unit involves slating a roof, focusing on the installation of slate tiles to create a durable and aesthetically pleasing roof covering. It includes selecting appropriate materials, setting out, and fixing slate tiles according to specifications. Proficiency in this unit enables workers to execute slate roofing projects, ensuring high-quality finishes that meet industry standards.

CPC30820.name: Apply WHS requirements, policies and procedures in the construction industry
CPC30820.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to adhere to work health and safety (WHS) requirements in the construction industry. It involves identifying and assessing risks, handling hazardous materials appropriately, planning and preparing for safe work practices, and following emergency procedures. Competency in this unit ensures that workers can maintain a safe working environment by complying with WHS policies and procedures.

CPC30820.name: Carry out WHS requirements
CPC30820.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge necessary to implement work health and safety (WHS) requirements in a plumbing and services work environment. It includes participating in workplace induction procedures, planning and preparing for safe work practices, identifying and assessing risks, handling hazardous materials, and applying safe work practices. Proficiency in this unit ensures that plumbing workers can effectively carry out WHS requirements, contributing to overall workplace safety.

CPC30820.name: Work safely on roofs
CPC30820.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to work safely on roofs. It involves identifying work requirements, planning and preparing for safe work practices, accessing roofs safely, and completing work tasks while adhering to safety protocols. Competency in this unit ensures that workers can perform tasks on roofs without compromising their safety or the safety of others.

CPC30120.name: Use carpentry tools and equipment
CPC30120.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to safely select and use carpentry tools and equipment, including hand tools, power tools, pneumatic tools, and plant equipment. It covers planning and preparation, selecting and using tools and equipment, and cleaning up, ensuring compliance with work health and safety (WHS) requirements and manufacturers' recommendations.

CPC30120.name: Identify and apply information in construction plans, drawings and specifications
CPC30120.desc: This unit involves interpreting and applying information from construction plans, drawings, and specifications to ensure accurate and efficient construction processes. It includes understanding symbols, terminology, and dimensions, and applying this knowledge to construction tasks.

CPC30120.name: Process materials to produce components using static machines
CPC30120.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to use static machines for manufacturing processes of components, meeting all relevant requirements of Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS), and Commonwealth and state or territory legislation. It includes planning and preparing, operating machines, and cleaning up, ensuring compliance with safety and operational procedures.

CPC30120.name: Carry out levelling operations
CPC30120.desc: This unit specifies the outcomes required to carry out levelling operations, using the rise and fall method and the height of collimation method, to establish correct and accurate set-out of buildings and components. It includes setting up, testing, and using levelling devices, and undertaking closed and open traverses using a range of levelling equipment.

CPC30120.name: Apply WHS requirements, policies and procedures in the construction industry
CPC30120.desc: This unit specifies the outcomes required to carry out work health and safety (WHS) requirements through safe work practices in all on- or off-site construction workplaces. It requires the performance of work in a safe manner through awareness of risks and work requirements, and the planning and performance of safe work practices with concern for personal safety and the safety of others.

CPC30120.name: Fabricate shopfitting components using CNC machines
CPC30120.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to operate computer numerically controlled (CNC) machines to fabricate components for shopfitting. It includes interpreting technical drawings, setting up and operating CNC machinery, and ensuring the quality and accuracy of fabricated components. This unit is essential for shopfitters who utilise CNC technology in the production of shopfitting elements.

CPC30120.name: Fabricate and assemble shopfront structures
CPC30120.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to fabricate and assemble shopfront structures, including bulkheads and shopfront openings. It involves interpreting shopfitting plans and specifications, selecting appropriate materials, and assembling components to form the shopfront structure. This unit is crucial for shopfitters involved in the construction of shopfronts.

CPC30120.name: Assemble and install shopfront structures
CPC30120.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to assemble and install shopfront structures, including internal and external prefabricated components, sections, and fittings. It involves assembling components, raising and bracing the shopfront structure, and installing doors and glazing. This unit is vital for shopfitters responsible for the installation of shopfronts.

CPC30120.name: Assemble internal shopfitting units and prepare for transport
CPC30120.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to assemble internal shopfitting units and prepare them for transport. It includes assembling components, ensuring the quality and accuracy of the units, and preparing them for safe transport to the installation site. This unit is essential for shopfitters involved in the assembly and transportation of internal shopfitting units.

CPC30120.name: Apply and trim decorative additions to shopfittings and components
CPC30120.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to apply and trim decorative additions to shopfittings and components. It includes selecting appropriate materials, applying decorative finishes, and trimming additions to achieve the desired aesthetic. This unit is important for shopfitters who enhance the visual appeal of shopfittings through decorative additions.

CPC30120.name: Install prefabricated internal shopfitting units
CPC30120.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to install prefabricated internal shopfitting units on-site. It includes interpreting shopfitting plans and specifications, selecting appropriate materials, and installing components to form the internal shopfitting units. This unit is essential for shopfitters responsible for the installation of prefabricated internal units.

CPC30120.name: Install internal shop walls and fixtures
CPC30120.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to install internal shop walls and fixtures, including framing, lining, and associated fixtures. It involves setting out and constructing internal wall framing, installing linings and fixtures, and ensuring the quality and accuracy of the installation. This unit is crucial for shopfitters involved in the construction of internal shop walls and fixtures.

CPC30120.name: Prepare shopfittings and surfaces and apply liquid finishes
CPC30120.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to prepare shopfittings and surfaces and apply liquid finishes. It includes preparing surfaces of shop doors, windows, walls, ceilings, partitions, and shopfittings, and applying a range of liquid finishes to achieve the desired aesthetic. This unit is vital for shopfitters who enhance the visual appeal of shopfittings through liquid finishes.

CPC30120.name: Demolish shopfronts and bulkheads
CPC30120.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to demolish shopfronts and bulkheads. It involves planning and preparing for demolition, selecting appropriate tools and equipment, and safely dismantling shopfronts and bulkheads. This unit is essential for shopfitters involved in the demolition of shopfronts and bulkheads.

CPC30120.name: Prepare shop floors for new coverings
CPC30120.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to prepare shop floors for new coverings. It includes removing existing floor coverings, selecting appropriate materials, and preparing the floor surface to ensure the successful application of new coverings. This unit is crucial for shopfitters responsible for floor preparation in shopfitting projects.

CPC30120.name: Install commercial glazing products
CPC30120.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to install commercial glazing products. It includes identifying work requirements, preparing materials, and installing glazing products in commercial settings. This unit is essential for professionals involved in the installation of commercial glazing.

CPC30120.name: Manage finances for new business ventures
CPC30120.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to manage finances for new business ventures. It includes developing financial strategies, producing financial projections, and managing business assets and financial capital to support business goals. This unit is vital for individuals responsible for financial management in new business ventures.

CPC30120.name: Work safely on scaffolding higher than two metres
CPC30120.desc: This unit specifies the outcomes required to work safely on construction sites where the work activity involves working above two metres from ground level and where fall protection measures are required. It covers safe methods for accessing the work site and safe methods of moving or passing tools, equipment, and materials to heights above two metres. This unit is essential for workers who perform tasks on scaffolding higher than two metres.

CPC31020.name: Apply basic levelling procedures
CPC31020.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to perform fundamental levelling tasks in construction settings. This includes setting up and using levelling devices, taking accurate measurements, and transferring levels to ensure structures are correctly aligned. Proficiency in this unit is essential for maintaining the accuracy and quality of construction projects.

CPC31020.name: Erect and dismantle restricted height scaffolding
CPC31020.desc: Provides individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely assemble and disassemble modular scaffolding systems up to four metres in height. This includes the placement of safety barriers and the application of appropriate handling techniques for various scaffolding components. Proficiency in this unit is essential for workers across various industries to ensure safe and effective use of restricted height scaffolding in compliance with relevant regulations and standards.

CPC31020.name: Work effectively and sustainably in the construction industry
CPC31020.desc: Equips individuals with the essential skills and knowledge to operate efficiently within the construction sector. This includes understanding team roles and responsibilities, planning and executing tasks collaboratively, exploring career pathways, and adhering to environmental and resource efficiency requirements. The unit is suitable for those with basic skills and knowledge undertaking routine work tasks under the direction of more experienced workers.

CPC31020.name: Plan and organise work
CPC31020.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to effectively plan and coordinate basic tasks on a construction site. This involves determining task requirements, breaking down tasks into components, estimating time and resources, and collaborating with team members to allocate roles and responsibilities. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction activities are carried out efficiently, safely, and in compliance with workplace standards.

CPC31020.name: Conduct workplace communication
CPC31020.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to communicate effectively in a construction workplace environment. This includes gathering, conveying, and receiving information through verbal and written forms, accessing and interpreting information from various sources, preparing and presenting basic reports, and participating in simple meeting processes. Proficiency in this unit ensures that workers can interact efficiently with colleagues, follow instructions accurately, and contribute constructively to workplace discussions, thereby enhancing overall productivity and safety on construction sites.

CPC31020.name: Carry out measurements and calculations
CPC31020.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to perform basic measurements and calculations in a construction environment. This includes selecting appropriate equipment, obtaining accurate linear measurements, and applying basic formulas to calculate weight, area, volume, perimeter, circumference, ratio, and percentage. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction tasks are executed with precision, contributing to the overall efficiency and quality of building projects.

CPC31020.name: Read and interpret plans and specifications
CPC31020.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to understand and interpret construction plans and specifications at a basic level. This includes identifying key features and functions of various types of construction drawings, understanding legends, symbols, and abbreviations, and extracting essential information such as site locations, dimensions, materials, and environmental requirements. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction tasks are carried out accurately and in compliance with project requirements.

CPC31020.name: Handle solid plastering materials
CPC31020.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely and effectively manage solid plastering materials on construction sites. This includes planning and preparing for material handling, sorting and storing materials appropriately, and removing materials while adhering to work health and safety (WHS) regulations. Proficiency in this unit ensures that plastering tasks are conducted efficiently, safely, and in compliance with environmental and workplace standards.

CPC31020.name: Use solid plastering tools and equipment
CPC31020.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely select, check, use, and store tools and equipment for solid plastering tasks. This includes understanding the functions and limitations of various hand and power tools, conducting pre-operational checks, following start-up and shut-down procedures, and adhering to work health and safety (WHS) regulations. Proficiency in this unit ensures that solid plastering tasks are performed efficiently and safely, contributing to the quality and integrity of construction projects.

CPC31020.name: Prepare surfaces for plastering
CPC31020.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to prepare various substrates for solid plastering applications. This includes planning and organising work, identifying and removing hazards or obstructions, selecting and setting up appropriate tools, and performing tasks such as sanding, grinding, patching, levelling, packing, filling, and finishing surfaces to ensure they are ready for plastering. Proficiency in this unit ensures that surfaces are adequately prepared, contributing to the quality and durability of plastering work.

CPC31020.name: Apply float and render to straight and curved surfaces
CPC31020.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to float, render, and finish both flat and curved solid plastering work. This includes planning and preparing work areas, manufacturing templates for curved work or circular columns, preparing background surfaces, applying floating and rendering coats to flat and curved surfaces as well as piers, and finishing rendering coats to achieve specified alignment and quality standards. Proficiency in this unit ensures that plastering tasks are executed accurately, contributing to the overall quality and durability of construction projects.

CPC31020.name: Apply set coats
CPC31020.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to mix and apply plaster setting coats to both flat and curved solid plaster backgrounds. This process involves planning and preparing work areas, selecting appropriate mix ratios for plaster and lime, preparing background surfaces, applying set coats in accordance with relevant standards and specifications, and finishing the surface to achieve a hard, smooth finish. Proficiency in this unit ensures that plastering tasks are executed accurately, contributing to the overall quality and durability of construction projects.

CPC31020.name: Apply trowelled texture coat finishes
CPC31020.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to mix and apply trowelled texture coatings to various surfaces. This process involves preparing substrates, selecting and mixing texture coating materials to the desired consistency, and applying the texture coat uniformly using a trowel to achieve the specified thickness and finish. Proficiency in this unit ensures that textured finishes are applied accurately, enhancing the aesthetic appeal and durability of construction projects.

CPC31020.name: Restore and renovate solid plasterwork
CPC31020.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to repair and refurbish lime mortar cement render and solid plaster surfaces. This includes planning and preparing for restoration work, selecting appropriate materials and tools, and applying techniques to address damage or deterioration in plastered surfaces. Proficiency in this unit ensures that restoration tasks are executed accurately, contributing to the preservation and enhancement of existing structures.

CPC31020.name: Apply WHS requirements, policies and procedures in the construction industry
CPC31020.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to implement work health and safety (WHS) practices in construction settings. This includes identifying and assessing risks, recognising hazardous materials such as asbestos, planning and preparing for safe work practices, applying these practices effectively, and following emergency procedures. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction activities are conducted safely, in compliance with legislative requirements, and with due regard for personal and communal well-being.

CPC31020.name: Investigate business opportunities
CPC31020.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to identify and evaluate potential business ventures. This involves sourcing and analysing market information, identifying products or services that align with business ideas, assessing market needs and trends, and understanding the legislative frameworks affecting the business. Proficiency in this unit ensures that individuals can conduct thorough research to determine the viability of business opportunities, facilitating informed decision-making in entrepreneurial endeavours.

CPC31020.name: Manage finances for new business ventures
CPC31020.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to implement and review financial management strategies for new business ventures. This includes producing financial budgets or projections, developing plans to manage business capital, ensuring adequate financial provision for taxation, and selecting key performance indicators to monitor financial performance. Proficiency in this unit ensures that individuals can effectively manage the financial aspects of a new business, contributing to its overall success and sustainability.

CPC31020.name: Operate elevated work platforms to 11 metres
CPC31020.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely and effectively operate specific types of elevated work platforms (EWPs), such as scissor lifts and self-propelled boom lifts with a boom length under 11 metres. This includes tasks such as locating, setting up, operating, and shutting down EWPs in various environments, including uneven terrain. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction workers can perform elevated tasks safely, adhering to industry standards and regulations.

CPC31020.name: Carry out concreting to simple forms
CPC31020.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely install formwork, reinforcement, and place and finish concrete for minor slabs, pathways, and other straightforward constructions. This includes tasks such as preparing the substrate, erecting and stripping formwork, placing and tying reinforcement, and applying concrete to achieve the specified design finish. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction tasks are executed accurately and in compliance with the National Construction Code (NCC), Australian Standards, and work health and safety (WHS) regulations.

CPC31020.name: Erect and maintain trestle and plank systems
CPC31020.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely set up, inspect, and maintain trestle and plank work platforms commonly used in construction tasks such as plastering and painting. This involves planning and preparing the worksite, selecting appropriate equipment, ensuring compliance with Australian Standards (e.g., AS 4576:2020), and adhering to work health and safety (WHS) regulations. Proficiency in this unit ensures that workers can effectively and safely utilise trestle and plank systems, contributing to the overall safety and efficiency of construction projects.

CPC31220.name: Investigate business opportunities
CPC31220.desc: A unit of competency within the Business Services Training Package (BSB). This unit equips individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to identify, research, and evaluate potential business opportunities. It covers areas such as analysing market needs, assessing financial viability, understanding regulatory requirements, and considering potential risks. The unit is designed for those aiming to establish or expand a small business, enabling them to make informed decisions about the feasibility and potential success of new business ventures.

CPC31220.name: Manage finances for new business ventures
CPC31220.desc: A unit of competency within the Business Services Training Package (BSB). This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to implement and review financial management strategies for new business ventures. Key areas covered include developing financial budgets and projections, managing business capital, ensuring compliance with taxation requirements, and monitoring financial performance using key performance indicators (KPIs). The unit also emphasises the use of new and emerging digital technologies to enhance business profitability. It is particularly relevant for those establishing a business for self-employment or initiating a new venture within a larger organisation.

CPC31220.name: Construct and install bulkheads
CPC31220.desc: This unit focuses on developing the skills and knowledge required to construct bulkheads for decorative purposes, to contain fittings such as range hoods and cupboards, to conceal services, and to facilitate changes in ceiling heights, all in compliance with the National Construction Code (NCC) and Australian Standards. It encompasses tasks such as preparing for sheeting bulkheads with various materials, setting out and fabricating bulkhead components, and installing both fabricated and pre-manufactured bulkheads. The unit is essential for individuals aiming to perform carpentry tasks involving bulkhead construction and installation in both residential and commercial settings.

CPC31220.name: Assemble partitions
CPC31220.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to set out and assemble partitions for dividing areas into usable spaces. This includes working with prefabricated and demountable partitions made of timber or metal, ensuring compliance with national construction codes, Australian Standards, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, and relevant legislation. Key competencies involve planning and preparation, setting out and cutting components, assembling partitions to specified measurements, and adhering to safety and environmental requirements.

CPC31220.name: Apply basic levelling procedures
CPC31220.desc: Equips individuals with the skills to perform levelling tasks in a single plane, essential for accurately setting out building components. This encompasses the setup, testing, and utilisation of various levelling devices, as well as the establishment and transfer of heights using appropriate equipment. The unit is pertinent to construction industry workers engaged in residential and commercial projects, emphasising adherence to safety protocols, accurate measurement techniques, and effective communication within a team environment.

CPC31220.name: Use explosive power tools
CPC31220.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely and effectively operate explosive power tools (EPTs) that utilise explosive charges to fasten materials or fix fasteners to bases. This includes understanding the functions, operations, and limitations of EPTs, selecting appropriate charges and fasteners, adhering to safety protocols, and performing maintenance tasks. The unit is applicable to workers in the construction industry and emphasises compliance with work health and safety (WHS) regulations and environmental requirements.

CPC31220.name: Erect and dismantle restricted height scaffolding
CPC31220.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely assemble and disassemble modular scaffolding systems up to four metres in height. This includes planning and preparing for scaffolding tasks, establishing secure footings, erecting scaffolding in compliance with safety regulations, inspecting for structural integrity, performing necessary repairs or alterations, and dismantling the scaffolding upon task completion. The unit emphasises adherence to work health and safety (WHS) requirements, environmental considerations, and effective teamwork within various industries.

CPC31220.name: Work safely at heights
CPC31220.desc: Equips individuals with the essential skills and knowledge to perform tasks at heights on construction sites, mitigating the risk of falls from one level to another. This encompasses identifying task requirements, selecting and inspecting appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE) and fall protection systems, assessing work areas for potential hazards, and implementing control measures to ensure safety. The unit emphasises adherence to workplace and regulatory requirements, including the development and application of safe work method statements (SWMS), and is applicable across various construction activities such as new builds, renovations, refurbishments, and maintenance.

CPC31220.name: Work effectively and sustainably in the construction industry
CPC31220.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to operate efficiently and sustainably within the construction sector. This encompasses understanding the construction industry's scope and employment conditions, planning and prioritising work activities, collaborating effectively within a team, identifying personal learning needs for career development, and adhering to environmental and resource efficiency requirements. The unit emphasises safe work practices, effective communication, and continuous improvement to enhance individual and team performance in various construction contexts.

CPC31220.name: Plan and organise work
CPC31220.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to effectively plan and coordinate basic work tasks on a construction site. This involves determining task requirements, breaking down tasks into component activities, estimating time and resources, identifying necessary tools and equipment, and preparing a comprehensive work plan. Additionally, it emphasises collaboration with team members to review plans, schedule work, allocate roles, and ensure adherence to work health and safety (WHS) requirements. This unit is suitable for individuals undertaking routine tasks under the direction of more experienced workers and is applicable across various construction contexts.

CPC31220.name: Conduct workplace communication
CPC31220.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to communicate effectively within a construction workplace environment. This includes gathering, conveying, and receiving information through verbal and written forms, participating in simple meeting processes, and utilising visual communication techniques. The unit is suitable for those with basic skills and knowledge undertaking routine work tasks under the direction of more experienced workers.

CPC31220.name: Carry out measurements and calculations
CPC31220.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to perform basic measurements and calculations essential for determining task and material requirements in a construction environment. This includes selecting appropriate equipment, obtaining accurate linear measurements, and applying basic formulas to calculate weight, area, volume, perimeter, circumference, ratio, and percentage. Additionally, it involves converting measurements between metres and millimetres, ensuring accuracy in calculations, and recording results systematically. This unit is applicable to individuals working under supervision in various construction contexts, emphasising the importance of precise measurements and calculations in successful project execution.

CPC31220.name: Read and interpret plans and specifications
CPC31220.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to understand and interpret construction plans and specifications at a basic level. This includes identifying key features and functions of various types of construction drawings, understanding symbols and abbreviations, verifying the inclusion of the latest amendments, and locating existing services, key features, and boundaries on a site plan. The unit is suitable for individuals with basic skills and knowledge undertaking routine work tasks under the direction of more experienced workers.

CPC31220.name: Fix standard plasterboard wall sheets
CPC31220.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to install standard plasterboard wall sheets in accordance with manufacturers' and job specifications. This includes preparing the work area, selecting and preparing materials, measuring and cutting plasterboard sheets, and fixing them to wall frames using appropriate adhesives and fasteners. The unit emphasises adherence to safety protocols, quality standards, and environmental considerations, ensuring that installations meet the required levels of finish and comply with relevant codes and standards.

CPC31220.name: Fix standard plasterboard ceiling sheets
CPC31220.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to install standard plasterboard ceiling sheets in construction settings. This involves planning and preparing the work area, selecting and preparing materials, measuring and cutting plasterboard sheets, and securely fixing them to ceiling frames or furring channels using appropriate adhesives and fasteners. The unit emphasises adherence to safety protocols, quality standards, and environmental considerations, ensuring that installations meet the required levels of finish and comply with relevant codes and standards.

CPC31220.name: Fix battens
CPC31220.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to install battens in preparation for lining systems in construction settings. This involves planning and preparing the work area, selecting appropriate materials, measuring and cutting battens to specified dimensions, and securely fixing them to substrates using suitable fasteners and techniques. The unit emphasises adherence to safety protocols, quality standards, and environmental considerations, ensuring that installations meet project specifications and comply with relevant codes and standards.

CPC31220.name: Fix wet area sheets
CPC31220.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to install wet area sheets in compliance with manufacturer and job specifications. This involves planning and preparing the work area, selecting appropriate materials, accurately measuring and cutting sheets, and securely fixing them to designated surfaces in wet areas such as bathrooms and laundries. The unit emphasises adherence to safety protocols, quality standards, and environmental considerations, ensuring that installations are watertight and comply with relevant codes and standards.

CPC31220.name: Fix ceiling sheets to external protected areas
CPC31220.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to install ceiling sheets in external protected environments, such as under eaves or verandas. This involves planning and preparing the work area, selecting appropriate materials, accurately measuring and cutting ceiling sheets, and securely fixing them to ceiling frames or structures using suitable adhesives and fasteners. The unit emphasises adherence to safety protocols, quality standards, and environmental considerations, ensuring that installations are durable and comply with relevant codes and standards.

CPC31220.name: Fix fibre cement board
CPC31220.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to install fibre cement boards in construction settings. This involves planning and preparing the work area, selecting appropriate materials, accurately measuring and cutting fibre cement boards, and securely fixing them to designated surfaces using suitable adhesives and fasteners. The unit emphasises adherence to safety protocols, quality standards, and environmental considerations, ensuring that installations comply with relevant codes and standards.

CPC31220.name: Apply levels of finish standards to planning and inspection of own work
CPC31220.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to apply industry standards for levels of finish when planning and inspecting their plastering work. This involves understanding and interpreting the relevant standards, assessing surface quality, selecting appropriate finishing techniques, and ensuring that the completed work meets the specified level of finish. The unit emphasises attention to detail, quality control, and adherence to industry best practices to achieve the desired outcomes in plastering projects.

CPC31220.name: Mix plastering compounds
CPC31220.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to prepare various plastering compounds used in wall and ceiling lining applications. This involves selecting appropriate materials, accurately measuring and combining components, and mixing them to the correct consistency as specified by manufacturers' guidelines. The unit emphasises adherence to safety protocols, quality standards, and environmental considerations, ensuring that the prepared compounds are suitable for their intended application and comply with relevant codes and standards.

CPC31220.name: Finish plasterboard joints manually
CPC31220.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to manually finish plasterboard joints to a standard ready for decoration. This involves preparing the work area, selecting appropriate materials and tools, applying jointing compounds and tapes, and finishing joints to achieve a smooth, seamless surface. The unit emphasises adherence to safety protocols, quality standards, and environmental considerations, ensuring that the finished work meets industry requirements and is suitable for subsequent painting or finishing.

CPC31220.name: Manually sand plaster work
CPC31220.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to hand sand joints in plaster walls, ceilings, and cornices to achieve a smooth finish suitable for decoration. This involves planning and preparing the work area, selecting appropriate tools and personal protective equipment (PPE), ensuring joints are dry and fully cured, and meticulously sanding plaster surfaces to the specified level of finish without over-sanding. The unit emphasises adherence to safety protocols, quality standards, and environmental considerations, ensuring that the completed work meets industry requirements and is ready for subsequent painting or finishing.

CPC31220.name: Cut and fix paper-faced cornices
CPC31220.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to accurately cut and install paper-faced cornices in construction settings. This involves planning and preparing the work area, selecting appropriate materials and tools, measuring and cutting cornices to precise angles, and securely fixing them to plasterboard surfaces using suitable adhesives and fasteners. The unit emphasises adherence to safety protocols, quality standards, and environmental considerations, ensuring that installations are seamless and comply with relevant codes and standards.

CPC31220.name: Rectify faults in drywall applications
CPC31220.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to identify and rectify faults in drywall installations. This involves planning and preparing the work area, selecting appropriate tools and materials, assessing and diagnosing faults such as board fractures, joint imperfections, or surface irregularities, and implementing effective rectification methods to restore the drywall to the specified level of finish. The unit emphasises adherence to safety protocols, quality standards, and environmental considerations, ensuring that all remedial work complies with relevant codes and industry best practices.

CPC31220.name: Complete penetrations and flashings
CPC31220.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to execute penetrations and install flashings associated with wall and ceiling linings. This includes planning and preparing the work area, selecting appropriate materials and tools, creating penetrations safely with minimal modification or damage to host materials, installing flashings, and applying sealants or caulking compounds to restore the integrity of wall or ceiling systems. The unit emphasises adherence to safety protocols, quality standards, and environmental considerations, ensuring that all work complies with relevant Australian Standards and regulatory requirements.

CPC31220.name: Install dry wall passive fire-rated systems
CPC31220.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to select and install dry wall fire-rated systems to walls and ceilings. This involves planning and preparing the work area, selecting appropriate materials and tools, and installing fire-rated systems in compliance with manufacturer specifications and the National Construction Code (NCC). The unit emphasises adherence to safety protocols, quality standards, and environmental considerations, ensuring that installations meet the required fire-rating criteria and comply with relevant codes and standards.

CPC31220.name: Install suspended ceilings
CPC31220.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to install both exposed and concealed suspended ceiling systems in construction settings. This involves planning and preparing the work area, setting out ceiling grids and alignment levels, fixing suspension rods to structural members, assembling and securing the suspended framework, and installing lining materials according to design specifications. The unit emphasises adherence to safety protocols, quality standards, and environmental considerations, ensuring that installations comply with the National Construction Code (NCC), Australian Standards, and workplace requirements.

CPC31320.name: Apply waterproofing for wall and floor tiling
CPC31320.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to effectively apply waterproofing systems in preparation for wall and floor tiling. This includes understanding the selection and application of appropriate waterproofing materials, ensuring compliance with relevant standards and regulations, and preparing surfaces to receive waterproofing membranes. Competency in this unit ensures that tiling professionals can prevent water ingress, thereby enhancing the durability and integrity of tiled surfaces.

CPC31320.name: Work safely at heights
CPC31320.desc: Equips individuals with the essential skills and knowledge to operate safely on construction sites where there is a risk of falling from one level to another. This training encompasses hazard identification, selection and use of appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE), implementation of fall protection measures, and adherence to safe work procedures. It also includes identifying and reporting common faults with scaffold or work platform systems. This unit is applicable to various construction activities, including new builds, renovations, refurbishments, and maintenance tasks, ensuring that workers can effectively manage the risks associated with working at heights.

CPC31320.name: Prepare surfaces for tiling application
CPC31320.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to repair and prepare various substrates for wall and floor tiling. This includes tasks such as cleaning surfaces to remove contaminants, installing underlay for framed substrates, controlling suction in cementitious and masonry substrates, and applying screeding or rendering to achieve the necessary surface finish. Competency in this unit ensures that tiling professionals can effectively prepare different surfaces, facilitating the successful application of tiles in compliance with industry standards.

CPC31320.name: Install mosaic tiling
CPC31320.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to install mosaic tiles on both flat and curved surfaces. This includes tasks such as checking that mosaic tiles conform to the specified size, pattern, colour, and characteristics; setting out mosaic work to be symmetrical and balanced while minimizing waste; preparing substrate surfaces by cleaning them of loose material and contaminants; and installing mosaic tiles to achieve a quality finish. Competency in this unit ensures that tiling professionals can effectively execute mosaic tiling projects in compliance with industry standards.

CPC31320.name: Carry out measurements and calculations
CPC31320.desc: Equips individuals with the essential skills and knowledge to perform basic measurements and calculations in a construction environment. This includes selecting appropriate equipment, obtaining accurate linear measurements, and applying basic formulas to calculate weight, area, volume, perimeter, circumference, ratio, and percentage. Competency in this unit ensures that construction workers can accurately determine task and material requirements, facilitating efficient and precise project execution.

CPC31320.name: Install floor tiles
CPC31320.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to install floor tiles across various substrates in both residential and commercial settings. This includes tasks such as preparing the work area, selecting and using appropriate tools and materials, setting out tiles to ensure symmetry and alignment, cutting tiles to fit around obstacles, and applying adhesives and grouts to achieve a high-quality finish. Competency in this unit ensures that tiling professionals can execute floor tiling projects that meet industry standards and client expectations.

CPC31320.name: Read and interpret plans and specifications
CPC31320.desc: Equips individuals with the essential skills and knowledge to accurately understand construction drawings and documents. This includes identifying key features and functions of various types of plans, understanding construction symbols and abbreviations, verifying the latest amendments, and locating existing services, key features, and boundaries on a site plan. Competency in this unit ensures that construction workers can effectively interpret project requirements, facilitating accurate and efficient execution of construction tasks in compliance with industry standards.

CPC31320.name: Install wall tiles
CPC31320.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to install wall tiles on various substrates in both residential and commercial settings. This includes tasks such as preparing the work area, selecting and using appropriate tools and materials, setting out tiles to ensure symmetry and alignment, cutting tiles to fit around obstacles, and applying adhesives and grouts to achieve a high-quality finish. Competency in this unit ensures that tiling professionals can execute wall tiling projects that meet industry standards and client expectations.

CPC31320.name: Use wall and floor tiling tools and equipment
CPC31320.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely and effectively select, operate, and maintain tools and equipment specific to wall and floor tiling tasks. This includes understanding the functions and limitations of various hand and power tools, performing pre-operational checks, adhering to safety protocols, and ensuring proper cleaning and storage after use. Competency in this unit ensures that tiling professionals can proficiently handle the necessary tools and equipment, contributing to the quality and efficiency of tiling projects.

CPC31320.name: Tile curved surfaces
CPC31320.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to tile curved surfaces on solid and sheet substrates using mortar or adhesive. This includes preparing for and tiling curved wall and floor surfaces, columns, circular walls, and arches. Competency in this unit ensures that tiling professionals can effectively execute tiling projects involving curved surfaces in compliance with industry standards.

CPC31320.name: Install decorative tiling
CPC31320.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to plan, set out, and install decorative tiling projects that form specific patterns. This includes tasks such as interpreting design specifications, selecting appropriate materials, preparing substrates, cutting tiles to precise dimensions, and aligning tile joints to achieve the desired decorative effect. Competency in this unit ensures that tiling professionals can execute intricate decorative tiling installations in compliance with industry standards.

CPC31320.name: Conduct workplace communication
CPC31320.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to communicate effectively with other workers in a construction workplace environment. This includes gathering, conveying, and receiving information through verbal and written forms of communication, accessing and interpreting basic information from various sources, preparing and presenting basic reports, and participating in simple meeting processes. Competency in this unit ensures that construction workers can effectively exchange information, follow instructions, and contribute to workplace discussions, thereby enhancing collaboration and productivity on-site.

CPC31320.name: Plan and organise work
CPC31320.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to effectively plan and coordinate basic work tasks on a construction site. This involves determining task requirements, breaking down tasks into manageable components, estimating time and resource needs, and collaborating with team members to allocate roles and responsibilities. Competency in this unit ensures that construction workers can execute tasks efficiently, adhere to work health and safety (WHS) standards, and contribute to the successful completion of construction projects.

CPC31320.name: Apply basic levelling procedures
CPC31320.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to carry out levelling in a single plane to establish accurate set-out of building components. This includes setting up, testing, and using levelling devices, as well as establishing and transferring heights using various levelling equipment. Competency in this unit ensures that construction workers can perform levelling tasks on residential and commercial work sites, contributing to precise construction and compliance with industry standards.

CPC31320.name: Handle wall and floor tiling materials
CPC31320.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely handle and store wall and floor tiling products and materials. This includes tasks such as preparing, handling, sorting, stacking, distributing, and disposing of tiling materials in accordance with safety data sheets and workplace requirements. Competency in this unit ensures that workers can manage tiling materials efficiently, contributing to the smooth execution of tiling projects and adherence to industry standards.

CPC31320.name: Carry out concreting to simple forms
CPC31320.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely install formwork, reinforcement, and place and finish concrete for minor slabs, pathways, and other minor works to a specified design finish. This includes tasks such as preparing the subgrade, erecting and stripping formwork, placing and tying reinforcement, and placing and finishing concrete in accordance with project specifications. Competency in this unit ensures that construction workers can execute basic concreting tasks efficiently and in compliance with industry standards, including the National Construction Code (NCC) and relevant Australian Standards.

CPC31320.name: Apply WHS requirements, policies and procedures in the construction industry
CPC31320.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to implement work health and safety (WHS) requirements through safe work practices in both on-site and off-site construction environments. This includes identifying and assessing risks, recognizing hazardous materials (such as asbestos), planning and preparing for safe work practices, applying these practices effectively, and following emergency procedures. Competency in this unit ensures that construction workers can perform tasks safely, with an emphasis on personal safety and the safety of others, in compliance with legislative requirements and workplace policies.

CPC31320.name: Work effectively and sustainably in the construction industry
CPC31320.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to operate efficiently and sustainably within the construction sector. This encompasses planning and prioritizing work activities, collaborating effectively with team members, understanding various construction job roles and employment pathways, and adhering to environmental and resource efficiency requirements. Competency in this unit ensures that workers can contribute positively to team objectives, pursue continuous personal development, and implement sustainable work practices in compliance with industry standards.

CPC31320.name: Repair wall and floor tiling
CPC31320.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to replace damaged wall and floor tiles. This includes tasks such as removing defective tiles without harming adjacent areas, preparing surfaces for new tile installation, selecting matching replacement tiles, and installing them to maintain alignment and finish consistency. Competency in this unit ensures that tiling professionals can effectively perform repair tasks, restoring the integrity and appearance of tiled surfaces in compliance with industry standards.

CPC31320.name: Erect and dismantle restricted height scaffolding
CPC31320.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to safely and efficiently assemble and disassemble modular scaffolding systems up to a height of 4 metres. This includes tasks such as planning and preparing for scaffolding work, placing safety barriers, selecting and inspecting equipment, erecting scaffolding in accordance with regulations and manufacturer specifications, inspecting and maintaining scaffolding structures, and safely dismantling and storing equipment after use. Competency in this unit ensures that workers can provide secure work platforms for various construction tasks, adhering to industry standards and contributing to overall site safety.

CPC40120.name: Use building science principles to construct energy efficient buildings
CPC40120.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to apply building science principles in the construction of energy-efficient structures. This involves understanding and implementing strategies related to thermal performance, moisture control, ventilation, and sustainable materials to enhance a building's energy efficiency. By mastering these principles, professionals can contribute to the development of buildings that are not only environmentally friendly but also cost-effective in terms of energy consumption.

CPC40120.name: Apply building codes and standards to the construction process for Class 1 and 10 buildings
CPC40120.desc: Equips construction professionals with the skills to access, interpret, and apply relevant building codes and standards as outlined in the National Construction Code (NCC) for Class 1 and 10 buildings up to two storeys. This includes understanding the structure of the NCC and effectively utilizing its information to ensure compliance in various residential construction projects. The unit is essential for builders, site managers, and related professionals responsible for adhering to building codes and standards in residential construction.

CPC40120.name: Apply structural principles to residential and commercial constructions
CPC40120.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to interpret and apply structural principles in both residential and commercial building contexts. This includes understanding load-bearing structures, selecting appropriate construction methods, and ensuring compliance with relevant building codes and standards. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction professionals can make informed decisions regarding structural integrity, contributing to the safety and durability of building projects.

CPC40120.name: Apply site surveys and set out procedures to building and construction projects
CPC40120.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to accurately set out buildings on construction sites using technical instruments and levelling and surveying techniques. This includes determining grid levels, developing contour plans, and performing necessary calculations to ensure precise building placement. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction professionals can effectively apply site surveys and set-out procedures, contributing to the successful execution of building and construction projects.

CPC40120.name: Plan building and construction work
CPC40120.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to effectively plan on-site activities for residential and commercial construction projects. This includes sequencing construction tasks, identifying and organizing necessary human and physical resources, and developing comprehensive project schedules. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction professionals can efficiently coordinate operations, manage resources, and prepare essential documentation, contributing to the successful execution of building and construction projects.

CPC40120.name: Select, prepare and administer a construction contract
CPC40120.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to manage contracts for both commercial and residential construction projects. This includes selecting appropriate contract types, preparing comprehensive contract documents, administering contract-related documents, and identifying causes of contract breaches. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction professionals can effectively oversee contract negotiations, manage contractual obligations, and ensure compliance with legal and regulatory requirements, contributing to the successful execution of construction projects.

CPC40120.name: Apply project quality management techniques
CPC40120.desc: Focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge required to enhance project outcomes through effective quality management. This includes contributing to quality planning by determining stakeholder requirements and identifying quantifiable criteria for deliverables, applying quality policies and procedures by implementing quality assurance and control measures, and participating in continuous improvement processes to review and enhance project outcomes. Proficiency in this unit ensures that project practitioners can support project managers and teams in maintaining high-quality standards throughout the project lifecycle, thereby contributing to the successful completion of projects.

CPC40120.name: Read and interpret plans and specifications
CPC40120.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to accurately interpret construction plans and specifications for residential and commercial projects. This includes identifying site characteristics, understanding structural and non-structural details, and comprehending the layout and dimensions of proposed buildings. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction professionals can effectively translate two-dimensional plans into three-dimensional understanding, facilitating accurate estimation, planning, and supervision of building projects.

CPC40120.name: Supervise site communication and administration processes for building and construction projects
CPC40120.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to oversee on-site communications, ensure compliance with quality control standards, and manage administrative processes in construction projects. This includes developing effective communication systems among on-site and off-site personnel, implementing quality control measures, conducting site inspections to monitor work quality, and maintaining comprehensive project records. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction professionals can effectively coordinate site activities, uphold industry standards, and facilitate successful project completion.

CPC40120.name: Select, procure and store construction materials for building and construction projects
CPC40120.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to supervise the selection, acquisition, and on-site storage of construction materials for residential and commercial projects. This includes evaluating material properties for suitability, ensuring compliance with the National Construction Code (NCC) and project specifications, and managing procurement processes to secure quality materials. Additionally, it involves overseeing the delivery, handling, and storage of materials on-site to prevent damage and maintain quality. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction professionals can effectively manage material resources, contributing to the successful execution of building and construction projects.

CPC40120.name: Produce labour and material schedules for ordering
CPC40120.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to develop comprehensive schedules for both human resources and materials in residential and commercial construction projects. This involves assessing project requirements, breaking down the project into stages and tasks, itemizing necessary materials and labor, and setting milestones and timeframes for commencement and completion. Additionally, it includes monitoring project costs, maintaining project files, and ensuring effective communication with suppliers and contractors. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction professionals can efficiently plan, allocate, and manage resources, contributing to the successful execution of building and construction projects.

CPC40120.name: Manage work health and safety in the building and construction workplace
CPC40120.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to effectively manage workplace health and safety (WHS) within the building and construction industry. This includes conducting thorough workplace inspections to identify potential hazards, performing comprehensive WHS risk analyses, and developing and implementing appropriate responses to mitigate identified risks in compliance with government legislation and regulations. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction professionals, such as builders, site managers, and forepersons, can establish and maintain safe work environments, thereby reducing the likelihood of accidents and promoting overall site safety.

CPC40120.name: Apply legal requirements to building and construction projects
CPC40120.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge necessary to ensure compliance with legal and regulatory obligations in residential and commercial construction projects. This includes understanding and applying relevant legislation, such as licensing and registration requirements, work health and safety (WHS) regulations, building codes, and standards. Additionally, it covers managing contractual obligations, insurance requirements, financial transactions, and industrial relations policies. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction professionals can effectively navigate the legal landscape of the construction industry, ensuring projects adhere to all necessary legal standards and obligations.

CPC40120.name: Apply building codes and standards to the construction process for Class 2 to 9 Type C buildings
CPC40120.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to access, interpret, and apply relevant building codes and standards, specifically the National Construction Code (NCC), to Class 2 to 9 Type C building projects. This includes understanding the structure of the NCC, determining building classifications, ensuring construction compliance with performance requirements, and identifying fire protection requirements. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction professionals, such as builders and site managers, can effectively ensure compliance with building codes and standards, contributing to the successful execution of building and construction projects.

CPC40120.name: Resolve business disputes
CPC40120.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to effectively manage and resolve disputes that may arise during residential and commercial contracting projects. This includes developing and implementing dispute resolution processes and procedures, evaluating dispute information, negotiating with involved parties, and identifying opportunities for resolution through internal or external means. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction professionals, such as builders and site supervisors, can address conflicts positively, maintaining project continuity and fostering professional relationships.

CPC40120.name: Minimise waste on the building and construction site
CPC40120.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to support sustainable building practices by minimizing waste removed from residential or commercial construction sites. This includes planning a waste minimization strategy, calculating cost benefits, and implementing alternative waste minimization systems. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction professionals can effectively manage compliance with waste regulations and adopt environmentally responsible practices, contributing to the sustainability and efficiency of building projects.

CPC40120.name: Manage finances for new business ventures
CPC40120.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to implement and review financial management strategies for new business ventures. This includes utilizing new and emerging digital technologies, interpreting financial reports, and analyzing numerical data to make informed financial decisions. Key components involve developing financial budgets or projections, managing business capital, ensuring compliance with taxation requirements, and monitoring financial performance through key performance indicators (KPIs). Proficiency in this unit ensures that entrepreneurs and business managers can effectively oversee the financial aspects of new ventures, contributing to their sustainability and growth.

CPC40120.name: Prepare simple building sketches and drawings
CPC40120.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to produce clear and descriptive sketches and drawings for building and construction projects. This includes capturing design concepts from architectural plans, creating two-dimensional and three-dimensional sketches, and applying standard drawing conventions such as symbols, abbreviations, and notations. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction professionals can effectively communicate ideas to clients and other stakeholders, facilitating accurate estimations and detailed explanations of construction details and measurements.

CPC40120.name: Identify and produce estimated costs for building and construction projects
CPC40120.desc: Equips individuals with the skills and knowledge required to accurately estimate costs associated with materials, labor, and other resources in construction projects. This includes interpreting construction drawings and specifications, calculating material quantities, estimating labor hours and costs, identifying physical resource requirements, and compiling comprehensive project cost estimates. Proficiency in this unit ensures that construction professionals can develop precise cost estimations, facilitating effective budgeting and financial planning for building and construction projects.

CPC41020.name: Lead team effectiveness
CPC41020.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge required to lead teams in a workplace environment. It encompasses planning and supervising team performance to achieve organisational goals and objectives. Key aspects include developing team plans, leading and facilitating teamwork, and actively liaising with management.

CPC41020.name: Manage work health and safety in the building and construction workplace
CPC41020.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to manage work health and safety (WHS) in building and construction workplaces. It involves inspecting workplaces for hazards, conducting risk analyses, and developing and implementing appropriate responses to mitigate risks, ensuring compliance with legislative requirements and organisational policies.

CPC41020.name: Read and interpret plans and specifications
CPC41020.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to read and interpret plans and specifications relevant to construction projects. It includes identifying types of drawings and specifications, recognising commonly used symbols and abbreviations, and understanding project requirements to ensure accurate implementation in construction activities.

CPC41020.name: Plan and prepare for activities on demolition sites
CPC41020.desc: This unit specifies the competencies required to plan and prepare for demolition activities. It covers assessing site conditions, identifying hazards, determining demolition methods, and arranging necessary resources to ensure demolition work is conducted safely and efficiently.

CPC41020.name: Plan demolition work to minimise risk to health, safety and environment
CPC41020.desc: This unit focuses on planning demolition work with an emphasis on minimising risks to health, safety, and the environment. It involves developing strategies to control hazards, ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements, and implementing measures to protect workers and the surrounding environment during demolition activities.

CPC41020.name: Supervise operational activities on demolition sites
CPC41020.desc: This unit involves supervising operational activities on demolition sites. It includes coordinating tasks, monitoring work progress, ensuring compliance with safety standards, and managing personnel to achieve project objectives efficiently and safely.

CPC41020.name: Finalise demolition activities and supervise property handover
CPC41020.desc: This unit covers the processes involved in finalising demolition activities and supervising the handover of the property. It includes ensuring all demolition tasks are completed to specifications, conducting site inspections, addressing any discrepancies, and completing necessary documentation to facilitate a smooth handover to the client or their representative.

CPC41020.name: Apply structural principles to the planning of the demolition of a structure
CPC41020.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to apply structural principles in planning the demolition of structures. It involves understanding structural integrity, assessing potential risks, and developing demolition plans that ensure safety and compliance with relevant standards and regulations.

CPC41020.name: Identify and produce estimated costs for building and construction projects
CPC41020.desc: This unit involves identifying and producing estimated costs for building and construction projects. It includes analysing project documentation, calculating material and labour costs, and preparing detailed cost estimates to support budgeting and financial planning in construction projects.

CPC41020.name: Read and interpret demolition site plans and drawings
CPC41020.desc: This unit focuses on the ability to read and interpret site plans and drawings specific to demolition projects. It encompasses understanding symbols, notations, and details presented in plans to accurately determine the scope and requirements of demolition tasks.

CPC41020.name: Remove non-friable asbestos
CPC41020.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to safely remove non-friable asbestos-containing material (ACM) in various settings, including construction sites, ships, and soils. It encompasses preparing the work area, containing and removing non-friable ACM, and adhering to decontamination and disposal protocols. Completion of this unit is mandatory for workers involved in removing more than ten square metres of non-friable ACM, aligning with national occupational licensing requirements.

CPC41020.name: Remove friable asbestos
CPC41020.desc: This unit covers the competencies necessary to remove friable asbestos-containing material (ACM). It involves preparing and enclosing the removal area, employing safe removal practices, and following stringent decontamination and disposal procedures. Successful completion certifies individuals to undertake Class A (friable) asbestos removal work, as required by national occupational licensing standards.

CPC41020.name: Apply WHS requirements, policies and procedures in the construction industry
CPC41020.desc: This unit focuses on the application of Work Health and Safety (WHS) requirements, policies, and procedures within the construction industry. It includes identifying and following safety procedures, understanding legislative requirements, and implementing risk control measures to maintain a safe work environment.

CPC41020.name: Demolish small buildings and structures using hand tools and small plant and equipment
CPC41020.desc: This unit involves the demolition of small buildings and structures using hand tools and small plant equipment. It covers planning and preparing for demolition work, safely operating tools and equipment, and adhering to environmental and safety regulations throughout the demolition process.

CPC41020.name: Prepare to work safely in the construction industry
CPC41020.desc: This unit provides the essential knowledge and skills required to work safely in the construction industry. It includes understanding basic safety requirements, recognising common hazards, and following workplace procedures to ensure personal and site safety. Completion of this unit is a prerequisite for obtaining a construction induction card, commonly known as a 'White Card', which is mandatory for construction work in Australia.

MEM40119.name: Carry out mechanical cutting
MEM40119.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to set up and operate various mechanical cutting and holing equipment, such as guillotines, croppers, cold saws, band saws, automatic saws, and abrasive saws.
