It involves selecting appropriate methods and machines, preparing materials, and ensuring cuts meet specified requirements. Applications include cutting for manufacturing, production, and maintenance purposes.

MEM40119.name: Apply fabrication, forming and shaping techniques
MEM40119.desc: This unit involves applying a range of fabrication, forming, and shaping techniques to produce components to specifications. It includes interpreting technical drawings, selecting appropriate materials and equipment, and performing operations such as bending, rolling, and forming to achieve the desired shapes and dimensions.

MEM40119.name: Perform routine manual metal arc welding
MEM40119.desc: This unit defines the skills and knowledge required to carry out routine manual metal arc welding (MMAW) on low carbon mild steel, where the welding is not required to meet an Australian Standard or equivalent. It includes preparing materials, setting up equipment, selecting appropriate electrodes, and performing welding operations to job requirements.

MEM40119.name: Weld using manual metal arc welding process
MEM40119.desc: This unit covers performing manual metal arc welding (MMAW) to industry standards. It includes preparing materials and equipment, selecting appropriate electrodes, and executing welding tasks to meet specified standards and codes.

MEM40119.name: Apply welding principles
MEM40119.desc: This unit involves applying fundamental welding principles to various tasks. It includes understanding welding processes, interpreting welding specifications, selecting appropriate welding techniques, and ensuring compliance with safety and quality standards.

MEM40119.name: Repair, replace and/or modify fabrications
MEM40119.desc: This unit covers the skills required to repair, replace, or modify fabricated components. It includes assessing the condition of fabrications, determining repair or modification requirements, selecting appropriate methods and materials, and performing the necessary operations to restore or alter the fabrication as specified.

MEM40119.name: Perform welds to code standards using flux core arc welding process
MEM40119.desc: This unit involves performing welds to code standards using the flux core arc welding (FCAW) process. It includes preparing materials and equipment, selecting appropriate consumables, and executing welding operations to meet specified code standards, ensuring quality and compliance.

MEM40119.name: Perform routine gas metal arc welding
MEM40119.desc: This unit covers performing routine gas metal arc welding (GMAW) on various materials. It includes preparing materials, setting up welding equipment, selecting appropriate consumables, and carrying out welding operations to meet job specifications and quality requirements.

MEM40119.name: Apply safe welding practices
MEM40119.desc: This unit involves applying safe welding practices in the workplace. It includes understanding and adhering to work health and safety (WHS) requirements, using personal protective equipment (PPE), identifying hazards, and implementing control measures to ensure a safe welding environment.

MEM40119.name: Perform general machining
MEM40119.desc: This unit covers performing general machining operations using machines such as lathes, milling machines, and drilling machines. It includes interpreting technical drawings, selecting appropriate materials and tools, setting up machines, and carrying out machining tasks to produce components to specified tolerances and standards.

MEM40119.name: Perform grinding operations
MEM40119.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to perform grinding operations using a range of grinding machines. It includes selecting appropriate grinding wheels, setting up machines, and applying grinding techniques to achieve specified tolerances and surface finishes. The unit also emphasises adherence to safety procedures and the proper maintenance of equipment.

MEM40119.name: Use workshop machines for basic operations
MEM40119.desc: This unit involves using workshop machines to carry out basic operations such as drilling, sawing, grinding, and turning. It includes selecting appropriate machines and tools, setting up workpieces, and performing operations to achieve specified outcomes. The unit also focuses on following safety protocols and maintaining equipment in good working order.

MEM40119.name: Interpret technical drawing
MEM40119.desc: This unit covers interpreting technical drawings used in manufacturing, engineering, and related environments. It includes understanding and extracting information from drawings, such as dimensions, tolerances, and material specifications, to inform work activities. The unit also emphasises the importance of accuracy in interpreting drawings to ensure compliance with design requirements.

MEM40119.name: Install machine/plant
MEM40119.desc: This unit involves installing machinery or plant equipment, requiring substantial modifications to existing sites or connecting equipment. It includes inspecting and preparing installation sites, positioning and aligning machinery, and performing routine modifications as necessary. The unit also highlights the importance of adhering to safety standards and completing necessary documentation.

MEM40119.name: Undertake manual handling
MEM40119.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to safely lift and move materials manually. It includes identifying manual handling tasks, assessing risks, and using appropriate techniques and equipment to minimise the risk of injury. The unit emphasises the importance of following workplace procedures and adhering to safety regulations during manual handling activities.

MEM40119.name: Order materials
MEM40119.desc: This unit involves ordering materials required for production or maintenance activities. It includes identifying material requirements, selecting appropriate suppliers, placing orders, and monitoring deliveries to ensure materials meet specifications and are available when needed. The unit also focuses on maintaining accurate records of orders and deliveries.

MEM40119.name: Perform precision mechanical measurement
MEM40119.desc: This unit covers performing precision mechanical measurements using a range of measuring devices. It includes selecting appropriate measuring equipment, accurately obtaining measurements, and interpreting results to ensure they meet specified tolerances. The unit also emphasises the maintenance and calibration of measuring instruments to ensure ongoing accuracy.

MEM40119.name: Mark off/out (general engineering)
MEM40119.desc: This unit involves marking off/out general engineering components using appropriate tools and techniques. It includes interpreting specifications, selecting suitable marking-out equipment, and transferring dimensions accurately to workpieces. The unit also highlights the importance of establishing datum points and following safety procedures during marking-out activities.

MEM40119.name: Mark off/out structural fabrications and shapes
MEM40119.desc: This unit covers marking off/out structural fabrications and shapes, such as beams and columns, to specifications. It includes interpreting technical drawings, selecting appropriate tools, and accurately transferring measurements to materials. The unit also focuses on ensuring that marking out is precise to facilitate correct fabrication and assembly.

MEM40119.name: Perform engineering measurements
MEM40119.desc: This unit involves performing engineering measurements using mechanical measuring devices. It includes selecting and using appropriate measuring instruments, obtaining accurate measurements, and performing necessary calculations. The unit also emphasises the importance of routine care and maintenance of measuring devices to ensure their accuracy and longevity.

MEM40119.name: Perform computations
MEM40119.desc: This unit covers performing mathematical calculations required in a manufacturing, engineering, or related environment. It includes arithmetic operations, algebraic expressions, geometry, and trigonometry to determine dimensions, tolerances, and material requirements. Accurate computations are essential for ensuring components meet specifications and quality standards.

MEM40119.name: Work safely and effectively in manufacturing and engineering
MEM40119.desc: This unit involves applying safe work practices and effective performance in manufacturing and engineering settings. It includes understanding work health and safety (WHS) regulations, identifying hazards, using personal protective equipment (PPE), and following standard operating procedures to maintain a safe and productive work environment.

MEM40119.name: Plan work activities
MEM40119.desc: This unit covers planning work activities in a manufacturing or engineering context. It involves interpreting job requirements, sequencing tasks, allocating resources, and coordinating with team members to ensure efficient workflow and timely completion of tasks.

MEM40119.name: Operate as a team member to conduct manufacturing, engineering or related activities
MEM40119.desc: This unit involves functioning effectively as a team member in manufacturing, engineering, or related activities. It includes understanding team goals, communicating effectively, collaborating with colleagues, and contributing to problem-solving to achieve team objectives.

MEM40119.name: Organise and communicate information
MEM40119.desc: This unit covers accessing, organising, and communicating information related to production, maintenance, or associated processes in manufacturing and engineering environments. It includes interpreting technical documents, using workplace terminology correctly, and conveying information through appropriate communication methods.

MEM40119.name: Interact with computing technology
MEM40119.desc: This unit involves using computing technology to perform work tasks in manufacturing and engineering settings. It includes operating computer hardware and software, managing files, and utilising relevant applications to support job functions.

MEM40119.name: Assist in the provision of on-the-job training
MEM40119.desc: This unit covers assisting in delivering on-the-job training to others. It includes demonstrating work skills, providing clear instructions, offering feedback, and supporting colleagues in developing their competencies within the workplace.

MEM40119.name: Use hand tools
MEM40119.desc: This unit involves selecting, using, and maintaining hand tools for various tasks in manufacturing and engineering environments. It includes understanding the appropriate application of tools, ensuring their safe use, and performing routine maintenance to keep them in good working condition.

MEM40119.name: Use power tools/hand-held operations
MEM40119.desc: This unit covers the safe and effective use of hand-held power tools in manufacturing and engineering tasks. It includes selecting appropriate tools, operating them according to manufacturer guidelines, and adhering to safety procedures to perform tasks such as cutting, grinding, and drilling.

MEM40119.name: Use tools for precision work
MEM40119.desc: This unit involves using precision tools to carry out tasks requiring high accuracy in manufacturing and engineering contexts. It includes selecting and utilising tools such as micrometers, vernier calipers, and gauges to measure and achieve precise dimensions and tolerances.

MEM40119.name: Maintain and overhaul mechanical equipment
MEM40119.desc: This unit covers diagnosing faults, repairing, overhauling, fitting, and adjusting mechanical systems and equipment. It integrates diagnostic, maintenance, and overhaul competencies, applying to situations requiring comprehensive skills in maintaining and overhauling mechanical systems.

MEM40119.name: Perform fault diagnosis, installation and removal of bearings
MEM40119.desc: This unit involves diagnosing faults in bearings, as well as their installation and removal in mechanical equipment. It includes selecting appropriate tools and techniques to ensure bearings are correctly fitted and functioning, maintaining equipment reliability and performance.

MEM40119.name: Perform precision fitting of engineering components
MEM40119.desc: This unit covers the precision fitting of engineering components, ensuring they meet specified tolerances and operational requirements. It includes interpreting technical drawings, selecting appropriate tools, and applying fitting techniques to assemble or repair components accurately.

MEM40119.name: Balance equipment
MEM40119.desc: This unit involves balancing rotating or reciprocating equipment to ensure smooth operation and prevent excessive vibration. It includes using appropriate balancing techniques and equipment to achieve the required balance specifications, enhancing equipment longevity and performance.

MEM40119.name: Perform precision levelling and alignment of machines and engineering components
MEM40119.desc: This unit covers performing precision levelling and alignment of machines and engineering components to ensure optimal operation. It includes using precision instruments to level and align machinery according to specifications, preventing operational issues and maintaining efficiency.

MEM40119.name: Shut down and isolate machines/equipment
MEM40119.desc: This unit involves safely shutting down and isolating machines or equipment for maintenance or in emergency situations. It includes following standard operating procedures to ensure equipment is safely de-energised and secured, protecting personnel and equipment from hazards.

MEM40119.name: Perform installation and removal of mechanical seals
MEM40119.desc: This unit covers installing and removing mechanical seals in equipment to prevent leakage of fluids. It includes selecting appropriate seals, using correct installation techniques, and ensuring seals are fitted according to manufacturer specifications to maintain equipment integrity.

MEM40119.name: Modify mechanical systems and equipment
MEM40119.desc: This unit involves modifying mechanical systems and equipment to meet new specifications or improve performance. It includes planning modifications, selecting appropriate tools and techniques, and implementing changes while ensuring compliance with safety and operational standards.

MEM40119.name: Dismantle, replace and assemble engineering components
MEM40119.desc: This unit covers dismantling, replacing, and assembling engineering components as part of maintenance or repair activities. It includes interpreting technical information, selecting appropriate tools, and applying correct procedures to ensure components are correctly assembled and functional.

MEM40119.name: Participate in environmentally sustainable work practices
MEM40119.desc: This unit involves participating in environmentally sustainable work practices within the workplace. It includes identifying environmental regulations, assessing current practices, and contributing to the implementation of improvements to reduce environmental impacts, promoting sustainability.

CPC40920.name: Establish legal and risk management requirements of new business ventures
CPC40920.desc: This unit covers the essential processes for identifying and complying with legal and risk management requirements when establishing a new business venture. It involves researching and implementing procedures to meet legal obligations, developing risk management strategies, and maintaining effective systems to ensure ongoing compliance.

CPC40920.name: Plan finances for new business ventures
CPC40920.desc: This unit focuses on identifying and planning the financial requirements essential for launching a new business venture. It encompasses setting profit targets, calculating costs and pricing, conducting break-even analyses, and developing comprehensive financial plans, including cash flow projections and budgeting. Additionally, it involves researching and selecting appropriate sources of finance to ensure the venture's financial viability.

CPC40920.name: Manage work health and safety in the building and construction workplace
CPC40920.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge required to manage work health and safety (WHS) in building and construction workplaces. It involves inspecting sites for hazards, conducting risk analyses, and developing and implementing appropriate responses to mitigate risks in compliance with government legislation and regulations. This unit is essential for builders, site managers, and forepersons responsible for managing risk in construction environments.

CPC40920.name: Read and interpret plans and specifications
CPC40920.desc: This unit focuses on developing the skills and knowledge necessary to accurately read and interpret plans and specifications for residential and commercial construction projects. It encompasses identifying various types of plans, understanding drawing conventions, recognising structural and non-structural details, and applying this information to tasks such as estimation, planning, and supervision within the building and construction industry.

CPC40920.name: Apply sustainable building design principles to water management systems
CPC40920.desc: This unit focuses on applying sustainable building design principles to the development and implementation of water management systems in construction projects. It involves assessing and selecting appropriate water management strategies, such as rainwater harvesting, greywater recycling, and efficient plumbing design, to minimise environmental impact and promote resource efficiency. The unit emphasises compliance with relevant regulations and standards to ensure the sustainability and effectiveness of water management solutions.

CPC40920.name: Resolve business disputes
CPC40920.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge required to advise on or resolve business disputes that may arise during activities in residential and commercial contracting projects. It includes the development and implementation of dispute resolution processes and procedures. This unit applies to builders, site supervisors, and related construction industry professionals responsible for resolving business disputes in a positive manner.

CPC40920.name: Carry out WHS requirements
CPC40920.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge required to carry out work health and safety (WHS) requirements in a plumbing and services work environment. It involves participating in workplace inductions, planning and preparing for safe work practices, identifying and assessing risks, recognising hazardous materials, and applying safe work procedures to ensure personal and site safety.

CPC40920.name: Carry out work-based risk control processes
CPC40920.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge required to carry out work-based risk control processes in plumbing and services work environments. It involves identifying potential hazards, assessing associated risks, implementing appropriate control measures, and reviewing their effectiveness to ensure workplace safety. The unit emphasises compliance with relevant work health and safety (WHS) regulations and the development of risk control policies and procedures.

CPC40920.name: Estimate and cost work
CPC40920.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge required to estimate materials, labour, and time for plumbing services in Class 1 buildings. It involves gathering customer requirements, interpreting plans and specifications, considering sustainability principles, and calculating costs, including overheads and mark-up percentages, to produce accurate quotations. Additionally, it covers documenting and verifying cost details in accordance with workplace procedures.

CPC40920.name: Access and interpret regulatory requirements for the plumbing and services industry
CPC40920.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge required to access and interpret regulatory requirements pertinent to the plumbing and services industry. It involves understanding the hierarchical relationship between legislation, regulations, codes, and standards, including the National Construction Code (NCC). The unit emphasises identifying building classifications, jurisdictional variations, and the distinction between Performance Solutions and Deemed-to-Satisfy (DTS) provisions to ensure compliance in plumbing projects.

CPC40920.name: Design and size sanitary drainage systems
CPC40920.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge required to design, size, and document the layout of sanitary drainage systems for residential and commercial unit developments. It involves interpreting plans and specifications, determining fixture requirements, calculating pipe sizes, and ensuring compliance with relevant Australian standards and jurisdictional regulations. The unit emphasises the application of sustainable design principles and the accurate documentation of system layouts to meet industry standards.

CPC40920.name: Design and size stormwater drainage systems
CPC40920.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge required to design, size, and document the layout of surface and sub-soil stormwater drainage systems up to legal points of discharge for residential dwellings (Class 1a), commercial Class 6 buildings, and unit complexes comprising at least eight Class 1a dwellings. It involves interpreting plans and specifications, performing catchment and runoff calculations, selecting appropriate materials, and ensuring compliance with relevant Australian standards and jurisdictional requirements.

CPC40920.name: Design and size consumer gas installations
CPC40920.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge required to design and size consumer gas installations, including consumer piping, flueing, and ventilation systems. It involves preparing for the design process, determining specific gas installation requirements, planning detailed system layouts, and completing necessary documentation. The unit ensures compliance with relevant Australian standards and jurisdictional regulations to promote safe and efficient gas installations.

CPC40920.name: Design and size sanitary plumbing systems
CPC40920.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge required to design, size, and document the layout of sanitary plumbing systems for multi-floor residential and commercial buildings. It involves interpreting plans and specifications, determining fixture requirements, calculating pipe sizes, and ensuring compliance with relevant Australian Standards and jurisdictional regulations. The unit emphasises the application of sustainable design principles and the accurate documentation of system layouts to meet industry standards.

CPC40920.name: Design and size heated and cold-water services and systems
CPC40920.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge required to design, size, and document the layout of heated, tempered, and cold-water services, flushing systems, and hydrant and hose reel systems for residential and commercial multi-floor buildings. It involves interpreting plans and specifications, performing calculations to determine appropriate pipe sizes and system components, and ensuring compliance with relevant Australian Standards and jurisdictional requirements. The unit emphasises the application of sustainable design principles and accurate documentation to meet industry standards.

CPP41419.name: Manage tenant relationships
CPP41419.desc: This unit focuses on establishing and maintaining positive relationships with tenants in the real estate industry. It encompasses effective communication, addressing tenant concerns, ensuring compliance with lease agreements, and managing tenant expectations to promote satisfaction and retention.

CPP41419.name: End tenancy
CPP41419.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge required to finalise a tenancy in the real estate sector. It covers identifying circumstances for ending tenancy agreements, preparing necessary documentation, coordinating property inspections, managing bond releases, and addressing issues arising from tenancy terminations.

CPP41419.name: Access and interpret legislation in real estate
CPP41419.desc: This unit focuses on equipping individuals with the skills and knowledge to identify, access, and interpret legislation pertinent to real estate operations. It encompasses understanding the legislative framework, recognising the structure of laws, maintaining current knowledge of relevant legislation, and applying this understanding to ensure compliance in real estate practices.

CPP41419.name: Market property
CPP41419.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge required to market properties for sale or lease in the real estate industry. It encompasses developing and implementing marketing plans tailored to specific properties, preparing marketing materials, selecting appropriate media channels, and monitoring the effectiveness of marketing activities to attract potential buyers or tenants.

CPP41419.name: Manage tenancy
CPP41419.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge required to manage a tenancy effectively. It includes timely and effective communication with tenants, landlords, and other stakeholders, as well as the management of rent payments, arrears, routine inspections, repairs, maintenance, tenancy renewals, rent increases, and tenancy agreement breaches.

CPP41419.name: Prepare for professional practice in real estate
CPP41419.desc: This unit focuses on understanding the personal and legislative requirements essential for professional practice in real estate. It encompasses knowledge of business structures, regulatory frameworks, codes of practice, and professional development pathways within the industry.

CPP41419.name: Appraise property for sale or lease
CPP41419.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge required to appraise residential property for sale or lease. It includes selecting appropriate appraisal methods, conducting property inspections, analysing market conditions, and recommending a price range or rental value. This unit does not cover formal property valuations.

CPP41419.name: Transact in trust accounts
CPP41419.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to conduct transactions in real estate trust accounts. It includes identifying the purpose and types of property trust accounts, applying agency controls to transactions in property trust accounts for specific purposes, balancing, reconciling and reporting on trust account transactions, and maintaining records of trust account transactions. The unit applies to people currently working in or seeking to work in real estate in a capacity that requires them to transact in trust accounts. State or territory licensing requirements may apply to this unit.

CPP41419.name: Present at hearings in real estate
CPP41419.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to effectively appear before a hearing in the real estate industry. It encompasses preparing for hearings, adhering to appropriate hearing etiquette, participating in conciliation processes, and presenting a case during hearings. The unit applies to industry professionals acting on behalf of principals in real estate. State or territory licensing requirements may apply to this unit.

CPP41419.name: Use inclusive work practices
CPP41419.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to recognise and interact productively with diverse groups of individuals in the workplace. It covers responding to and working effectively with individual differences that might be encountered during the course of work. The unit applies to individuals who work in a variety of contexts where they will be expected to interact with diverse groups of individuals. They may also provide some leadership and guidance to others and have some limited responsibility for the output of others. No licensing, legislative or certification requirements apply to this unit at the time of publication.

CPP41419.name: Establish landlord relationships
CPP41419.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to establish and maintain effective relationships with landlords in property management. It includes confirming the scope of landlord requirements, completing property management agreements, and establishing frameworks for communication. The unit applies to individuals working in real estate who are responsible for managing landlord relationships. State or territory licensing requirements may apply to this unit.

CPP41419.name: Prepare to work with real estate trust accounts
CPP41419.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to work with real estate trust accounts within established agency controls. It includes examining trust accounts, identifying established controls applicable to real estate trust account transactions, and explaining common inaccuracies in trust account transactions. The unit applies to individuals currently working in or seeking to work in the real estate industry. State or territory licensing requirements may apply to this unit.

CPP41419.name: Access and interpret ethical practice in real estate
CPP41419.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to work ethically in real estate. It includes expressing a thorough understanding of ethical standards in real estate. This unit supports real estate professionals in reducing financial and reputational risks, meeting consumer protection standards, and dealing responsibly with ethical breaches and challenges. The unit applies to people currently working in or seeking to work in real estate. State or territory licensing requirements may apply to this unit.

CPP41419.name: Establish vendor relationships
CPP41419.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to establish and maintain effective relationships with vendors in property sales. It includes planning prospecting activities, confirming vendor needs and expectations, preparing and conducting listing presentations, completing listing agreements, and planning for ongoing communication and records management associated with the vendor relationship. The unit applies to individuals working in real estate who manage vendor relationships. State or territory licensing requirements may apply to this unit.

CPP41419.name: Deliver presentations to clients in real estate
CPP41419.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to present information to clients in real estate in a planned, structured, and professional manner. It includes preparing for presentations, conducting them effectively, and reviewing their outcomes to identify areas for improvement. The unit applies to industry professionals acting on behalf of principals in real estate. State or territory licensing requirements may apply to this unit.

CPP41419.name: Establish marketing and communication profiles in real estate
CPP41419.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to develop marketing and communication profiles in real estate. It includes understanding methods for marketing and communicating, clarifying the type, value, and purpose of different communication activities, and developing a personal profile for marketing and communication in real estate. This unit applies to people currently working in or seeking to work in real estate. State or territory licensing requirements may apply to this unit.

CPP41419.name: Sell property
CPP41419.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to sell property through methods such as private treaty, auction, and other negotiations. It includes preparing the property for sale, negotiating sales between vendors and buyers, and facilitating the completion of contracts. The unit applies to individuals currently working in or seeking to work in real estate who apply knowledge of legislative and compliance requirements, ethical standards, and consumer preferences to manage real estate operations. State or territory licensing requirements may apply to this unit.

CPP41419.name: Establish buyer relationships
CPP41419.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to establish, develop, and manage positive relationships with buyers in the real estate industry. It includes identifying and explaining ethical and conduct standards, promoting personal and agency brands in communication with buyers, responding to and documenting buyer inquiries, clarifying and documenting buyer preferences, matching buyer preferences to properties for sale, presenting opportunities for property inspections, interpreting buyer feedback, developing communication strategies to address buyer expectations, and maintaining ethical practice, client service, and confidentiality standards. The unit applies to individuals working in real estate who apply knowledge of legislative and compliance requirements, ethical standards, and consumer preferences to manage real estate operations. State or territory licensing requirements may apply to this unit.

CPC50220.name: Manage business risk
CPC50220.desc: This unit covers the development and implementation of strategies to manage business risks. It involves identifying potential risks, analysing their likelihood and impact, and developing appropriate mitigation plans to minimise adverse effects on business operations.

CPC50220.name: Lead WHS risk management
CPC50220.desc: This unit focuses on leading workplace health and safety (WHS) risk management processes. It includes establishing risk management frameworks, identifying hazards, assessing risks, and implementing control measures to ensure a safe working environment.

CPC50220.name: Apply building codes and standards to the construction process for Class 1 and 10 buildings
CPC50220.desc: This unit involves accessing, interpreting, and applying relevant building codes and standards to the construction of Class 1 and 10 buildings, which include residential dwellings and non-habitable structures. It ensures compliance with the National Construction Code (NCC) and other legislative requirements.

CPC50220.name: Select, prepare and administer a construction contract
CPC50220.desc: This unit covers the processes of selecting appropriate construction contracts, preparing contract documentation, and administering the contract throughout the construction phase. It ensures that all parties understand their obligations and that the project is completed in accordance with contractual agreements.

CPC50220.name: Identify and produce estimated costs for building and construction projects
CPC50220.desc: This unit involves identifying and estimating the costs associated with building and construction projects. It includes analysing project documentation, calculating material and labour costs, and preparing detailed cost estimates to inform budgeting and financial planning.

CPC50220.name: Produce labour and material schedules for ordering
CPC50220.desc: This unit focuses on developing detailed schedules for labour and materials required for construction projects. It involves interpreting project plans and specifications to determine quantities and timelines, ensuring that resources are available when needed to maintain project efficiency.

CPC50220.name: Supervise site communication and administration processes for building and construction projects
CPC50220.desc: This unit covers the supervision of communication and administrative processes on construction sites. It includes managing information flow, coordinating meetings, maintaining records, and ensuring effective communication among stakeholders to facilitate smooth project operations.

CPC50220.name: Apply legal requirements to building and construction projects
CPC50220.desc: This unit involves understanding and applying legal requirements relevant to building and construction projects. It includes knowledge of contracts, regulations, codes, and standards to ensure that all aspects of the project comply with legal and regulatory obligations.

CPC50220.name: Apply structural principles to residential and commercial constructions
CPC50220.desc: This unit focuses on applying structural principles to the construction of residential and commercial buildings. It involves understanding load-bearing structures, material properties, and construction methods to ensure the structural integrity and safety of buildings.

CPC50220.name: Read and interpret plans and specifications
CPC50220.desc: This unit involves the ability to read and interpret construction plans and specifications for both residential and commercial projects. It includes identifying site characteristics, understanding building layouts, and extracting essential information to guide construction activities.

CPC50220.name: Prepare and evaluate tender documentation
CPC50220.desc: This unit involves evaluating project and contract requirements to prepare and formalise tender documentation in the building and construction industry. It includes interpreting, compiling, and documenting essential project information into a final tender document.

CPC50220.name: Prepare simple building sketches and drawings
CPC50220.desc: This unit focuses on preparing sketches and drawings used for communicating ideas to clients and other parties in the building and construction industry. It includes capturing design concepts from architectural drawings to create simpler versions for estimating and explaining details.

CPC50220.name: Apply site surveys and set-out procedures to building and construction projects
CPC50220.desc: This unit covers applying site surveys and set-out procedures to building and construction projects. It involves interpreting site plans, conducting site surveys, and setting out building works in accordance with project specifications and relevant standards.

CPC50220.name: Apply building codes and standards to the construction process for Class 2 to 9 Type C buildings
CPC50220.desc: This unit involves accessing, interpreting, and applying relevant building codes and standards to the construction of Class 2 to 9, Type C buildings. It ensures compliance with the National Construction Code (NCC) and other legislative requirements for these building classes.

CPC50220.name: Apply building codes and standards to the construction process for Type B construction
CPC50220.desc: This unit focuses on applying building codes and standards to the construction process for Type B construction. It involves ensuring that building work complies with the National Construction Code (NCC) and other relevant standards for Type B buildings.

CPC50220.name: Monitor costing systems on complex building and construction projects
CPC50220.desc: This unit covers monitoring costing systems on complex building and construction projects. It includes overseeing financial management processes, ensuring accurate cost reporting, and maintaining budgetary control throughout the project lifecycle.

CPC50220.name: Supervise the planning of on-site building and construction work
CPC50220.desc: This unit involves supervising the planning of on-site building and construction work. It includes coordinating site activities, managing resources, and ensuring that work is planned and executed in accordance with project schedules and quality requirements.

CPC50220.name: Select and manage building and construction contractors
CPC50220.desc: This unit focuses on selecting and managing building and construction contractors. It involves evaluating contractor capabilities, negotiating contracts, and overseeing contractor performance to ensure project requirements are met.

CPC50220.name: Administer the legal obligations of a building and construction contractor
CPC50220.desc: This unit covers administering the legal obligations of a building and construction contractor. It includes understanding and managing contractual, legal, and regulatory responsibilities to ensure compliance throughout the construction process.

CPC50220.name: Manage construction work
CPC50220.desc: This unit involves managing on-site construction work to meet commercial contractual obligations. It includes establishing effective communication processes, managing risks and work health and safety (WHS), overseeing the supply of materials and equipment, and coordinating on-site operations to ensure project timelines and quality standards are met.

CPC50220.name: Manage environmental management practices and processes in building and construction
CPC50220.desc: This unit focuses on planning and implementing effective environmental management practices in building and construction projects. It encompasses developing environmental management plans, ensuring compliance with environmental legislation, monitoring environmental performance, and promoting sustainable building practices to minimise environmental impact.

CPC50220.name: Manage professional technical and legal reports on building and construction projects
CPC50220.desc: This unit involves managing the preparation and evaluation of professional, technical, and legal reports related to building and construction projects. It includes interpreting complex documentation, ensuring reports comply with regulatory requirements, and effectively communicating findings to stakeholders to support informed decision-making.

CPC50220.name: Apply structural principles to the construction of buildings up to three storeys
CPC50220.desc: This unit covers the application of structural principles in the construction of buildings up to three storeys. It involves understanding load-bearing components, selecting appropriate construction methods, and ensuring compliance with relevant building codes and standards to maintain structural integrity and safety.

CPC50220.name: Manage building and construction business finances
CPC50220.desc: This unit focuses on managing the financial aspects of a building and construction business. It includes budgeting, financial planning, monitoring cash flow, and ensuring financial compliance to support the profitability and sustainability of the business.

CPC50220.name: Manage project quality
CPC50220.desc: This unit involves managing project quality to ensure outcomes meet stakeholder expectations. It includes developing quality management plans, implementing quality assurance processes, and conducting quality control activities to achieve project objectives.

CPC50220.name: Identify services layout and connection methods for Type B and C constructions
CPC50220.desc: This unit covers identifying the layout and connection methods for services in Type B and C constructions. It involves interpreting plans and specifications, coordinating with service providers, and ensuring compliance with building codes and standards to facilitate the integration of services into construction projects.

CPC50220.name: Develop workplace policies and procedures for sustainability
CPC50220.desc: This unit focuses on developing and implementing workplace policies and procedures that promote sustainability. It includes identifying areas for improvement, engaging stakeholders, and establishing practices that reduce environmental impact and enhance sustainable operations within the organisation.

CPP51122.name: Manage people performance
CPP51122.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to manage the performance of staff who are direct reports. It includes work allocation, performance planning and review, providing feedback, and managing follow-up. The unit emphasises performance management and development as key responsibilities for effective managers.

CPP51122.name: Provide leadership across the organisation
CPP51122.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to demonstrate senior leadership behaviour, and to lead the organisation and others. It includes influencing groups and individuals, building and supporting teams, and shaping and managing the organisation's culture.

CPP51122.name: Plan and interpret market research
CPP51122.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to plan market research and interpret its findings. It involves defining market research objectives, selecting appropriate data collection methods, analysing data, and reporting on findings to inform business decision-making.

CPP51122.name: Manage business operational plans
CPP51122.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to develop and monitor the implementation of operational plans to support efficient and effective workplace practices and organisational productivity and profitability. It includes developing and managing operational plans, monitoring performance, and reviewing operations to achieve business goals.

CPP51122.name: Manage compliance in the property industry
CPP51122.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to analyse, develop, implement, manage, and evaluate compliance in the property industry. It involves identifying legislative requirements, conducting risk analysis, developing compliance strategies, and monitoring and evaluating compliance systems within a property agency.

CPP51122.name: Establish and monitor property industry trust account management practices
CPP51122.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to establish and monitor trust account management practices in the property industry. It includes implementing legislative requirements, developing policies and procedures, overseeing trust account transactions, and ensuring accurate record-keeping and reporting.

CPP51122.name: Manage ethical practice in the property industry
CPP51122.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to implement and manage ethical practice systems in a property agency. It involves identifying ethical practice requirements, developing and implementing risk control strategies, monitoring ethical practices, and evaluating and improving ethical practice systems.

CPP51122.name: Manage a safe workplace in the property industry
CPP51122.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to manage work health and safety (WHS) policies, procedures, and programs in the property industry. It includes establishing and maintaining WHS systems, ensuring compliance with legislative requirements, and promoting a safe work environment.

CPP51122.name: Manage teams in the property industry
CPP51122.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to manage and evaluate agency teams in the property industry. It involves planning and implementing team activities, monitoring team performance, providing support and feedback, and fostering a positive team environment to achieve organisational goals.

CPP51122.name: Manage operational finances in the property industry
CPP51122.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to manage operational finances within a property agency. It includes budgeting, financial forecasting, monitoring financial performance, and ensuring financial activities comply with legislative and organisational requirements.

CPP51122.name: Develop a strategic business plan in the property industry
CPP51122.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to develop a strategic business plan for a property agency. It involves analysing market opportunities, setting business objectives, formulating strategies, and developing action plans to achieve long-term business success.

CPP51122.name: Manage customer service activities in the property industry
CPP51122.desc: This unit specifies the skills and knowledge required to manage customer service activities in the property industry. It includes developing customer service strategies, managing customer relationships, handling complaints, and implementing improvements to enhance customer satisfaction and loyalty.

BSB50820.name: Manage project scope
BSB50820.desc: This unit focuses on the processes required to ensure a project includes all the work necessary to achieve its objectives. It encompasses defining and managing both the project and product scope, involving the development of a scope management plan, collection of requirements, definition of scope, creation of a Work Breakdown Structure (WBS), and validation and control of scope. Effective scope management ensures that only the work required to complete the project is performed, preventing scope creep and ensuring project success.

BSB50820.name: Manage project time
BSB50820.desc: This unit addresses the skills and knowledge necessary to manage timely completion of a project. It involves determining and implementing the project schedule by identifying and sequencing activities, estimating activity durations, developing and controlling the schedule. Proficiency in this area ensures that project timelines are met, resources are allocated efficiently, and potential delays are identified and mitigated promptly.

BSB50820.name: Manage project quality
BSB50820.desc: This unit pertains to the management of project quality to ensure that project deliverables meet the required standards and stakeholder expectations. It includes planning quality management, managing quality assurance, and controlling quality through systematic measurement, analysis, and improvement of project processes and outputs. Emphasis is placed on continuous improvement and adherence to organisational quality policies and procedures.

BSB50820.name: Manage project cost
BSB50820.desc: This unit involves the processes required to manage project costs to ensure the project is completed within the approved budget. It covers planning cost management, estimating costs, determining the budget, and controlling costs. Effective cost management ensures that project resources are used efficiently, financial risks are mitigated, and the project remains financially viable throughout its lifecycle.

BSB50820.name: Manage project human resources
BSB50820.desc: This unit focuses on the management of human resources within a project context. It includes planning human resource management, acquiring, developing, and managing the project team. Key activities involve defining roles and responsibilities, developing staffing management plans, fostering team development, managing team performance, and resolving conflicts. Effective human resource management ensures that the project team is skilled, motivated, and working collaboratively towards project objectives.

BSB50820.name: Manage project information and communication
BSB50820.desc: This unit focuses on the effective management of project information and communication processes to ensure timely and appropriate generation, collection, dissemination, storage, and disposal of project information. It involves developing a communication management plan, managing project information flow, and ensuring that stakeholders receive relevant and accurate information throughout the project lifecycle. Effective communication management is crucial for aligning stakeholder expectations, facilitating decision-making, and ensuring project success.

BSB50820.name: Manage project risk
BSB50820.desc: This unit addresses the identification, analysis, and management of risks within a project context. It encompasses the development of a risk management plan, risk identification, qualitative and quantitative risk analysis, risk response planning, and monitoring and controlling risks throughout the project. Proficient risk management ensures that potential threats are mitigated, and opportunities are capitalised upon, thereby enhancing the likelihood of project success.

BSB50820.name: Manage project integration
BSB50820.desc: This unit pertains to the coordination of all aspects of a project to ensure its successful completion. It involves developing a project charter, project management plan, directing and managing project work, monitoring and controlling project work, performing integrated change control, and closing the project or phase. Effective integration management ensures that project activities are aligned, resources are utilised efficiently, and project objectives are achieved cohesively.

BSB50820.name: Manage complex projects
BSB50820.desc: This unit focuses on the management of projects that are characterised by high levels of complexity, uncertainty, and ambiguity. It involves applying advanced project management techniques, managing multiple interrelated project components, dealing with a wide range of stakeholders, and navigating complex organisational environments. Proficiency in managing complex projects ensures that project managers can effectively handle challenges and deliver successful outcomes in intricate project scenarios.

BSB50820.name: Manage business resources
BSB50820.desc: This unit involves the efficient and effective management of business resources to achieve organisational objectives. It includes planning resource requirements, acquiring and allocating resources, monitoring and controlling resource usage, and evaluating resource management processes. Effective resource management ensures that physical, human, and financial resources are utilised optimally, contributing to organisational productivity and success.

BSB50820.name: Communicate with influence
BSB50820.desc: This unit focuses on the development and application of communication strategies to influence others and achieve desired outcomes. It encompasses understanding the audience, crafting persuasive messages, utilising appropriate communication channels, and evaluating the effectiveness of communication efforts. Proficient communication with influence is essential for leaders and managers to effectively convey ideas, drive change, and achieve organisational goals.

BSB50820.name: Develop critical thinking in others
BSB50820.desc: This unit involves fostering critical thinking skills in individuals and teams to enhance problem-solving and decision-making capabilities. It includes creating an environment that encourages critical analysis, facilitating learning opportunities, mentoring, and providing feedback to develop others' critical thinking abilities. Developing critical thinking in others contributes to improved innovation, adaptability, and performance within the organisation.

UEE32225.name: Document and apply measures to control WHS risks associated with electrotechnology work
UEE32225.desc: This unit involves identifying, documenting, and applying work health and safety (WHS) and occupational health and safety (OHS) hazard and risk control measures. It includes identifying workplace hazards, assessing risk levels, and implementing control measures to eliminate or mitigate risks in accordance with compliance procedures.

UEE32225.name: Fabricate, assemble and dismantle utilities industry components
UEE32225.desc: This unit outlines the skills and knowledge required to fabricate, assemble, and dismantle utilities industry components using fitting and metal fabrication techniques. It involves interpreting drawings, using hand and power tools safely, and joining components using various methods.

UEE32225.name: Fix and secure electrotechnology equipment
UEE32225.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to fix and secure electrotechnology equipment, including mounting and securing components, enclosures, and equipment to various surfaces using appropriate fasteners and techniques.

UEE32225.name: Solve problems in ELV single path circuits
UEE32225.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to provide solutions to predictable problems in single path circuits operated at extra-low voltage (ELV). It includes working safely, using measurement devices, and applying problem-solving techniques to circuit faults.

UEE32225.name: Use drawings, diagrams, schedules, standards, codes and specifications
UEE32225.desc: This unit involves using drawings, diagrams, cable schedules, industry standards, codes of practice, and specifications in various electrotechnology work functions. It includes interpreting schematic, wiring, and mechanical diagrams.

UEE32225.name: Participate in refrigeration and air conditioning work and competency development activities
UEE32225.desc: This unit is about participating in refrigeration and air conditioning work functions and competency development activities, which includes applying relevant WHS procedures, communicating with others, and seeking assistance when needed.

UEE32225.name: Diagnose and rectify faults in air conditioning and refrigeration control systems
UEE32225.desc: This unit involves diagnosing and rectifying faults in refrigeration and air conditioning control systems, interconnecting circuits, and equipment. It requires applying fault-finding procedures, conducting repairs, and replacing faulty components.

UEE32225.name: Establish the basic operating conditions of air conditioning systems
UEE32225.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to determine the operating conditions of air conditioning systems. It includes measuring air temperature, air flow rates, and relative humidity, and applying calculation methods.

UEE32225.name: Establish the basic operating conditions of vapour compression systems
UEE32225.desc: This unit is about determining the operating conditions of vapour compression systems used for refrigeration or air conditioning. It involves measuring suction and discharge pressures, temperatures, and understanding the principles of the refrigeration cycle.

UEE32225.name: Find and rectify faults in single phase motors and associated controls
UEE32225.desc: This unit covers the skills required to find and rectify faults in single phase motors and their associated controls within refrigeration and air conditioning systems. It includes fault-finding, repair, and testing procedures.

UEE32225.name: Find and rectify faults in three phase motors and associated controls
UEE32225.desc: This unit involves finding and rectifying faults in three phase motors and associated controls. It includes fault diagnosis, repair, and testing of motors used in refrigeration and air conditioning applications.

UEE32225.name: Install refrigerant pipe work, flow controls and accessories
UEE32225.desc: This unit covers installing refrigerant pipe work, flow controls, and accessories for refrigeration and air conditioning systems. It includes routing, placing, and securing pipe work and connecting components according to specifications.

UEE32225.name: Install, commission, service and maintain low temperature systems
UEE32225.desc: This unit involves installing, commissioning, servicing, and maintaining low temperature refrigeration systems, such as freezer rooms and refrigerated cabinets. It includes fault-finding and maintenance procedures specific to low-temperature applications.

UEE32225.name: Install, commission, service and maintain medium temperature systems
UEE32225.desc: This unit covers the installation, commissioning, service, and maintenance of medium temperature refrigeration systems, including cool rooms and refrigerated cabinets. It includes troubleshooting and repair.

UEE32225.name: Prepare and connect refrigerant tubing and fittings
UEE32225.desc: This unit involves preparing and connecting refrigeration and air conditioning piping/tubing and fittings. It includes cutting, bending, and joining copper tubes using techniques like flaring, swaging, and silver brazing.

UEE32225.name: Recover and charge refrigerants
UEE32225.desc: This unit outlines the skills and knowledge required to recover, pressure test, evacuate, and charge refrigerants from refrigeration and air conditioning systems. It includes using appropriate recovery equipment and completing documentation.

UEE32225.name: Safely handle refrigerants and lubricants
UEE32225.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge needed to safely handle refrigerants and lubricants. It includes applying safety procedures, understanding the properties of refrigerants, and using personal protective equipment.

UEE32225.name: Select refrigerant piping, accessories and associated controls
UEE32225.desc: This unit involves selecting the correct refrigerant piping, accessories, and associated controls for specific refrigeration and air conditioning systems based on system requirements and industry standards.

UEE32225.name: Solve problems in low voltage refrigeration and air conditioning circuits
UEE32225.desc: This unit is about solving problems in low voltage (LV) refrigeration and air conditioning circuits. It includes diagnosing faults, using testing devices, and applying logical fault-finding procedures.

UEE32225.name: Verify functionality and compliance of refrigeration and air conditioning installations
UEE32225.desc: This unit involves verifying that refrigeration and air conditioning installations are functional and compliant with relevant regulations, codes, and standards. It includes conducting tests and inspections.

UEE32225.name: Apply environmentally and sustainable procedures in the energy sector
UEE32225.desc: This unit covers applying environmentally sustainable procedures in the energy sector, which includes identifying and implementing practices to minimise environmental impact and reduce waste.

UEE32225.name: Attach cords and plugs to electrical equipment for connection to a single phase 230 Volt supply
UEE32225.desc: This unit outlines the skills to attach cords and plugs to electrical equipment that will be connected to a single phase 230 Volt supply, ensuring it is done safely and correctly.

UEE32225.name: Attach cords, cables and plugs to electrical equipment for connection to 1000 V a.c. or 1500 V d.c.
UEE32225.desc: This unit is about attaching cords, cables, and plugs to electrical equipment for connection to high voltage systems, requiring knowledge of specific safety protocols and connection methods.

UEE32225.name: Disconnect - reconnect electrical equipment connected to low voltage (LV) installation wiring
UEE32225.desc: This unit covers the skills required to safely disconnect and reconnect electrical equipment from low voltage (LV) installation wiring, in accordance with legislative and safety requirements.

UEE32225.name: Locate and rectify faults in low voltage (LV) electrical equipment using set procedures
UEE32225.desc: This unit involves locating and rectifying faults in low voltage (LV) electrical equipment by following set procedures. It includes using testing devices and applying a systematic approach to fault finding.

UEE32225.name: Deliver a service to customers
UEE32225.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to deliver aspects of customer service at an introductory level. It includes creating a relationship with customers, identifying their needs, delivering services or products, and processing customer feedback.

UEE32225.name: Operate application software packages
UEE32225.desc: This unit outlines the skills and knowledge required to identify, select, and operate commercial software packages, including a word-processing and a spreadsheet application. It applies to individuals who use different software applications in an office environment to produce documents.

UEE32225.name: Source and purchase material/parts for installation or service jobs
UEE32225.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to source and purchase or order materials and parts for installation or service jobs. It includes determining job specifications, using manufacturer catalogues, making purchasing inquiries, and completing relevant purchasing documentation.

UEE32225.name: Maintain documentation
UEE32225.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to maintain and prepare documentation for work activities, purchases, and expenses. It includes planning and maintaining documentation typically required in an electrotechnology workplace information system.

UEE32225.name: Perform rescue from a live LV panel
UEE32225.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge to perform rescue from a live Low Voltage (LV) panel. It includes assessing the situation, making the area safe, removing the victim from the live panel, and providing first aid until emergency services arrive.

AUR31120.name: Follow environmental and sustainability best practice in an automotive workplace
AUR31120.desc: This unit outlines the skills and knowledge required to follow environmental and sustainability best practices in an automotive workplace. It involves complying with workplace procedures, environmental regulations, and implementing sustainability practices to minimise the environmental impact of work activities. The unit applies to individuals working in the automotive industry, ensuring they contribute to reducing waste, conserving resources, and adhering to legal and organisational environmental requirements.

AUR31120.name: Communicate effectively in an automotive workplace
AUR31120.desc: This unit focuses on developing effective communication skills for use in an automotive workplace. It covers verbal, written, and non-verbal communication techniques, as well as the ability to follow instructions, provide feedback, and work collaboratively with colleagues. Effective communication is crucial for ensuring safety, efficiency, and teamwork in automotive environments.

AUR31120.name: Follow safe working practices in an automotive workplace
AUR31120.desc: This unit focuses on developing the skills and knowledge required to follow safe working practices in an automotive workplace. It covers identifying workplace hazards, using personal protective equipment (PPE), and adhering to safety procedures to prevent accidents and injuries. The unit is essential for ensuring a safe working environment and is applicable to individuals across various roles in the automotive industry.

AUR31120.name: Solder electrical wiring and circuits
AUR31120.desc: This unit describes the performance outcomes required to solder electrical wiring and circuits in an automotive context. It includes selecting appropriate tools and materials, preparing components, and performing soldering tasks to ensure secure and reliable electrical connections. The unit is critical for automotive electricians and technicians, ensuring they can perform soldering tasks safely and effectively.

AUR31120.name: Test and repair basic electrical circuits
AUR31120.desc: This unit provides the skills and knowledge needed to test and repair basic electrical circuits in automotive systems. It involves using diagnostic tools, interpreting circuit diagrams, and repairing faults to restore functionality. The unit is essential for automotive electricians and technicians, ensuring they can maintain and repair electrical systems in vehicles.

AUR31120.name: Diagnose and repair vehicle dynamic control systems
AUR31120.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to diagnose and repair faults in vehicle dynamic control systems, such as electronic stability control (ESC) and anti-lock braking systems (ABS). It involves preparing for the task, selecting appropriate diagnostic procedures, identifying faults, performing repairs, and completing post-repair testing and documentation. The unit is essential for automotive technicians working on modern vehicles equipped with advanced safety and control systems.

AUR31120.name: Diagnose and repair compression ignition engine management systems
AUR31120.desc: This unit outlines the skills and knowledge required to diagnose and repair faults in compression ignition (diesel) engine management systems. It covers preparing for the task, selecting diagnostic procedures, identifying faults, performing repairs, and completing post-repair testing and documentation. The unit is critical for technicians working on diesel-powered vehicles, vessels, or machinery, ensuring they can maintain and repair complex engine management systems.

AUR31120.name: Test charge and replace batteries and jump-start vehicles
AUR31120.desc: This unit focuses on the skills and knowledge required to test, charge, and replace vehicle batteries, as well as jump-start vehicles. It includes preparing for the task, using appropriate tools and equipment, performing battery testing and charging, replacing batteries, and safely jump-starting vehicles.

AUR31120.name: Diagnose and repair charging systems
AUR31120.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to diagnose and repair faults in vehicle charging systems, including alternators and related components. It involves preparing for the task, selecting diagnostic procedures, identifying faults, performing repairs, and completing post-repair testing and documentation. The unit is critical for automotive electricians and technicians, ensuring they can maintain and repair charging systems effectively.

AUR31120.name: Diagnose and repair starting systems
AUR31120.desc: This unit outlines the skills and knowledge required to diagnose and repair faults in vehicle starting systems, including starters and related components. It covers preparing for the task, selecting diagnostic procedures, identifying faults, performing repairs, and completing post-repair testing and documentation. The unit is essential for automotive technicians, ensuring they can maintain and repair starting systems effectively.

AUR31120.name: Diagnose and repair automotive electrical systems
AUR31120.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to diagnose and repair automotive electrical systems. It involves preparing for the task, sourcing a diagnostic testing strategy, diagnosing the cause of the fault, carrying out the repair, performing post-repair testing, and completing workplace processes and documentation. The unit applies to electrical systems in various automotive contexts, including wiring, lighting, and electronic components. It requires the use of diagnostic equipment, tools, and materials appropriate for automotive electrical repairs.

AUR31120.name: Apply knowledge of petrol and diesel engine operation
AUR31120.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to understand and apply the principles of petrol and diesel engine operation. It includes identifying engine components, understanding their functions, and explaining the operational principles of internal combustion engines. The unit is essential for diagnosing and repairing engine-related issues and ensuring efficient engine performance. It applies to both petrol and diesel engines in automotive and heavy vehicle contexts.

AUR31120.name: Diagnose and repair heavy vehicle air braking systems
AUR31120.desc: This unit focuses on diagnosing and repairing air braking systems in heavy vehicles. It involves identifying faults, testing system components, and performing repairs to ensure the braking system operates safely and efficiently. The unit requires knowledge of air braking system components, their functions, and the procedures for diagnosing and repairing faults. It applies to heavy vehicles such as trucks, buses, and trailers.

AUR31120.name: Diagnose and repair heavy vehicle steering systems
AUR31120.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to diagnose and repair steering systems in heavy vehicles. It includes identifying steering system components, diagnosing faults, and performing repairs to ensure safe and efficient steering operation. The unit covers both manual and power steering systems and applies to heavy vehicles such as trucks and buses. It requires the use of appropriate tools and equipment for steering system repairs.

AUR31120.name: Diagnose and repair heavy vehicle suspension systems
AUR31120.desc: This unit covers the diagnosis and repair of suspension systems in heavy vehicles. It involves identifying suspension system components, diagnosing faults, and performing repairs to ensure safe and efficient vehicle operation. The unit applies to heavy vehicles such as trucks and buses and requires knowledge of suspension system types, components, and repair procedures. It also involves the use of appropriate tools and equipment for suspension system repairs.

AUR31120.name: Diagnose and repair heavy vehicle compression ignition engines
AUR31120.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to diagnose and repair faults in the compression ignition engines of heavy vehicles. It involves preparing for the task, sourcing a diagnostic testing strategy, diagnosing the cause of the fault, carrying out the repair, performing post-repair testing, and completing workplace processes and documentation. The unit applies to those working in the automotive service and repair industry, including heavy commercial vehicles, agricultural machinery, mobile plant machinery, and marine vessels. It requires the use of diagnostic equipment, tools, and materials specific to compression ignition engines.

AUR31120.name: Diagnose and repair heavy vehicle drive shafts
AUR31120.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to diagnose and repair drive shafts in heavy vehicles. It involves identifying faults, testing components, and performing repairs to ensure the drive shaft system operates safely and efficiently. The unit applies to heavy vehicles such as trucks, buses, and trailers. It requires knowledge of drive shaft components, their functions, and the procedures for diagnosing and repairing faults. The unit also involves the use of appropriate tools and equipment for drive shaft repairs.

AUR31120.name: Diagnose and repair heavy vehicle automatic transmissions
AUR31120.desc: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to diagnose and repair automatic transmissions in heavy vehicles. It involves preparing for the task, sourcing a diagnostic testing strategy, diagnosing the cause of the fault, carrying out the repair, performing post-repair testing, and completing workplace processes and documentation. The unit applies to heavy vehicles such as trucks and buses. It requires knowledge of automatic transmission components, their functions, and the procedures for diagnosing and repairing faults. The unit also involves the use of diagnostic equipment, tools, and materials specific to automatic transmissions.

AUR31120.name: Diagnose and repair heavy vehicle emission control systems
AUR31120.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to diagnose and repair emission control systems in heavy vehicles. It involves identifying faults, testing system components, and performing repairs to ensure the emission control system operates efficiently and complies with environmental regulations. The unit applies to heavy vehicles such as trucks and buses. It requires knowledge of emission control system components, their functions, and the procedures for diagnosing and repairing faults. The unit also involves the use of appropriate tools and equipment for emission control system repairs.

AUR31120.name: Inspect and service hydraulic systems
AUR31120.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to inspect and service hydraulic systems in vehicles or machinery. It includes preparing for the task, inspecting the system for leaks or damage, testing system operation, replacing or repairing faulty components, and completing workplace processes and documentation.

AUR31120.name: Carry out servicing operations
AUR31120.desc: This unit covers the competencies required to perform routine servicing operations on vehicles or machinery. It encompasses preparing for the task, conducting inspections, replacing fluids and filters, checking and adjusting components, resetting service indicators, and finalising workplace processes and documentation.

AUR31120.name: Diagnose and repair hydraulic systems
AUR31120.desc: This unit focuses on diagnosing and repairing faults in hydraulic systems of vehicles or machinery. It involves preparing for the task, applying diagnostic procedures to identify faults, repairing or replacing defective components, testing the system for correct operation, and completing required workplace processes and documentation.

AUR31120.name: Develop and carry out diagnostic test strategies
AUR31120.desc: This unit involves developing and implementing diagnostic test strategies to identify faults in complex systems of vehicles or machinery. It includes researching and selecting appropriate diagnostic procedures, planning and conducting tests, analysing results to pinpoint issues, rectifying identified faults, and completing necessary workplace documentation.

AUR31120.name: Inspect and service braking systems
AUR31120.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to inspect and service braking systems in vehicles. It involves preparing for the task, inspecting braking components for wear or damage, testing system functionality, servicing or replacing components as needed, and finalising workplace processes and documentation.

AUR31120.name: Diagnose and repair cooling systems
AUR31120.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to diagnose and repair cooling systems in vehicles or machinery. It includes preparing for the task, identifying and testing cooling system components, analysing faults, repairing or replacing defective parts, and completing workplace processes and documentation.

AUR31120.name: Inspect and service engines
AUR31120.desc: This unit covers the competencies required to inspect and service engines in vehicles or machinery. It encompasses preparing for the task, conducting engine inspections, performing necessary servicing operations, testing engine performance, and finalising workplace processes and documentation.

AUR31120.name: Inspect and service diesel fuel injection systems
AUR31120.desc: This unit focuses on inspecting and servicing diesel fuel injection systems in vehicles or machinery. It involves preparing for the task, examining fuel injection components for wear or damage, performing servicing procedures, testing system functionality, and completing required workplace processes and documentation.

AUR31120.name: Diagnose and repair engine forced-induction systems
AUR31120.desc: This unit involves diagnosing and repairing engine forced-induction systems, such as turbochargers and superchargers, in vehicles or machinery. It includes preparing for the task, applying diagnostic procedures to identify faults, repairing or replacing defective components, testing system performance, and completing necessary workplace documentation.

AUR31120.name: Use and maintain measuring equipment in an automotive workplace
AUR31120.desc: This unit covers the skills and knowledge required to use and maintain measuring equipment in an automotive workplace. It involves selecting appropriate measuring devices, accurately measuring components or systems, maintaining and calibrating equipment as per manufacturer specifications, and adhering to workplace procedures and safety requirements.

AUR31120.name: Use and maintain tools and equipment in an automotive workplace
AUR31120.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to select, use, and maintain tools and equipment in an automotive workplace. It includes identifying the appropriate tools and equipment for specific tasks, operating them according to manufacturer specifications and workplace procedures, performing routine maintenance to ensure their serviceability, and adhering to safety and environmental regulations.

AUR31120.name: Inspect and service final drive assemblies
AUR31120.desc: This unit covers the competencies required to inspect and service final drive assemblies in vehicles. It encompasses preparing for the task, conducting inspections to identify wear or damage, performing servicing operations such as adjusting or replacing components, testing the assembly for correct operation, and completing workplace processes and documentation.

AUR31120.name: Inspect and service manual transmissions
AUR31120.desc: This unit focuses on inspecting and servicing manual transmissions in vehicles. It involves preparing for the task, examining transmission components for signs of wear or damage, performing necessary servicing operations such as replacing fluids or worn parts, testing the transmission for proper functionality, and finalising workplace processes and documentation.

AUR31120.name: Inspect and service automatic transmissions
AUR31120.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to inspect and service automatic transmissions in vehicles. It includes preparing for the task, inspecting transmission components for wear or damage, conducting servicing operations such as fluid replacement or filter changes, testing the transmission to ensure correct operation, and completing required workplace documentation.

AUR31120.name: Carry out oxyacetylene welding thermal heating and cutting
AUR31120.desc: This unit covers the competencies required to perform oxyacetylene welding, thermal heating, and cutting in an automotive context. It encompasses preparing for the task by selecting appropriate equipment and materials, setting up and operating oxyacetylene equipment safely, performing welding, heating, and cutting operations as per specifications, and adhering to workplace safety and environmental procedures.

AUR31120.name: Carry out manual metal arc welding on components
AUR31120.desc: This unit involves the skills and knowledge required to perform manual metal arc welding (MMAW) on automotive components. It includes preparing for the task by selecting suitable welding equipment and consumables, setting up and operating MMAW equipment safely, performing welding operations to join or repair metal components according to specifications, and following workplace safety and environmental guidelines.
